loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua. El  Sr.Oscar Antonio  G. B. , se dedica  arduamente a laborar como supervisor, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace diez años, es casado y con dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Oscar atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloque, y arena, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el cambio de una pared de su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en mal estado. 
Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio G. B. has worked as a supervisor in the city of Managua for ten years.  He is married and has two children for whom he wants to provide everything necessary for their proper development.

One of the needs Mr. Oscar is currently facing is home improvement due to the state of disrepair of his house.  He has decided to take on the task of home improvement and requested a loan through CEPRODEL to buy construction materials such as blocks and sand.  He plans to change a wall which is badly damaged.

With this endeavor he hopes to improve his children's living conditions.  It is important to point out that with this project he will be giving his family a decent roof over their head and the environment needed for his children's development.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as blocks and sand

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr: Née le 02 Octobre 1976 à Bopa au Mono (Bénin), Marie Thérèse vit depuis quinze ans à Sodjéatinmé, un quartier de Cotonou. Marie Thérèse est mariée à Richard, un menuisier, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Marie Thérèse a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis dix ans environ et qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Marie Thérèse vend des tissus dans son atelier. Marie Thérèse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Marie Thérèse sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'avenir, Marie Thérèse désire élargir davantage le niveau de son activité.
texts.en: Marie Therese was born on October 2, 1976 in Bopa au Mono, Benin. She has lived for 15 years now in Sodjéatinmé, in the Cotonou neighborhood. Marie Therese is married to Richard, a carpenter and they have three children who are in school. The couple is responsible for all the various household expenses.  Marie Therese has very little formal education, but learned to sew, a skill she has been passionate about for 10 years and enables her to help with the family expenses.  On the side, Marie Therese also sells fabric from her workshop. She purchases her products in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. With the goal to satisfy her clients' demands, she is requesting a loan from Alidé for the sixth time. All of her previous loans were properly reimbursed. In the future, Marie Therese hopes to expands her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: Pizaras

texts.en:
C. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 55 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, C. runs a business venture in the retail sector selling dried fish in the local community. 

C. has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. C. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. 

C. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, with which she will purchase more different kinds of dried fish. This loan will be the second loan taken out by C. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of dried fish to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias sells beans.  She is 35 years old and divorced with 3 children.  One of them goes to school.

Lilias borrowed a loan to stock more beans to sell. She hopes to build a shop in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Manuel Antonio se conoce por ser un buen trabajador con bueno valores morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido llevar el progreso a su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. 

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Manuel Antonio a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro y pago de mano de obra esto será utilizado para hacer ampliación de su hogar y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is from the city of Managua.  He is well-known as a hard-working person with good moral values.  He has known how to have his household progress, and he has managed to give his family better living conditions.

Manuel Antiono requested a loan from Ceprodal to improve the condition of his home.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials like blocks, sand, cement, gravel, and iron.  He will also use the loan to pay for labor.  He will use these materials to expand his house in order to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz En Dios Group

texts.en:
Candida is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Paz en Dios - "Love and Peace in God". She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most important challenges are to work hard in her business and to improve it. Her dreams are to have a supermarket and to give to her family a better life.

Candida is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 6 years, starting with a grocery stall in her house. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally, these colmados are in the same neighborhood as homes, or short walking distances from any home. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to proviD. certain necessities. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she was searching for loans to start doing business. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is free trading zone, a cement factory, and others.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned meal, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su familia, sus hijos y su esposo, todos trabajan, ella junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura y ganadería, el trabajo es propio, sus hijos también ayudan a atender las labores que demanda, como familia todos se apoyan para que el negocio marche bien.
Actualmente quiere comprar cerdos para engorD., por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita comprarlos y atender este nuevo sector D. comercio, aumentar sus ganancias.
El propósito D. Blanca es tener una fuente D. ingresos segura, que su negocio con los cerdos le genere lo planeado y D. esta manera garantizar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her children and husband.  Everyone works.  Blanca works with her husband in his farming and ranching business.  Their children also help with the labor.  As a family everyone helps out so that the business runs smoothly.  Currently she wants buy pigs to fatten.  With the loan she is requesting she will purchase the pigs and attend to this new business venture to increase her earnings.  Blanca's aim is to have a reliable source of income generated by her pig business and thereby, ensure better financial stability.

loans.use: purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.en:
Najmiddin is a hardworking man. He is married and the responsible father of two children. His wife is not working. 

For more than three years Najmiddin has been running a public transportation service. He has his own car, a “Gazelle,” that he drives through Isfara city. The profit that he makes from this business he spends to provide for his family’s needs. 

In addition to his transportation business he also processes dried fruits. Najmiddin would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing of new car in order to expand his business and make a good profit. 

This loan will be his second loan from IMON International and he has a good credit history.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an additional car

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 67 años de edad, ella es casada, y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en  el distrito de Tambogrande. Rosa vive en una zona rural de este distrito. Y no cuenta aún con servicio básicos.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 4 años, además cuenta con  0.68 has de terreno agrícola sembrados de mango y limón que son herencia de sus padres, los cuales ella aprovecha, para poder trabajarlos

Rosa esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y aves con la finalidad de lograr un  mejor tamaño y peso en menos tiempo y así rotar más rápido sus animales

Rosa es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde trabaja y en donde vive las personas que la conocen la consideran un persona tranquila y bastante trabajadora.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old, married, and does not have any children. She lives in her own house in the hamlet of Pueblo Libre, in Tambogrande district. Rosa lives in a rural zone of this district and does not have even basic services.

Rosa raises sheep and poultry. Once they have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market. She has been doing this work for four years. She also works 0.68 hectares of farmland that she has planted with mangoes and lemons, which she inherited from her parents.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will buy a balanced diet to fatten her sheep and birds so that they will reach a good size in less time, so that she can turn over her animals more quickly.

Rosa is rather well-known and esteemed by those who live in the area where she lives and works. People who know her consider her to be a calm and hard-working woman.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet to fatten her sheep and birds so that they reach a better size

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, es originaria de una localidad rica en cultura ya que muy cerca de ahí se encuentra localizada la zona arqueológica un lugar mágico lleno de energía positiva, ella tiene 47 años de edad y estudio hasta el segundo año de primaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas y no le alcanzaba para sus útiles que ocupaba en la escuela. Doña Cristina está pidiendo un préstamo a Financiera para la compra de leña, maíz, gas, cal, etc., ella se dedica a vender tortillas hechas a mano y a la venta de masa en su casa desde hace dos años y medio y comenta que empezó con este negocio para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y para pagar los gastos de la casa. Cristina es Viuda y tiene 3 hijos estudiantes de primaria. La meta que tiene en mente es poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ya que cerca de ahí no hay y mas adelante vender ropa y zapatos de segunda mano.
texts.en: Cristina is from a place that is rich in culture and very close to a magical archeological area full of positive energy. She is 47 years old and went to school until the second grade. She didn't continue with her schooling because she helped her parents work and there wasn't enough money for her school supplies. Cristina is asking for a loan to buy firewood, corn, gas, lime, etc. She sells handmade tortillas and tortilla dough in her house. She has done this for two years and tells us that she started this business to get her young children ahead and to pay the household expenses. Cristina is a widow and has 3 children in elementary school. The goal she has in mind is to open a small grocery store in her house since there isn't one nearby. IN the future, she wants to sell second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to sell handmade tortillas.

loans.name: Darwin Fernando

texts.es:
El sr. Darwin es una persona trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante y desea darle a su familia una vida comoda, Darwin tiene un merendero, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la atencion de sus clientes.
su merendero esta ubicado en el barrio el centro de la ciudad  de Choluteca.
El credito lo invertira en compra de alimentos para la preparacion de sus sabrosas comidas.
Los planes de Darwin a corto plazo es remodelar su negocio, hacerlo un poco mas grande ya que el negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada y cada dia que pasa atiende mas personas.
nos comento sentirse muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
texts.en:
Sr. Darwin is a hardworking individual who desires to move forward and provide his family a comfortable life. He manages an outdoor restaurant with the help of his wife, who is in charge of looking after their customers. Their outdoor restaurant is located in a central neighborhood in the city of Choluteca.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of food for preparing delicious dishes. Darwin’s short-term plans are to remodel his business and to make it a little bit bigger because it is located in a high-traffic area where many people pass by each day. He says that he is very happy because everything is going well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing delicious dishes.

loans.name: Lesly Karen

texts.es: La Srta. Lesly es soltera, ella es una joven trabajadora, luchadora con deseo de superación;  se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y golosinas; ella comenzó en este negocio con su madre y ahora ella misma es quien vela por dicho negocio, eligió este trabajo ya que por su zona donde vive nadie brinda esta venta, la joven Lesly viene laborando en este negocio por mas de 2 años, gana aproximadamente S/ 175 soles semanales. El credito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su negocio (compra de andamios y vitrinas ) ya que ha decidio comprar nuevos productos para aperturar una tienda surtida. Su principal sueño de Lesly es tener su casa propia construida en su totalidad y su meta es llegar a tener en su Distrito donde vive un minimarket. Ella esta muy agradecida por el credito que se le ha otorgado ya que va a poder mejorar su negocio y asi percibir mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Señorita Lesly is single, and is a hard-working young women who strives with the desire to succeed.  She works selling soda and candy; she started this business with her mother, and now she is the one who oversees the business.  She chose this line of work because nobody is providing this service in the area where she lives.  The young lady Lesly has been working in this business for over two years, and she earns approximately 175 Soles a week.

The loan on offer will be invested by her in growing her business (buying shelves and counters), as she has decided to buy new products to open a fully-stocked store.

Lesly's main dream is to have own home which is fully built, and her goal is to be able to have a minimarket in her District.  She is very grateful for the loan which is being offered to her, as she will be able to improve her business and so earn more profits.

loans.use: to improve her business (purchase of counters and shelves)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 37 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Raúl de 38 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Frank de 12 años y Fiorella de 09 años de edad, quienes son  el impulso  de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Virginia  y su pareja, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café, achiote y hojas de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le ayudan en las extracción y transporte de sus productos cosechados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco lugar donde los vende y recibe buenos pagos por sus productos. Para el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su segundo crédito y se siente muy contenta de saber que contará una vez mas con el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de seguir prosperando y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de cacao, con lo cual espera aumentar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
37-year-old Virginia is originally from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is a sociable and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 38-year-old Raúl, and her two beloved children: 12-year-old Frank and 9-year-old Fiorella, who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

The produce which Virginia and her partner have managed to grow through their hard work and determination have helped them a lot in making progress in life.  Every morning, Virginia starts working on her land as she knows that the quality of her produce depends on the care she provides to her cacao, coffee, annatto and coca leaf crops.  During harvest seasons she needs the support of laborers who help her to pick and transport her harvested crops.  What she most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them grow big.  She has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her harvested crops to the storage warehouses in the town of San Francisco where she sells them and receives a good price for them.  In the future, she would like to buy more land.

This will be Virginia's second loan and she feels very happy to know that she will once more have your support as this makes her certain that she will continue to do well in her business.  For her part, she is prepared to make her repayments punctually, according to the repayment schedule.  Virginia will use the 2,500 soles she has requested to buy more cacao seeds with which she hopes to increase her future harvests.

loans.use: to buy more cacao seeds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has been able to repay her loan ahead of schedule and she is taking up another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Oscar Osmar

texts.es:
Oscar, es agricultor, está soltero, vive con sus padres, él lleva muchos años dedicándose a sembrar maíz, actividad que ha aprendido al lado de su padre, este oficio le agrada mucho a Oscar, ya que lleva varios procesos que por su experiencia los maneja a perfección.
Actualmente necesita compara abono y semilla mejorada para iniciar el proceso de siembra en frijol y maíz, esta compra de materiales serán un gran apoyo para Oscar.
Su sueño es algún día formar su propio hogar, construir su casa.
texts.en:
Oscar is a farmer. He is single and he lives with his parents. He has been growing corn for several years. He learned to do this from his father. This trade makes Oscar very happy. Due to his experience, he is able to do many farm processes perfectly.
Now he needs to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to start the process of planting beans and corn. The purchase of these materials will be a great help for Oscar. 
His dream is to one day have his own home and build a house.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and seeds in order to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman with three school-going children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. Gladys has operated a cafe for the past three years; in addition she also practices farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and the local company workers. The major challenge she faces is competition from other cafe operators. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Mutuo

texts.en:
Mutuo is married and blessed with three children. For the past four years, she has been running a grocery business to earn a living. Mutuo is also a farmer. Her potential customers are people in her local community and she employs two people to assist her in her business. 

Mutuo is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables to sell. Thanks to Falulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt a culture of saving. Mutuo hopes to establish a wholesale business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Tumenbayar is a 43-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has higher education in both accounting and nutrition technology. Her younger daughter attends the Royal academy in Mongolia, while her elder daughter helps her to operate the business.   

Regardless of her profession, she had six years of experience in her own grocery and home furnishing store, until she went to South Korea for a higher paying job for five years. After she came back from S. Korea in 2010, she continued her small grocery store business. 

Tumenbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store. Her goal is to improve her business in order to increase her working capital and expand her business as well.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the grocery store

loans.name: Wafaa'

texts.en:
Wafaa' is a 29-year-old young woman and she is married with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary.

Wafaa' has a project of raising poultry. She wants to purchase a huge amount of fodder to feed the poultry, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Wafaa' gets the loan, she will purchase the amount of fodder she needs to feed the poultry. This will increase her product and she will benefit from selling them to increase the family's income and to live in better conditions. Wafaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for poultry

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a cotton scarf weaver. She does not have her own loom but  is hired for a fee to weave scarves. She lives in a village along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sina is in the process of building a new house but lacks some money to finish building it. She has decided to ask for a loan of $1,200 to finish this project.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella has two kids who she is sending to school. She is 35 years old and married. She runs a glassware and kitchenware business in the public market. To further support the needs of their children, Shella’s husband engages in the buying and selling of cars.

Shella needs additional working capital to maintain and continue operating her business. She chooses the ASKI organization for a loan because she knows they care for their clients. Shella is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional kitchenware and glassware to sell to her customers in the market. She wishes to continue growing her business to give a better way of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and glassware to sell to her customers in the market.

loans.name: Alison

texts.es: Alison es auxiliar en enfermería y además trabaja en una imprenta. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como papel, placas, películas, etc. para la imprenta. Alison   es soltera y tiene un hijo; su esposo está trabajando en el extrior y colabora enviando dinero para solventar a los hijos. Alisonvive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y también la primera vez que solicita un crédito de una entidad financiera.
texts.en: Alison is a nursing assistant and also works in a print shop.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like paper, plates, film, etc. for the print shop.  Alison is single and has a son.  Her husband is working abroad and helps out sending money to help support the children.  Alison lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Nueva Potosí zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with Kiva and also the first time she’s requested a loan from a financial institution.

loans.use: to buy paper, plates and film for her print shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil actual casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 4 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arrendar terrenos.
El sueño es comprarse una casa grande. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en la producción.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, 34, is married and has four children; she lives with her husband and children who are 14, 12, 7 and 4 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

María is a corn and rice farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and manure.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease land.  Her dream is to be able to buy a big house.  She’s faced no problems with production and in her free time she likes to go out on family outings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Joseph, who was born in the outskirts of Kitale, Kenya, and is said to have entered the world smiling. Life for Joseph and others in his rural farming village was challenging, requiring families to rely on ingenuity and perseverance in the face of few resources.He has a side hustle business(motorbike business). Joseph lives together with his wife, to whom he has been married for over 18 years! His marriage has been blessed with three children. Joseph has been doing mixed-farming for over ten years. He considers himself to be more passionate and hardworking than other farmers. He also leaves nothing to chance when carrying out his duties. Joseph is seeking a KES 50,000 loan to purchase farm equipment. Acquisition of these assets is aligned to his plan of growing his agribusiness to the next level. On his farm, he grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. He also keeps poultry. For the past few years, his biggest challenge has been the tools used on the farm. They are outdated and worn out, to say the least. As a result, farm work has become strenuous and time consuming. He spends more resources on labor, since working with these tools requires a lot of effort, yet the quality of work keeps deteriorating. Joseph is going to use this loan to purchase modern farm equipment that will bring effectiveness and efficiency to his farm work. New improved tools will not only save him on labor costs, but will also improve the quality of the work. With your loan, he will grow his business to greater heights and elevate his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
People in the village want to scholastic materials for school going children, reams of paper, textbooks, pens, pencils, and mathmatical sets. Mathematical sets include Compasses, protractor, and rulers for technical drawers.

Every parent must buy these supplies, they are a requirement for each child in addition to school fees. People will bring their goats to the cattle market, sell them and then get money for the school supplies.

Irene O. has knowledge in Secretarial work. She is a well-trained person.

She is married to Pastor Abraham O.. They have never been funded by VEF but still they are struggling to do their work with low income and capital.

This family is well known and I believe that they are able to handle the loan very well.

They are doing their work in Soroti town and serving the many business people there with secretarial services.

Given 500 US Dollars, they will expand their business very much such that most people in the community will benefit from their services.

loans.use: Buy Stationary and other office supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is mother of 5 kids; they are currently 16, 18, 10, 21, 22, and 24 years old. Several years ago, she went through a divorce and become the only provider of the house. This is why she started selling fried food at her house, and later started to sell tamales. With this activity, she has been able to proviD. for her home and give to their kids what they need. In spite of the difficult times she’s had to go through, she’s been able to get ahead thanks to her love for her kids and her great sense of responsibility.

At this time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$200 to buy supplies needed to make her products, so she can increase her sales. Don’t hesitate any longer, Gloria needs support and generosity. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [GabrieL. Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es madre D. 5 hijos, quienes tienen actualmente 16, 18, 10, 21, 22 y 24 años D. edad. Hace muchos años que elL. sufrió un divorcio, quedando soL. al frente del hogar, por ello decidió comenzar a vender frituras en su domicilio y tiempo después inició con L. venta D. tamales. Con esta actividad ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa y brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario. A pesar D. los difíciles momentos que ha tenido que enfrentar, por el amor a sus hijos y su amplio sentido D. L. responsabilidad ha logrado salir adelante.

En este momento elL. requiere D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 200 DLLS, para poder comprar insumos que requiere para L. elaboración D. sus productos y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas. No lo dudes más, Gloria necesita D. apoyo y generosidad, elL. y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mama Ayeetey sells mats woven from grass through her business, Ayee's Mat. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods for retail sale

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina L. C. is 25 years old and weaves the traditional Mayan top known as a huipil, and also raises lambs to sell. But with this loan she'll purchase a calf to raise and use for milk production. The rich green hills in her remote village are tremendously fertile and beautiful in this current rainy season, and the women take advantage of all the greenery by pasturing and raising sheep and other livestock.

Catarina has four children, from two to eight years old. She's a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to raise for milk production

loans.name: Luder

texts.en:
Business Description

Luder started this business 5 years ago. He sells dog food and poultry feed. He serves his clients daily from 8 AM to 8 PM

Loan Use

Luder needs this loan to invest in live poultry, poultry feed and other veterinary science products. This way he will be able to offer healthy chicks to his clients who raise poultry.

Personal Information

Luder is 33 years old and has 2 minor children, one of whom attends school. His wife is employeed at a mattress store. Luder started his business by borrowing from a private lender. He and his family live in his parents' home. He needs this loan to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Luder inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que ofrece son: Alimentos para aves y perros. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a.m.-a -8pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Luder necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos, balanceados y otros productos veterinarios. De esta manera ofrecer los pollitos completamente sanos a sus clientes que se dedican a la cría de aves de corral.

Información Personal

Luder tiene 33 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores 1 esta estudiando .Su esposa trabaja como empleada en un almacén de colchones. Luder inicio con un capital solicitado a un prestamista. Vive en la casa de sus padres .Por lo que necesita del crédito para poder mejorar y acondicionar de mejor manera su local.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and other veterinary science products

loans.name: Nery Veronica

texts.es:
Señora M. began her business by selling fruits and vegetables in a traveling fashion with the goal of supporting her four children. However, this wasn't enough to cover the expenses of their home, and she decided to take on the risk of starting a fixed business in the Israel Lewites market. This is how Nery started to work with CEPRODEL, and thanks to the financing she obtained from them, she was able to buy a location where she offers a little bit of everything to her clients.

Her traveling business started ten years ago with $40 in capital with little merchandise and few products. Although the infrastructural conditions now aren't the greatest, she has still been able to progress. Her business is covered with plastic for protection from the sun, and even though she hasn't been able to put a decent roof on her location, this isn't an obstacle for her in her progress.

She started working with CEPRODEL in 2005, and her first credit was 3,000 cordobas. Little by little, her line of credit has increased thanks to her credit record. For Nery, working with CEPRODEL has been an incredible help, and she is very thankful for the support that has been offered to her by being a part of this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora M., comienza su negocio de manera ambulante vendiendo verduras y frutas con el fin de darle sustento a sus cuatro hijos. Sin embargo esto no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos necesarios en su hogar y decide arriesgarse a poner un negocio de manera fija en un local en el mercado Israel Lewites. Es asi como Nery comienza a trabajar con CEPRODEL y gracias al financiamiento logro comprar un local en donde brinda de todo un poco a los clientes.

Su negocio ambulante lo empieza desde hace diez años con un capital de US$ 40.00 y con poca mercaderia y productos, sin embargo ahora aunque las condiciones infraestructural no es la mejor ella ha logrado progresar. Su negocio esta cubierto por plasticos para proteccion del sol ya que aun no ha logrado poner un techo digno en su local; esto no es impedimento para ella en su progreso.

Ella comenzo trabajando con CEPRODEL desde el 2005, su primer credito fue de CS3,000.00 (cordobas), y poco a poco su linea de credito ha ido aumentando gracias a su record crediticio. Para Nery el trabajar con CEPRODEL ha sido una ayuda increible y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado por parte de la Institucion.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: I live in a midsize metropolis, Multan, in Pakistan. I am married with four children. We live in a small rented brick house here in Multan. I have enrolled all of my children to school except the youngest, who will attend school sometime in the near future. My husband is the only breadwinner of the entire family. He is responsible for every household expense and pays for the children's school charges. He owns a grocery store. Now he plans to increase his income through expanding his shop. Please lend him $325. This loan will help him to have more customers flock to his shop.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

loans.name: Aliadas Al Trabajo Group

texts.es:
This committee was originally founded by 5 women that knew each other through the committee program of the Paraguayan Foundation and decided to form their own group. They are now in their third cycle of loans of the program, and have excellent credit history as they have always paid on time.

Perla, Pabla, Cornelia, Bernarda, and Silvia each have fast food stands. They sell sandwiches, empanadas, desserts, juice, and sodas among other things. They will use the loan to purchase meats, breads, flour, oil, prepared dough for empanadas, cheese, sodas, vegetables, and fruits, etc.

Mirian, Salvadora, and Liz each own small shops where they sell basic necessities such as bread products, sugar, flour, oil, vegetables, eggs, milk, fruit, and canned goods, etc. They want the loan to buy more merchandise. Veronica has a small butcher shop where she sells meats including chicken and pork. She also sells cold beverages such as sodas, beers, and juice. She will use her part of the loan to buy a new freezer; now that it is summer she has a high demand for cold beverages and the meats will keep better.

Bartola and Rossana dedicate themselves to selling fruits and vegetables. They will use their loans to buy tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, bananas, apples, oranges, pineapples, and watermelons, etc.

Rosa will buy bracelets, hoop earrings, hair clips, hair products, necklaces, and all types of objects for little girls. Eugenia dedicates herself to recycling and would like to acquire a new cart to transport all the objects she collects to recycle such as plastic bottles, cardboard, and paper, etc.

Silvia has a small restaurant where she sells all types of food. She will use her loan to buy gas, oil, meats, vegetables, noodles, and rice, etc. Martina sells charcoal and wishes to by more charcoal and bags to sell; Mirian sells ice cream and wants to purchase more flavors wholesale. Lastly, Luciana has a small store where she sells various objects such as shampoo, creams, women’s blouses, T-shirts, and pants, etc; she will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El presente comité se formó mediante cinco señoras, que se conocían del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya y decidieron formar su grupo, el cual ya se encuentra en el tercer ciclo de préstamos del programa, con una calificación muy buena ya que no presentaron ningún atraso de pago en los préstamos anteriores.

Las señoras Perla, Pabla, Cornelia, Bernarda y Silvia poseen puestos de venta de comidas rápidas cada una. Ellas venden sándwiches, empanadas, postres, jugos, gaseosas entre otros, ellas invertirán su crédito en invertirá en la compra de carnes, panes, harina, aceite, disco para empanadas, harina, queso, gaseosas, verduras, frutas, etc.

Las señoras Mirian, Salvadora y Liz poseen despensas cada una en donde comercializan todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad tales como panificados, azúcar, harina, aceite, verduras, huevos, leche, frutas, productos enlatados, etc. Ellas desean el crédito para la compra de mercaderías.

Verónica tiene una pequeña carnicería donde vende carnes y menudencia de vacas, pollo y cerdo, además vende bebidas frías como gaseosas, cervezas y jugos. Ella desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de freezer nuevo, ya que en este verano la demanda de bebidas frías es bastante alta y las carnes se deben conservar mejor.

Bartola y Rossana se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras, ellas invertirán sus préstamos en la compra de tomates, locotes, cebolla, bananas, manzanas, naranjas, frutas de estación como piñas, sandías, etc.

Rosa invertirá en comprar pulseras, aros anillos, pinzas y gomas para el pelo, cadenas, y todo tipo de bijouteries para niñas; Eugenia se dedica al reciclaje y desea adquirir un carrito nuevo para transportar sus diferentes artículos que recolecta para reciclar, como botellas de plástico, cartones, papeles, etc.

Silvia posee un comedor donde vende todo tipo de comidas por lo que ella desea invertir su crédito en la compra de gas, aceite, carnes, verduras, fideos, arroz, etc. Martina vende carbón y desea comprar más carbón y bolsas para la venta; Mirian vende helados y desea invertirlos en la compra al por mayor de diferentes sabores de helados y Luciana posee una mercería en donde vende artículos varios como shampoo, cremas, blusas para damas, remeras, pantalones, etc. y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, milk, sugar, meats, fruits, vegetables, shampoo, creams, blouses, T-shirts, pants, charcoal, plastic items and a cart among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his shoe business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. He lives in Benin-City, Edo state.Nigeria.  Edwin uses his motorcycle to move people from place to place. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. Now Edwin needs a loan of US $625 to enable him purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
“As you can see I have a wood fence at the entrance of my residence. I would like to place a protective wall at the front of my house, to give more security to my dwelling, since I have family and it is necessary for protection. I request 450 dollars for its construction. “

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

“Como pueden ver tengo una cerca de madera a la entrada de mi domicilio, me gustaría colocar una barda en el frente de mi casa, para darle mas seguridad a mi vivienda, ya que tengo familia y es necesaria su protección. Solicito 450.00 dlls para su elaboración.”

loans.use: To build a protective wall at the front of his house.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of their children in school. She operates a clothing shop in the community market. She sells men's and women's clothes like jeans, trousers, club shirts, skirts, and tops, among others. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of men's and women's clothes to increase her stock to make more income for her business and family. She is a member of the group called Transformer Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Doña Josefina P. is from the town of Chinandega and for a living she has been selling fruit for the past 10 years at the market Santa Ana. The start was difficult as her working capital was $25 (twenty five dollars) but as time went by sales have improved and now she is supporting her family.

Today she needs economic resources to buy fruits and sell them, and therefore she has approached Ceprodel hoping to obtain a loan that will allow her to continue improving her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Josefina P. es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de frutas las cuales las comercializa en el mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad. Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles por lo que inicio a vender con un capital de trabajo de U$ 25 (Veinticinco dólares) y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha mejorado sus ventas y llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que hoy en día ella está atravesando es que necesita el recurso económico para obtener las frutas y venderlas, por eso es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase fruit to increase sales.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Three years ago Cadith lost her husband. He was her companion and her support, and she misses him very much. Her three children and she cried the loss of her husband and father, and it has been hard to accept the death of a man so full of vitality, but they have. Cadith knew that the only way to keep him in their lives was to not give in to depression and work to get ahead, since that would be what he would have wanted her to do, and she did. She owns a food business. She is an expert cook, and she sells dinner plates with cold drinks, since it is always very hot in her town. She is requesting a loan which she will use to build a stand where she can sell her delicious dishes and that way provide more comfort for her clients and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 3 años Cadith perdió a su esposo, pena difícil de superar, ya que ella lo amaba mucho, y era su compañero de camino, y soporte. Tanto ella como sus 3 hijos lloraron la partida de su padre con mucho dolor, es difícil aceptar la muerte de un hombre lleno de vitalidad, pero así fue y lo aceptaron.Cadith sabía que la única manera de tenerlo presente, era no dejarse llevar por la depresión y seguir adelante, eso es lo que él quisiera ver en ella, y así lo ha hecho hasta hoy.Su negocio, es la comida, es una experta cocinera, vende platos de comida por las noches acompañados de heladas bebidas, ya que su localidad tiene un clima muy caluroso.Ella recurre a este medio para solicitar un préstamo el cual utilizará para la construcción de un kiosko para la venta de sus deliciosos platos, y tener mayor comodidad, tanto para ella como para sus clientes.

loans.use: To expand her business by building a kiosk.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with two sons, Volodya and Roman. He runs a small business selling dishware in Drogobych, where he's originally from. Moreover, Yaroslav also has another business offering transportation services in his region. He has been in business for 10 years. He gets about $4,000 of gross revenue each month.  

Yaroslav is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase dishware for his vending kiosk. A variety of good quality products will help him boost his sales and generate additional profit. Yaroslav believes that his business and marketing abilities, in combination with financial assistance, will help him increase his income and success.

Note: this is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Nihifadh

texts.en:
Nihifadh A. is 26 years old and single with one six-year-old child. She has run her own shop since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Nihifadh now looking for a loan to buy more commodities to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Edgard Bismarck

texts.es: Don Edgard habita en un barrio llamado Villa Alemania de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y junto a su esposa tiene una hija de seis años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar y de su pequeña hija. Edgard es dueño de una unidad de taxi, desde hace dos años, pues anteriormente  tenía una ruta de bus 111, pero decidió vender la ruta y comprarse el taxi, puesto que esta nueva actividad llevaba a generar más ingresos. Con la solicitud del préstamo que está haciendo es para mejorar el taxi, darle buen  mantenimiento, ya que es su fuente de trabajo. Sus planes a largo son poder adquirir otra unidad de taxi para alquilarla, y así tener mejores ganancias como más capital, poder criar a su hija y darles los estudios necesarios para que llegue a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Edgard lives in a neighborhood called Villa Alemania in the city of Managua. He is 30 years old, married, and has one 6-year old daughter with his wife who is a homemaker and cares for their young child. Edgard has owned a taxi for two years, having previously had route 111. However, he decided to sell the route and buy himself a taxi because this new activity would generate more income. With the request he’s making for a loan, he wants to make improvements to his taxi and maintain it well given that it is his source of income. His long-term plans are to be able to buy another taxi to rent out. He would have greater profits in the form of capital to be able to raise his daughter and provide the necessary education for her to become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his taxi.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 53 años de edad, es separado, tuvo 3 hijos, él se ha quedado viviendo con uno de ellos. Desde los 12 años viene labrando la tierra, nos cuenta que cuando se enamoró pensó llevar una vida feliz, pero no fue así, dice que ella se aburrió porque él era agricultor, que no soportó los bajos recursos y lo abandonó hace 8 años. Pero él decidió trabajar con la misma fuerza para darle lo mejor a su hijo. Ha sembrado varias chacras de diversos productos, pero lo que tiene en mayor cantidad es el cacao, este producto es muy rentable, nos dice que no hay pérdida, lo único delicado es que lo tiene que cuidar de la enfermedad del “koki” que acaba con la planta cuando no la fumiga. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará el “rejin” producto que usará para fumigar las dos hectáreas de cacao que tiene sembradas.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, separated and has three children and lives with one of them. For 12 years he has worked the land. He tells us that when he fell in love, he thought that he would live a happy life, but it didn't turn out that way. He says that his wife got bored because he was a farmer. She couldn't live on such a limited income so she left eight years ago. But he decided to work with the same determination in order to give his son the best. He has sown various fields with different crops but what he has the most of is cacao. This product is very profitable - he says there's no way to loose. The only delicate thing is that he has to prevent a disease called "koki" that kills the plants when he doesn't fumigate. This is the first time that he is requesting a loan from MFP. With the money he will buy "rejin," a product he will use to fumigate two hectares of cacao that he has planted.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the product necessary to fumigate crops

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Mrs. Si H. is a 30-year-old widow and is now living in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She has a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Si H. is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ducks and duck food for her duck breeding business. By expanding her poultry business, she hopes to earn additional income and to provide a better life for herself.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Ndèye Marie

texts.fr: Ndèye Marie N., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des recharges de crédit à vendre au niveau de son télécentre pour renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Marie N., age 39, is married and has five children to look after. She has been a member of the village association of Petit Kandé for seven and a half years. She wants to buy mobile phone cards to sell at her tele-center in order to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell phone cards in a tele-center

loans.name: Calixtra De Jesus

texts.es:
Calixtra de Jesús Ríos tiene la edad de 63 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Calixtra tiene 8 hijos y todos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida no labora por su edad, sus propósitos son de introducir nuevos productos en su pulpería y así tener el favoritismo de sus clientes, sus sueños son de tener otra vivienda donde su esposo y ella puedan vivir tranquilos ya que debido a la edad que tienen ambos y el negocio lo ocupan como medio de subsistencia sus deseos son de predominar en con su negocio además le gusta este negocio y quisiera mantenerlo para su bienestar además le gustaría que Dios le de mas vida para seguir trabajando y seguir disfrutando de la vida.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Calixtra inicio este negocio nació con el objetivo de  apoyar en los gastos de la familia y así ayudar a su esposo por lo que su esposo no trabaja debido a su edad por lo que empezó estableciendo con pocos productos como lo fue: golosinas, refrescos y granos básicos pero sus clientes buscaban mas productos por lo que Doña Calixtra no tenia mucho capital para invertir pero mas tarde decide realizar un préstamo y logra conseguir mas productos para su pulpería y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que mantener surtida su pulpería además quiere realizar la compra de nuevos productos y las compras las realiza en Managua y en otros departamentos.
texts.en:
Calixtra de Jesús Ríos is 63 years old and lives with her partner. She has 8 children, who are adults and work for themselves. Her partner doesn't work because of his age. She intends to introduce new products in her general store so she can attract more customers. Her dreams are to own another home where she and her husband can live tranquilly, given their age. They are dependent on their business as their means of survival. Her wishes are to dominate in the business. Moreover, she likes the business and would like to maintain it well. She would also like God to give her more time so she can continue working and enjoying life. Her source of income is her general store, which is located in her house. She has had this business for 15 years. Calixtra began this business with the objective of helping out with the expenses of the family. This is how she helps her husband, as her husband no longer works due to his age. They began establishing the business with some products like candies, drinks, and basic grains. However, her customers were looking for more products, in which Calixtra had no capital to invest. Later, she decided to take out a loan and managed to get more products for her general store and satisfy the needs of her customers. The loan is for capital to stock her general store and to buy new products and purchases from Managua and other places.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to stock her general store and buy new products

loans.name: Tonouwoèdé

texts.fr: Agée d’une quarantaine d’années, Mme A. Tonouwoèdé est une femme très dynamique qui a entrepris avec ses maigres moyens la vente de petits articles (bonbons, farine, sucre en poudre, savon omo) au bord de la rue .Afin de développer son activité pour un bon rendement,Mme A. souhaite construire un hangar pour s’abriter contre le soleil et la pluie Mais elle manque de moyens financiers .C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pouvant lui permettre de mieux s’installer , s’approvisionner  régulièrement .Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettrons de mieux contribuer aux charges de famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Tonouwoèdé A. is forty-something and a very dynamic woman who, with her meager funds, has embarked upon selling small items (candy, flour, sugar, Omo soap) on the road side. In order to develop her business for a good return, she would like to construct a covered stall for shelter against the sun and rain. But she lacks the financial means. This is why she is requesting financing to enable her to do better in getting situated and in acquiring supplies regularly. The profits derived from this work will allow her to do more to help with family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell basic goods

loans.name: Yanette

texts.es:
La socia,  Sra: Yanette, es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la agricultura (cultivo de papa, chuño, habas) y la ganadería y la crianza de animales menores (criar oveja, vacas), animales de corral (cuyes, gallinas, pollos).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado, en su comunidad campesina y se compromete a generar ingresos con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yanette is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. She balances her household activities with farming (she grows potatoes, chuño—dried potatoes—and peas). She also raises animals like sheep and cows, as well as caged animals like guinea pigs, chickens and hens. She is grateful for and values this loan, provided in her rural community, and she is committed to generate income with her hard work and to repay the entire loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals and seeds

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Violetas” trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente, se reúnen en el centro focal Panamericana ubicado en la ciudad de El alto.
Casi todas cuentan con familias  bastante numerosas, afirman que necesitan conseguir mayores ingresos para poder sostener económicamente a sus familias. La mayoría en este grupo se dedica a la artesanía, Martha por ejemplo se dedica al trenzado en paja, realiza adornos y muebles livianos con este material, otras de ellas se dedican al tejido en macramé y también al bordado de manteles .La asociación Violetas quiere ampliar sus ventas, para obtener mayores ganancias, es por eso que solicitan mayores créditos para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima. Luego de llegar a sus objetivos de venta, están seguras que mejorarían su situación económica.
texts.en:
The association, "Violetas," has worked with the Pro-Mujer family for approximately 10 years. They meet at the Panamericana center located in the city of El Alto. Almost all of them have rather large families. They tell us that they need to make bigger incomes to be able to support their families economically. The majority of this group is dedicated to craftwork. Martha, for example, braids straw and makes decorations and light furniture with this material. Others weave macramé or embroider tableclothes. The Violetas association wants to expand its sales to obtain bigger profits. This is why they are requesting bigger credits to be able to purchase a larger quantity of supplies. After reaching their sales goals, they are sure that they will improve their economic situations.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo en una casa arrendada. Trabaja todos los días en su principal fuente de ingresos, que es una vulcanizadora donde ofrece el servicio de reparación de llantas de automóviles y con su compresora llena de aire las llantas de los autos de sus clientes. Este trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, quien es parte importante en el negocio, ambos se esmeran para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios, por ello, sus clientes van aumentando progresivamente. A las personas que atiende principalmente son choferes de unidades de transporte público, y el acceso a su local es estratégico, pues se encuentra en el paradero de la mayoría de las líneas de transporte. Para mas adelante, Sonia y su esposo ven la posibilidad de implementar su vulcanizadora con la venta de repuestos para automóviles. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y trabaja incesantemente para que ella, y cada miembro de su banco comunal sean beneficiados. El dinero que ahora solicita es para mejorar la infraestructura de su local y abastecerse de más  herramientas adecuadas para su labor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old, and she lives with her husband in a rented house. She works every day at her principal source of income, which is a vulcanizing business. She offers the services of repairing automobile tires, and filling the tires on her clients' cars with her air compressor. She carries out this work together with her husband, who is an important part of the business. They both work hard to improve the quality of their services, and because of their hard work, their customers progressively increase in number. Among their clientele, the majority are drivers of public transportation vehicles. Sonia and her husband strategically located their business by the bus stop where the majority of bus lines complete their route, so as to provide the drivers with easy access to their services. For the future, Sonia and her husband see the possibility of adding the sale of spare auto parts to their vulcanizing business. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she works incessantly so that she and each member of her communal bank may succeed and continue to receive loans. The money that she asks for now will be used to improve the infrastructure of her business site and to supply herself with more adequate tools for use in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejorar la infraestructura de su local

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean N. is 56 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband (pictured at home) are vegetable sellers; together they make US$ 9 per day. This income is less than their daily expense, so Sean would like to take a loan to invest in another business. She will use her loan to purchase rubber, which she will sell for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase rubber to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Adeyinka

texts.en: A. is 47 years old, married with six children. She sells kerosene and also has a bar which she operates at night. She started these businesses two years ago. A. needs a loan of N 100,000 to purchase drums of kerosene to sell.

loans.use: purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: Leticia Jackeline

texts.es: Doña Leticia Jackeline Q. tiene la edad de 54 años, reside en la Comarca Sabana Grande  en la ciudad capitalina. Casada, con cinco hijos tres trabajan y dos están estudiando, su negocio es la costura y venta de pollo el cual desde hace seis año inicio con dinero propio. Sus planes es poder incrementar su negocio para obtener mejores utilidades. Este es su séptimo crédito en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, huevos, para cubrir la demanda. Sus deseos es poder ver a sus hijos que estudien. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad que ha dado para crecer en su negocio como hacer las mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
Leticia Jackeline Q. is 54 years old. She lives in Comarca Sabana Grande in the capital city. She is married and has five children, 3 who work and 2 who are in school. She sews and sells chickens, a business she started 6 years ago with her own money. Her plans are to grow her business to obtain better returns. This is her seventh loan with Afodenic, which will be used to purchase meat, chicken and eggs to meet demand. Her hope is for her children to go to school. She is thankful to the institution for the opprortunity it has provided her to grow her business and make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, chicken, eggs and dairy products

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Née en 1975, Mme Akossiwa E. est mariée à un agriculteur avec qui elle a eu cinq (05) enfants. Elle fait le commerce de céréales tels que le mais, le mil et le sorgho. Elle a pour habitude d’aller dans les villages environnants de sa localité pour acheter les produits auprès des paysans et les stocker afin de les revendre en détail au moment où les prix flambent sur le marché. A l’approche des grandes récoltes, elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre de constituer les stocks de céréales. C’est un moyen par lequel elle va accroitre ses revenus commerciaux.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Ms. Akossiwa E. is married to a farmer, with whom she had five children. She does commerce in grains, such as corn, millet, and sorghum. She usually goes from village to village in the area to buy goods from rural producers. And she stores them in order to resell them retail when market prices skyrocket. At the approach of the major harvests, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to build up a stock of grains. This is how she is going to increase her commercial revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grain

loans.name: Aderunty

texts.en:
T. is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ogun State. She sells doors and windows and has been in the business for the past fifteen years.

T. is requesting the loan N140,000 to purchase more doors and windows to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more doors and windows to sell

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma P. Q. vive en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Ana tiene 38 años de edad, se encuentra separada de su esposo y vive solamente con sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, el ex esposo de Ana le da mensualmente $160.00 US. Ana posee una tienda en su casa ya que no puede salir a trabajar fuera de casa para no descuidar a sus hijos es por ello que lo hace desde su casa con su tienda donde vende productos de consumo, ahora Ana esta solicitando este crédito ya que desea seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, con tu ayuda para este crédito Ana lograra surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas que serán de gran ayuda para ellas y todos sus hijos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah B. is a hairdresser and sells hair products like wigs, weave-ons and other hair products at Elmina near Abreshia. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a teacher. She received schooling through junior high school. Sarah has been in this business since 2005. She uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more, and a greater variety of, hair products for the styles of her customers. Sarah plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Ángela Isabel

texts.es: Ángela Isabel G. G. de 48 años de edad, reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Ángela vive en casa propia con su esposo y dos hijas menores de edad, actualmente estudiantes. Ángela se dedica día a día en atender su negocio, el cual tiene ubicado en su casa, es una tienda con productos de consumo; la tienda de Ángela tiene trece años de ofrecer de sus productos a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son vecinos de su colonia, pero ahora Ángela esta solicitando este crédito para fortalecer su tienda, surtiéndola con nuevos productos que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ángela Isabel G. G. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives in her own home with her husband and two dependent daughters, who are currently students.

Ángela attends to her business on a daily basis. She operates a store out of her home where she sells consumer products. For the past 13 years, she has been offering her products to her customers who are mostly neighbors who live in her development.

Ángela is now requesting a loan to purchase new products for her store that will help increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Arcangel Uriel Group

texts.es: El grupo “Arcángel Uriel” ésta  representado por la señora Celia y conformada por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. desayuno, venta D. ropa, artesanías, CDs y al transporte público D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia dentro del ámbito comercial siempre esta presente pero con los años los socios aprendieron a hacerle frete con productos a bajos precios y D. buena calidad o diversificando su mercadería para tener un stock mas variado generando así mas y mejores ingresos para el sustento D. sus hogares. Pese a ello siempre existe la necesidad D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo para hacer crecer el negocio ya que las necesidades D. sus familias van creciendo con los años; es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. un apoyo económico que les permita incrementar su mercadería, adquirir herramientas y repuestos para mejorar mas sus ingresos diarios y por eso recuren al financiamiento que les otorga la Fundación Agrocapital donD. van cursando otro ciclo mas demostrando capacidad y responsabilidad para la administración D. los fondos otorgados y generando así mejores ingresos para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Arcángel Uriel” group is represented by Celia and includes 12 members. Most of the members are involved in different commercial activities such as selling breakfast foods, clothing, handicrafts or CDs, or providing public transport for passengers. Although competition within the commercial sector is always present, over the years the members have learned to hold their own by selling good quality products at low prices, or by diversifying their merchandise so they can have a more varied stock; this has enabled them to generate more income for supporting their families. Nevertheless, the members always need to increase their working capital in order for their businesses to grow, since their families’ needs are increasing over the years. The members need economic assistance so that they can increase their merchandise and purchase tools and spare parts, and thus improve their daily income. That is why they sought funding from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, which has been granted. The members are working on their second loan cycle and are demonstrating their ability and responsibility in administering the funds that have been granted to them. This funding will enable the members to generate more income so that they can proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing their merchandise and purchasing tools and spare parts

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos F. de 41 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador desde joven aprendió el oficio de albañil ya que su papa trabajaba en construcción y hace soldadura el cual lleva 18 años en experiencia. Casado una esposa trabajadora que le ayuda a mantener su familia ella vende tortilla, desde horas tempranas se levanta para ir al molino y moler el maíz y luego palmear  el rico alimento Nicaragüense, procreo tres hijos de 8,2 y 14 años de edad,  dos estudian su primaria lo que mas desea es poder ayudar a sus hijos para que no falten al colegio y puedan ser hombres de bien. Don Carlos lleva siete ciclos en Afodenic y con este invertirá en la compra de soldadura para hacer su trabajo. Da las gracias a la institución por dar la oportunidad de hacer las mejoras en su vida como en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos F. is 41 years old. He is a hard-working gentleman who learned to be a building worker when he was young as his father worked in construction. For the past 18 years he has been working as a welder. He is married, his hard-working wife helps support the family. She sells tortillas, she gets up very early to go to the mill to grind corn and then prepare the delicious Nicaraguan dish. He has three sons, age 8, 2, and 14. Two are in elementary school, and it is his wish to be able to support his children so they can stay in school and become good men. Don Carlos has had seven loans with Afodenic, and with this one he will invest in buying welding to continue his work. He is grateful to the institution for giving him the opportunity to improve his life as well as his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding to continue work.

loans.name: Liberee

texts.en:
Liberee is 34 years old and is a recent widow with 3 children ages 7, 9 and 11; she also takes care of one dependent who is 15 years old. Liberee lives in the southern province of Rwanda near the National Park of Nyungwe which is in the tourism region. She has many years experience in the agriculture sector.

Liberee is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to grow her business by purchasing more farm supplies for use and sell in her business. If successful, this will allow her to earn more profit, support her family of 3 children and 1 dependent, and save money so that she will be able to buy her own house someday.

loans.use: Purchase more farm supplies

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: T. Joséphine est née le 11 Avril 1963 au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à AGBOGBA Joseph, un agent de recette des impôts. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Joséphine vit au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, il y a de cela un an. C’est le conjoint de Joséphine qui assure les charges de la famille. Joséphine est allé à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Mais depuis environs 10 ans, Joséphine vend des ustensiles de cuisine (bols en séries, glacières, bassines en séries, casseroles en séries, etc.) au marché Houègbo à Allada.
