C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Joséphine s’approvisionne. Joséphine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien remboursé le crédit. En vue d’agrandir son commerce et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle en période de fêtes, Joséphine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Joséphine ambitionne construire une boutique dans sa maison pour vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
T. Joséphine was born on April 11, 1963 in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is married to AGBOGBA Joseph, a tax collector. The couple has one child who is in school. She has been living in the Gbowèlè district in Allada, in Atlantique county, for a year. Her husband is the one ensuring that family expenses are met. Joséphine has attended secondary school. But for about ten years, she has been selling kitchen utensils (nested bowls, insulated containers, nested tubs, sets of pots and pans, etc.) at the Houègbo market in Allada. She stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. She has already benefited from an ALIDé loan and has repaid it. With the aim of expanding her commerce and satisfying her customers further during these holidays, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to build a store in her house to sell her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 12 sets of bowls

loans.name: Bech

texts.en: Bech S. was born in 1976 and is married with a young child who is not going to school. Bech S. and her husband own a small business selling rattan furniture. This couple also uses a cow cart to transport their rattan to sell around their community. They take a few days or a week to sell produce. Since selling rattan is the most profitable business, this family would like to depend on it. To make the business more successful and to have more income, Bech S. is applying for a $500 loan to be used to order additional rattan furniture to sell.

loans.use: To order additional rattan furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne B. est mariée, 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans la couture en vendant des habits cousus par elle-même. Les revenus générés lui permettent de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Julienne B. is married, 52 years old and mother of seven children. Her business activity is sewing and selling clothes she has tailored herself. The income generated allows her to better meet her family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen R. P. es una señora de 39 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Actualmente doña Carmen ordeña a en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 30 litros de leche y con otra vaca su producción aumentará muchos más litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionada de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.
Doña Carmen desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢500.000(quinientos mil colones) para comprar otra vaca y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con otra  vaca es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar a su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Doña Carmen es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su octavo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Carmen R. P., 39, lives with her husband and their three children in the El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba community in the Cartago province. It is a small, rural community with approximately 2,000 inhabitants. The inhabitants work at milk production and planting coffee. The landscape is irregular, and much of the land is humid tropical rain forest. The community has very picturesque scenery that combines tropical rain forest with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. El Sauce is approximately one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, which is the closest commercial center. Several times a year, however, the road becomes impassable because of the rains that fall in the area. This is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges for the community. When there isn't any work, many people choose to look for jobs in Turrialba or on banana plantations located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so the local people are looking to invest in projects in their own areas so they don’t have to travel to find work. Carmen currently milks in a small wooden installation set up as the milking room. She says that she produces approximately 30 liters of milk a day. With another cow, her production will increase by many more liters daily. She is excited to be able to see how her business grows and becomes stronger. Carment wishes to get a micro loan for ¢500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy another cow and increase her milk production. She knows that having another cow is a big sacrifice and will demand more work. But, she says that if she wants to get the family ahead she needs to put forth great effort to produce more. Carmen is a member of the Association of Producers in El Sauce, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her eighth loan, and she expects to continue growing on a personal level and economically. She also points out that thanks to this kind of organization that serve as a means of facilitating loans she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
45-year-old Ricardo farms for a living. He is from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. He is married and has two children and his oldest child is now 22 years old.

Ricardo cultivates his land for rice crops. The farm is the only source of income his family has so he makes sure it is productive.

Ricardo recently joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain its financial services. He applied for a loan of Php 6,000, which he will use to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

Ricardo is hopeful that this loan will help double his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jesica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jesica del Carmen M. C., vive con su familia en el barrio Carlos Fonseca  tiene un  hijo menor a su cargo y es madre soltera.
La Señora Jesica del Carmen C. es  profesora de primaria desde hace diez años, en el centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth. Es primera vez que trabaja con crédito en esta Financiera. El crédito lo va utilizar para cubrir gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Jesica del Carmen M. C. lives with her family in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. She is a single mother and has a minor son under her care. Jesica del Carmen C. has been an elementary school teacher for 10 years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. This is her first loan with this financial institution. She will use the funds to pay family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Msf Group

texts.en: Pictured here are members of the 'MSF' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These gentlemen are petty businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in order to further expand their businesses. Mustapha S. on the left is the leader of this group. Thirty-eight–year-old Mustapha is married and he and his wife have four children. For six years now, Mustapha has been selling motor spare parts. With this SLL 800,000 loan, he will expand his business by buying more spare parts to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of spare parts to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca sells dried fish and potatoes in her shop in one of the markets in Lagos. She is well-known in the market even with the short time she has been working there. This is due to her good customer relations. Franca has been in the business for 2 years and she is doing very well.
 
Franca is married with 5 children and she is 37 years of age. She lives in Lagos with her family. She is very energetic and business-oriented, and she wants to improve the living standard of her family by sending the children to good schools, feeding, and more. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more dried fish and potatoes to sell. She has been a member in LAPO microfinance for some years now with a good repayment record. She appreciates LAPO microfinance and Kiva for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica B. A. vive en el barrio Santa Isabel en el departamento de Cundinamarca, donde está ubicada la capital de Colombia. Bogotá; ella tiene una cigarrería, allí vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas,  para la cual requiere un financiamiento por valor de $ 2.000.000 que invertirá en la compra de enlatados, bebidas, embutidos, dulces,  salsamentaría en general y comestibles como arroz, aceite y café.

Su  idea de negocio surgió conjuntamente con su  hermano, ya que en su familia existe la tradición de ser independientes y fue así como montaron su cigarrería “Rancho Villa” aprovechando que Puente Aranda, localidad donde está ubicado el barrio Santa Isabel y donde ahora funciona su negocio, está rodeado de canchas deportivas, colegios, microempresas y   muchas familias residentes, lo cual hizo notorio un amplio mercado potencial para darle curso a su sueño. Ahora su principal desafío es acreditarlo y mejorar  su modo de vida y  condiciones económicas familiares día a día;  ahora su reto es fortalecer las relaciones entre sus vecindad, aprovechando la cigarrería como sitio donde hay mucha afluencia de vecinos, que con el tiempo pueden ser buenos amigos.
texts.en:
Mónica B. A. lives in the Santa Isabel neighborhood of Bogota, the capital of Colombia located in the department of Cundinamarca. She owns a small shop where she sells food, drinks, and general provisions. She needs a loan of $ 2.000.00, which she will invest in the purchase of canned goods, drinks, cold meats, sweets, general deli goods, and non-perishables like rice, oil, and coffee. Mónica came up with the idea for her business with her brother since her family has an established tradition of being independent. They opened their shop "Rancho Villa" in Puente Aranda, taking advantage of the fact that this Santa Isabel locale where there business is based, is surrounded by sports fields, schools, small businesses, and many family homes. The location gave them obvious market potential to achieve their dream. Currently, Mónica's biggest challenges are financing the business and improving her quality of life and the day-to-day economic conditions of her family. Since the shop is located in a place with a large number of neighbors, her goal is to strengthen her relationships with her neighbors who with time can become good friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Nandani

texts.en:
Nandani is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children; she has two sons and one daughter. One of them is married while the others currently do not have jobs.

Nandani has managed a business sewing clothes for three years. She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help develop her business.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To improve her sewing business

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila, a resident of Lahore (which is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) is the wife of S. B. and the mother of two sons. She wants to raise them with a good education, so this resulted in them both being enrolled in a school.  The elder son reads in 5th standard (grade) and the younger on is in 2nd standard. Although she is not educated, she knows the value of education, so she also enrolled them in a tuition center so they get more attention from a teacher and can concentrate on their studies.

A very caring and talented lady, Naila operates a business selling clothes. She purchases the clothes from different cities (Peshawar, Faisalabad and Multan) because of good quality and cheap rates. She has six years of experience in this business. She does this work to give a better future to her kids.

Her husband operates a scrap business in the community which he has been handling for the last seven years. He also does a government job in the morning for meager income. They both work hard to manage their finances and to give a good future to their kids.

Naila has completed her two loans from Asasah and now is applying for the third time to invest the capital in her clothing business so she can purchase the clothes in bulk and increases the profit from it.

loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and cooking oil to sell.  Christine is 34 years old and married to a policeman. She has 4 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock dried fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Albertina Carlota S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 27 anos de idade que frequenta a escola de jornalismo. Albertina fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela. 
Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 15 anos na cidade de Maputo no mercado Mandela de venda de refeições e bebidas alcoólicas. Tem 3 empregados 1 para ajudar em casa e os outros para ajudar no seu estabelecimento comercial e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa, pagamento de empregados e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (PROCREDIT), mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que Ja é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tinta, areia, cimento, pedra, portas e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência oferecendo melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Albertina Carlota S. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is single and has one son, who is 27 years old and attends journalism school. Albertina only studied through the 7th grade; she did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her son and supports her sister who lives with her. She has never left Maputo. For more than 15 years, Albertina has had her own business in Maputo city's Mandela market, where she sells meals and alcoholic drinks. She has 3 employees: 1 to help out in her house and 2 others to help her with her business. She earns about 7,000 MZN per month, which she uses for household expenses and employee payment. She is even able to save some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). Albertina has had loans with other banks (PROCREDIT), but later decided not to continue with them. She found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is already a client of this institution. This is her 1st loan, which has a value of 16,000 MZN. She intends to use it to buy construction material (paint, sand, cement, stone, doors, etc.) in order to expand and improve her house. She promises to pay back this loan on time so she can have access to others. In the future, she plans to ask for more loans in order to finish her house and offer her family a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (paint, sand, cement, stone, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Ivo

texts.en: lvo L. is 52 and is married with two children aged 8 and 20. She owns a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. lvo needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately USD 136 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, lvo joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Gappal,Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 45-year-old married woman. She does construction work to earn a living and runs a retail shop to earn extra income. She has engaged in the business for 10 years. She became a member of Kasa group in Faulu Kenya so as to access loans. She has managed to take out three loans from Faulu Kenya. Because she has a good reputation for paying back her loans, she has been guaranteed another loan of 70,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy building materials like cement and sand. She dreams of owning real estate in the future. she describes herself as determined and motivated.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace was born in 1970 and is a widow with five children. She is a businesswoman and the only one in her family who works. She therefore has to work hard to provide all that’s necessary for her family.

Grace owns a small business which sells various products such as cooking oil, rice, cosmetics products and so on. She employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. Her business is very small but she is well-known in her community. She operates her business from six in the morning to six in the evening every day. This is her 10th year of successful operation in business.

Grace is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more products to sell. These additional products will help her to attract more customers and satisfy them which is the way to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.en:
Gudelia P. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 52 years old. Gudelia is married and has four children. Two of them have jobs, and two of them are in school. To make a living, Gudelia works in someone else's specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Gudelia has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gudelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gudelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gudelia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Gudelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy P. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 5. She is a farmer and an accessory vendor. She and her husband cultivate their land to plant and harvest rice crops. She also allots some of her time to selling accessories like bracelets and necklaces. 

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it and to support her children's schooling. One of her dreams is to see her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate M. sells maize at Abura. Kate has senior high educational background. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Her loan will be used to buy extra maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

In this picture, Kate is showing the maize kernels that she will be selling.

loans.use: buy extra maize to sell

loans.name: Gemma-Rose

texts.en:
Gemma-rose S. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 23 years old. Gemma-rose is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Gemma-rose owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gemma-rose has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma-rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma-rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma-rose is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gemma-rose from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Five members make up this loan group located in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which to improve their living standard. Mrs. Srin S. the group leader is 44 years oldand selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Chho, are farmers who own 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family and he is also a fisherman. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is a student.

Mrs. S. has a problem cultivating rice as she did have enough rice seed. So, to improve production, Mrs. Srin S. is asking for a loan to buy additional rice seed.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene  4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía, la socia trabaja desde hace 15 años la socia realiza diversos trabajos, ella borda y también elabora muñecas de trapos y con trajes típicos, todo hecho en telas, vende bisutería y adornos varios. La socia desea comprar mercadería para implementar su negocio y de este modo aumentar su mercadería y sus ganancias ella comprará materiales para elaborar las muñecas de trapo y para comprar llaveros y algunos huacos retratos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Sacsayhuman" which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Antonia; she is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  She makes a living selling crafts and has done this for fifteen years. She make different kinds of things like embroidery and rag dolls dressed in typical clothing -- all made out of fabric.  She also sells costume jewelry and various types of ornaments. She would like to buy merchandise to implement her business and in this way increase both her merchandise and her profits.  She will buy materials to make rag dolls and to buy key chains and some Huaco (type of pottery) frames.

She acknowledges and appreciates the loan through this medium also agrees to make her payments in the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: El Corazon De Flor Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama El Corazón De Flor, porque es el nombre de una hija de una integrante, se ubica en la ciudad de Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. La sra. Leticia S. T. se dedica a la venta de alimentos, que inició hace cuatro años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ingredientes y asi poder tener más variedad en sus productos y realizar mejor su trabajo. Tiene 43 años, estudio hasta el 6to año de primaria. Es madre soltera y tiene en total 1 hijo varón de 11 años de edad. Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio, buen sazón, y su local está céntrico, ya que está frente a un balneario, siempre los recibe con una sonrisa, además cuenta con lo necesario para satisfacer su paladar. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder cumplir con las espectativas de sus clientes. Quiere este credito para invertir en su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias. Tambien espera seguir apoyado económicamente a su familia con la ampliacion de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Corazón De Flor' (Flor's Heart) because 'Flor' is the name of the daughter of one of the group's members.  The group is located in the city of Tehuacan, in the State of Puebla, in Mexico and has 9 members.

Mrs Leticia S.T. sells meals and she set up her business four years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients so that she can offer more variety in her products and better carry out her work.  She is 43 years old and studied up to the 6th year of elementary school.  She is a single mother and has one son aged 11.  Leticia's customers say that she provides a good service and good-tasting food.  Her premises are centrally located and located opposite a spa.  She always greets her customers with a smile and provides food which satisfies their palates.  At the moment of requesting this loan, Leticia feels happy that she will be able to meet her customers' demands.  She would like to invest this loan in her business and thereby make more profits.  She also hopes to continue supporting her family financially and expanding her home.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and make meals

loans.name: Eunice Nyambura

texts.en: Eunice Nyambura is 31 years old and married to Fredrick Mutwiri, who contributes to the family income. They have two children, ages 13 and 2 years old. She has been running a grocery store for a period of two years with an income of about 4,000 Kenyan shillings a month. This is her first loan with KADET and she wants to use it to buy tomatoes and charcoal for resale. She hopes to be a supplier of green vegetables. She wants to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and charcoal

loans.name: And Jappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND JAPPO du Banc villageois de Ngeune S. est créé la veille de l'inauguration le 27 décembre 2010. Le groupe est composé de 27 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont pratiquement toutes des liens de parenté. Le petit commerce est leur activité principal

DIALE D. debout à l'extrême gauche sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Avec son premier prêt à CAURIE-MF elle va renforcer son activité qu'elle fait depuis 4 ans.

Elle soutien son mari sur la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group And Jappo, which belongs to the Banc Villageois in Ngeune S., was established the day before its inauguration on 27th December 2010. The group is made up of 27 women coming from the same neighborhood. They are almost all related. Their main activity is small business.

Diale D., who is standing on the far left of the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 42 years old, married and mother to ten children. She has a small business selling vegetables and fish. With the loan from Cauri-MF she is going to strengthen the business which she has been carrying out for the past four years. She helps her husband to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fish

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Nana Adjoa A. is married with seven dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Nana sells cosmetics at Elmina and moves her wares from one area to another. Nana has attained a senior high school education and helps her husband to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use her loan to provide working capital to expand her cosmetics business. In the future, Nana hopes to use her profits to build a shop.

loans.use: to provide working capital

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
There are four people who form a group loan. They are located in Lekh Pir village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Phan K. is a 34 year-old married woman and she is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the four members. She and her husband, Mr. Cheng Thol, earn their living by making doors and windows which they sell to support the family.  In order to support this business, Mrs. Phan K. would like to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials for her current business.   

This couple has four children: two are chefs in restaurants and the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Khairu

texts.en:
Khairu started her own small grocery business about 30 years ago. She operates her store from a building on property she and her husband owns. Khairu has requested a loan of $1,300 USD to make some improvements to her store. She’d like to purchase some shelving material and buy a scale to use for weighing food items. These investments will help Khairu as she continues to develop and expand her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay off her children’s college tuition. In the future, she would also like to do some remodeling to her store so that she can increase her retail space. This is Khairu’s third loan from IMON International. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in developing a successful business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To make improvements to her store

loans.name: Lourdes Rosa

texts.es:
Lourdes, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Puno y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cusco. Lourdes trabaja en el magisterio en el área administrativa como encargada de la biblioteca, ella trabaja desde las 7:45 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a viernes, ella también tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en su domicilio y atiende por las tardes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Lourdes en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal y específica para la matricula de la universidad de su hijo.     

Lourdes pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old. She is married and as a result of this union has two children. She was born in the city of Puno. Today she lives in the city of Cusco. Lourdes works in the administrative area of the educational field as a librarian. She works from 7:45 a.m. to 3 p.m. from Monday to Friday. She also has a small beauty salon in her home where she sees customers in the evenings. She has been in this business for several years. It is going well for her thanks to her dedication to her work. At this time Lourdes needs this loan for personal use. Specifically, she needs it for her son’s college tuition.

Lourdes belongs to Los Solidarios communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity this program offers her. She promises to make all repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: For personal use, specifically, for her son's college tuition.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Remia owns and operates a a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish such as dilis, pinikas, and sari in the local community. Remia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Remia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Remia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell such as pinikas and ulang. This loan will be Remia's seventh loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La Sra. H. N. es comerciante, viuda tiene 3 hijos dos casados y uno que vive con ella pero es mayor trabaja para cementera. Se le han financiado doce crédito todos los ha invertido para su negocio su negocio es venta de ropa nueva y usada en las comunidades de pochomil viejo, san pablo, san Cristóbal y san Rafael, el dinero lo solicita para invertirlo en ropa de la temporada de verano, sus clientes son maestros y trabajadores de Cemex, dice sentirse satisfecha con el apoyo que ceprodel le ha brindado con estos crédito ya que hacía a podido ir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs H. N. is a saleswoman.  She is widowed and has three children, two who are married and one who still lives with her but is grown up and works for a cement company.

Mrs H. N. has received twelve loans and they have all been invested in her business selling new and used clothing in the villages of Pochomil Viejo, San Pablo, San Cristóbal and San Rafael.  She will invest this loan in buying summer clothing.  Her customers are bosses and workers at Cemex.  She says that she feels satisfied with the support that Ceprodel have offered her with her loans since they have helped her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes: pants, blouses and blankets

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a escuela primaria y para poder sustentar su hogar es que ella tiene este negocio.  Ella sale a vender todos los días a distribuir sus productos, ella sale muy temprano por lo que sus diferentes clientes viven en lugares muy lejanos, además de estar atendiendo su negocio en casa aprovecha para atender las necesidades de su familia. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio, ahora necesita el crédito para comprar zapatos, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas, tratamientos y trajes de baño pues se acerca la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora sells general merchandise and has 2 children attending primary school.  She has her business in order to support her household. 

She goes out to sell her goods every day, leaving very early since her various customers live in faraway places.  In addition to taking care of her business, she also takes care of the needs of her family. Her dream is to expand her business and now needs a loan to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, bedding treatments and bathing suits, because the summer season approaches.

loans.use: buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, bedding treatments and bathing suits

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.ru: Yadigar M. 33 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yadigar projivayet so svoyey jenoy i detmi v Absheron regione uje 5 let. Yagidar seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari v osobennosti moyushiye sredstva (porashki, milo, shampuni, steklo-ochistitieli i t. da). On uje 4 qoda kak otkril etot magazin prodaji produktov. On ochen strayetsya i userdno rabotayet chtob razvit svoy bizness den za denm.
texts.en: Yadigar M. is 33 years old.  He is married and has two children.  For five years, Yadigar has lived in the Absheron region with his wife and children.  Yagidar now needs 2000 AZN to buy goods, especially cleaning products (laundry detergent, soap, shampoo, window cleaner, etc.) He opened his grocery shop four years ago.  Every day he tries very hard and works diligently to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim. He is 31 years old and single with an 8-year-old child. Ibrahim also has two dependents that live with him and help with his business.  In 2004, Ibrahim established his cinema and top-up cards (mobile phone card) business. He started his business because he wanted to be employed and self-reliant. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, Ibrahim earns about 900,000 SLL a month. 

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy recharge cards and improve his cinema business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a permanent structure for his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone charge cards and improve his cinema business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth inició su expereincia de negocio apoyada en un cuaderno donde registraba pedidos  de mercancías, que compraba de contado  para vender a pocos clientes  a crédito,  para que estos pudieran pagarle cómodamente en cuotas; así vendía toallas, sabanas, adornos y cosméticos; luego en un local comercial ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla,  definió que vendería sola la línea de cosméticos,  pero esta  no llenó sus expectativas, por eso acudió  finalmente a un comerciante mayorista de electrodomésticos y decidieron trabajar en las dos líneas en el mismo local; así Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos menores y él comerciante mayorista, a la venta de grandes electrodomésticos, mediante un sub arriendo que ella paga por el espacio.  Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace Elizabeth  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará planchas, licuadoras y equipos de telefonía celular y memorias USB, aprovechando la gran demanda que últimamente tienen estos artículos y la  facil rotación. Con sus anteriores financiamientos a esta organización, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y sobre todo cumplirle a sus clientes, por eso agradece a la Fundación su apoyo financiero, con el que ha logrado surtir con diversidad de artículos el negocio.  Su sueño y gran desafío es tener puntos de ventas alterno en otros centros comerciales, para lograr el aumento de sus ingresos y seguir con su cónyuge proyectando su crecimiento familiar. Mientras esto ocurre Elizabeth trabaja persistentemente en su negocio, logrando en la actualidad sostenerse en el mercado con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de un 21% que gradualmente planea aumentar.
texts.en: Elizabeth started her business experience with a notebook where she registered her orders for merchandise. She would pay for it upfront and sell to a few customers on credit so they could pay her easily. She sold towels, sheets, ornaments, and cosmetics. Later, in a locale in the center of  Barranquilla, she decided she would sell only the cosmetic line. This didn't meet her expectations, so finally she went to a wholesale dealer of household appliances and they decided to sell both things in the same locale. Elizabeth sells the small appliances and he, the wholesaler, sells the large appliances with a sublet because she pays for the space.  Her Kiva loan is the third loan Elizabeth  has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy irons, blenders, and cell pones as well as USB memory sticks. She wants to take advantage of the high demand these items have had and the easy turnover. With her previous loans from this organization, she has been able to increase her working capital and more than anything serve her customers. That is why she is grateful to the Foundation for its financial support. With it, she has been able to supply her business with a variety of items. Her dream and great challenge is to have alternate points of sales in other commercial centers so she can increase her income and continue with her spouse, plannig their family growth. While this is happening, Elizabeth is working persistently on her business, able to support herself in the market with sales profits of no less than 21%, which she plans on increasing gradually.

loans.use: to buy irons, blenders, cell phones and USB  memory sticks

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
Salir adelante con su negocio y apoyar financieramente a su esposo debido a los problemas de salud que él actualmente enfrenta, es el sueño de María Leonor, quien a sus 58 años de edad tiene la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida. Las confecciones son un oficio al que se ha dedicado desde hace algunos años y desde su casa elabora prendas de vestir a la medida, toallas y tendidos que vende a sus clientes fijos. 
 
María necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, botones, entre otros insumos que le permitan mantener existencia de sus productos para mostrarlos a sus clientes y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
To get ahead with her business and to financially support her husband because of health problems he’s currently facing is María Leonor’s dream.  At the age of 58 she has the hope of improving her quality of life.  

For some years she’s been sewing and makes clothes to order, towels and bedclothes that she sells to regular customers.  

María needs a loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons, among other supplies that will make it possible for her to have products on hand to show her customers and thus earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Julio Bismar

texts.es:
Julio de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa se trabaja como estilista y hace manicure y a la vez cuida a un niño. Tienen un hijo con discapacidad y esta en el ultimo año de bachillerato. Su actividad e su taller de refrigeración y mecánico soldador.

Empezó hace 15 años escogió esta actividad a raíz de que su padre fue quien le enseño, luego tomo cursos para aprender mas . Labora diariamente en su taller reparando electrodomésticos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas repuestos para su taller y arreglar su vivienda en la compras de cerámicas para piso. En un futuro quiere cambiar de negocio comprarse un carro para hacer de taxi y ampliar su vivienda y que su hijo llegue hasta la universidad y seguir D-miro.
texts.en:
Julio, aged 44, lives in an urban area in El Guasmo (so named because of the tree species Guazuma Ulmifolia). El Guasmo is a crowded, lower-class neighborhood in Guayaquil that was formerly a ranch.  His wife works as a stylist and does manicures while caring for a child.   They have a child with disabilities, who is in the final year of high school. 

Julio's business is a refrigeration and mechanical welding workshop.  He started it 15 years ago, and chose this activity because of his father.  His father was the one who taught him, then he took courses to learn more.  He works daily in his workshop repairing appliances. With the help of the loan he wants to buy more spare parts for his workshop and fix up his home with the purchase of floor tiles.  

In the future he wants to change business and buy a car to use as a taxi. He also wants to expand his home and for his child to reach college, and to continue with D-MIRO.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cinder-blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children. Two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu  has operated a business  selling natural fruit juices, like mango juice and banana juice. She sells  from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Saumu wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, bananas and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes, bananas and sugar.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 31 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a emprender con éxito el negocio familiar que hoy tiene de manera sólida y junto a su esposo continúan dando todos sus esfuerzos, Tiene 11 años y medio dedicándose en la elaboración de ladrillos, que lo hace por millares. Recuerda que en un inicio vendía los ladrillos que producían otra fabricas, pero poco a poco logró ahorras y con ello arrendó un terreno amplio, lugar en el que ahora elabora ella misma los ladrillos. Como ya conocía la dinámica del mercado pudo conseguir rápidamente clientela, permitiéndole poner en flota su negocio. Para el futuro es  espera abastecerse de insumos y así no dejar de producir más ladrillos. Considera que para crecer es necesario apoyarse de los créditos ya que lo ha comprobado en su propia experiencia de las cuales viene trabajando de la mano con MFP  durante 11 oportunidades en las que viene recibiendo crédito. Con el dinero que solicita, le servirá para la compra de insumos que siempre utiliza en la fabricación de sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Elena, 31, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Her wish to improve herself led her to successfully start a family business that today is solid and, together with her husband, she continues putting all her efforts into it.  

She’s been manufacturing bricks for 11 and a half years; she makes them by the thousands.  She remembers how in the beginning she’d sell bricks made by other factories but gradually managed to save up and rent a spacious lot where she now makes the bricks herself.  Since she already knew the market dynamics she was able to quickly secure customers and launch her business.  

For the future she hopes to stock up on raw materials in order not to stop making bricks.  She believes that in order to grow one has to rely on loans, something she’s learned first hand working with MFP on 11 loan opportunities to date.  She will use the requested funds to buy the raw materials she always uses to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy brick making supplies.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La joven Yesenia tiene la edad de 18 años, solo estudio la primaria y es soltera.
Ella nos platica que cuando termino de estudiar la primaria tuvo que dejar la escuela ya que sus padres no tenian los recuersos para darle estudios y tuvo que iniciar a trabajar primero en los queaseres del hogar para hace a un poco mas de dos años a iniciado a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de pollo destasado, ella realiza sus ventas de lunes a sabados y dice que se levanta muy temprano para aliñar los pollos y cuando ya esta listo el pollo, lo pone en una cubeta y sale a ofrecerlo casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Ella nos platica que en algunas ocaciones su madre la ayuda, ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollo para su posterior venta, tambien nos dice que espera en un futuro poder tener su propio creadero de pollos y que desea que su negocio cresca cada dia mas, para poder continuar ayudando a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 18 years old and single. She only went as far as primary school.  She tells us that when she completed primary she had to leave school since her parents didn't have the resources to send her.  She had to begin working, first doing household chores, until a little more than two years ago she began her own business selling cut-up chickens. 

She sells Mondays to Saturdays and says that she gets up very early to prepare her chicken. When it's ready she puts it on a tray, and goes out to sell it door-to-door to her friends and neighbors in the community. She tells us that sometimes her mother helps her. 

She needs this loan in order to buy chicken to sell.  She also says that in the future she hopes to raise her own chickens. She wants her business to grow day by day, so that she can continue helping her mother with household expenses.

loans.use: To sell chicken

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, a 44-year-old married mother of one, lives in Purok 2 Carangan, Ozamiz City where she has had a shop that sells a variety of dry goods and peanut butter for the past six years.

Angelita has requested a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase dry goods for her business and ingredients for her peanut butter. A member of PMPC for four years, she hopes to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods for her business and ingredients for her peanut butter.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en: Benigna is a very supportive mother with her children. She lives in her own home together with her beloved husband. Benigna has a business of furniture making where she can sell tables, chairs and beds. Her wish is to be able to see her children become professionals. This is what motivates her to work every day. She has decided to request this loan in order to buy a wood, nails and other materials needed in her shop that will appeal to her customers and allow her to attract new customers. She hopes that this will improve her situation and that she will manage to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy nails, wood and other materials needed for her furniture

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. HUANCA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.
La  socia Luz Marina; tiene 48 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica  al transporte, la socia tiene un combi el cual lo ha puesto al servicio D. movilidad escolar, la socia trabaja con un colegio privado y se encarga del recojo y traslado D. la casa D. los niños  al colegio y D. retorno del colegio a la casa D. los niños, la socia desea por ahora invertir en el mantenimiento D. sus movilidad y en la compra D. combustible para la combi, la socia trabaja desD. hace 3 años y D. este modo tiene las mañanas para hacer diferentes cosas como cocinar para su familia, lavar, arreglar la casa, pagar facturas y otros, por las tardes pueD. pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento D. su movilidad y en la compra D. combustible.
Los otros socios se dedican a la panadería, a la administración D. sus negocios como agencia D. viajes, a la compra y venta D. ropa entre otros.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR D. HUANCA” Communal Bank, which is located in the Huanchac community in the Province of Cusco and Department of Cusco.

The member is Luz Marina; she is 48 years old.  The member is married with three children.  She works in transport; she has a small bus with which she provides school transportation services.  She works with a private school, and is responsible for picking up the children from their homes and bringing them to school, and for taking them home after school.

The member now would like to invest in maintenance on her vehicle and buying fuel for it.

The member has been doing this work for the last three years, and in this way she has the mornings for doing different things such as cooking for her family, doing laundry, tidying the home, paying bills and other things.  In the afternoons, she is able to spend more time with her children.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in maintenance for her vehicle and purchasing fuel.

The other members work in a bakery; managing businesses such as a travel agency; buying and selling clothes; among other things.

The member is grateful for the support that is being offered to her, and at the same time, she agrees to comply with her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance of her vehicle and purchase of fuel.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 33 years old and lives in an airport community.  She is single.   Sharon stopped her education in 4th grade and has three children between 3 and 10 years old, all of whom are  in school and live at home.  

For a year now, Sharon has been selling bread.  She started this business with the little amount that she was saving.  She learned this business from her aunt.  She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.  

Sharon is  requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, oil and baking powder for her business.  She hopes to have more profit to sustain her family.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, butter, oil and baking powder

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, es casado, reside en su casa propia junto a su  familia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. También cría y vende aves de corral. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

José desea comprar fertilizantes y para  brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José, who is 41 years old, is married and lives with his family in his own house, which has electrical service and is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura. It is a district with agriculture, livestock-raising, and handicrafts.

He has some farmland where he usually plants lemon trees. He has several years of experience in this business and during this time he has learned a lot about the management of crops. He also raises and sells poultry. He uses the income that he receives from these activities to pay the daily expenses of his family.

José wants to buy fertilizers and maintain his land so that he can plant a new lemon plantation. In this way he will obtain a better harvest. To achieve his objective, he has seen the need to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his fields and to plant a new lemon plantation.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married with one child. Perla is 58 years old and lives in Bañadero.

To earn a living, Perla sells dried fish. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has been requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. Perla has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 37, is humble villager from the Ornlong Veng District in Siem Reap Province.  He has spent most of his life cultivating rice crops alongside his wife. Sok and his wife earn a good profit from their farming business.  He works tirelessly to support his children’s education.  Sok earns additional income by working as a manual laborer for tradespeople in the local area.  At the workplace, he earns money by using his physical strength to carry heavy things like bags of rice and beans. 

In the next few months, Sok will start harvesting his rice crop and then be engaged with threshing.  He owns an old threshing machine, but it does not work well.  Sok would like to ask for a loan from Kiva partner Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to fix his old threshing machine.  This loan will help this family to reduce the time and labor required to thresh his rice products this year.  In the future, Sok hopes to expand his farming business and provide his three children good opportunities to study at the University level.

loans.use: to fix his old threshing machine to reduce the time and labor required to process rice products.

loans.name: Kamunevu Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kamunevu Farmers Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Raphael and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Raphael is the facilitator of the Kamunevu Farmers Group. In the photograph above, Raphael is pictured with his group members and the field officer standing on the far left. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Kamunevu Farmers Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Raphael takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Raphael had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Raphael was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Raphael will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 35 years old and married to an evangelist. They have four children aged 5 to 12 years, three of whom are currently in school. 

She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 7 years. She would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell in her store. Immaculee would like to use any profits to buy a cow. She would one day like to own and run a larger store.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ovuluhya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ovuluhya SHG Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Ovuluhya SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Ovuluhya SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married to a carpenter and has two children.  For the past six years, Mercy has run a business, selling cosmetics in Beasease.  Mercy uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills.  She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell.  With the additional profit generated from this loan, Mercy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between the ages of one and sixteen; all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a mother of two children aged five years and two years respectively. She has a hotel business that she has managed for the past six years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase foodstuff commodities to sell. 

She will use the anticipated profit to reach and satisfy her basic needs. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To boost her business by purchasing foodstuff commodities to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has three children and has been doing this work for 6 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Keeping poultry' Her biggest challenge is 'Access to finance.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuiyobei.'

Nancy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Chose Juhudi after being convincd by a neighbour in Juhudi group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Learnt how Juhudi works to boost farmers production and income through finance.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Nancy replied 'Will put up a poultry structure and increase the birds population.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nancy owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household '' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Gena requested a PHP 6350 loan through NWTF to invest in a a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Gena is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with nine children.

She has been doing this very business for five years. She has experience in her business. She got a grant money worth 100 dollars from Village Enterprise Fund in the year 2001.

Margaret runs a small store outside of Tororo that deals in domestic and kitchen supplies. She has the only such store in the area and people walk up to an hour just to buy supplies from her store. She deals in both wholesale and retail.

A loan will help Margaret significantly upgrade her store. She is currently supporting her family with the store, but they are struggling to pay school fees and buy medicine.

Given a loan 500 dollars, she plans to expand her business by buying the essential commodities in large quantity -- sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, washing soap, toilet soap, rice, baking powder, baking flour, matches etc.

loans.use: Buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Abel

texts.en:
My name is Rosa Abel A. and I sell firewood from my car. I have had my business for 3 years and I have many customers as I live in a town where the majority of home use firewood to cook. My business generate enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family and to give a good education to my children, who are ready to enroll in school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Rosa Abel A. me dedico a la venta de leña en coche, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en mi pueblo la mayoria de las casas consume leña para cocinar, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis dos hijos que estan por ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: To buy tires, wood, and ball bearins.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Mr S. has worked for 20 years at the repair and sales of electric domestic devices, and is an older person, but very responsible and dedicated to his work. He says: " What I desire is to continue working but to do this I need financial support in order to purchase a large quantity of used electric domestic devices to salvage the still-good parts and use them to repair the aparatuses that my clients bring to me, but I need a loan of $1,200.00."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Seledón lleva 20 años dedicándose a la reparación y venta de electrodomésticos, es una persona mayor pero muy responsable y dedicada con su trabajo. "Lo que deseo es poder seguir ocupado en mi trabajo por eso necesito que me apoyen para poder comprar una gran cantidad de electrodomésticos usados para poder obtener las partes buenas y poder reparar todos los aparatos que me traigan los clientes, necesito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: To purchase new parts and used electric domestic devices to use to repairs and to sell.

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en: B. Zefer Evez oglu is a 50-year-old farmer and he is the head of an Internally Displace Persons family settled in Buldug village of the Sabirabad region. His family consist of 4 children, 2 parents and his wife. His family expenses are high due to the sickness of the elder people. He has a small business in animal husbandry. He would like to increase the number of animals to increase his income. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase animals and animal feed.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura K. is 31 years old. She has a secondary-level education.  She is married and has 4 children.  When she graduated from secondary school, her parents did not allow her to continue her education. So she got married. She was a housewife and looked after her children. For 10 years, her husband has gone to Russia to earn money. Mastura decided to start working and earning money by herself.   She started her business in a market seven years ago. She sells women's dresses, women's handkerchiefs, morning dresses, pajamas, towels, bedcovers and slippers. Her business brought her a good income, and she started to change the range of goods. With the purpose of selling goods fast, she sells them with a low price so goods do not lay long on a counter.  For the loan amount of $575 Mastura is going to buy school uniforms. This loan helps increase the range of school uniforms in the market before school starts and gives the opportunity to local habitants to obtain goods for low prices. Mastura is going to pay off the loan amount over 6 months.

loans.use: To increase the turnover through buying and selling new range of school uniforms

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila sells small articles of clothing, accessories and sweets from a bag as she walks through the streets of the various communities in her area. She probably walks 10-15 miles a day as she sells her items.

Every night she makes homemaD. coconut-bread, a delicious sweet bread that everyone loves to buy from her. This will be the fifth loan that she has taken out, and she is very excited to continue improving her life.

She plans to use the loan to purchase a better variety of clothes to sell, and she hopes to save enough so that one day she can build a strong and safe home of concrete for her family, and so that she can also build a store where she can sell her items without having to walk so much each day.

She is very involved with her local Catholic church, and wants nothing more than to give her nine children a shot at a better life. She is very thankful for your help with this loan.

NOTE: This $1,000 loan will fund Petronila's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase better variety of clothes for resale

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
Problems and money shortages never defeated HIlda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. That's why since she was 30 years old, she has been selling clothing. Years ago, she had a small stand, but she could not make enough to cover the rent. Because of the difficult situation facing her family, she decided to sell her garments door to door and in markets. Little by little, she began to sell her items at the local fairs. Now things are picking up and she would like to establish herself in a commercial location so her knitted pieces, designed entirely by her, will be better displayed and appreciated. HIlda has big goals that motivate her. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She appreciates your great support.

Los problemas y la escasez económica nunca derrotaron a Hilda que siempre ha buscado la manera de acabar con los obstáculos para salir adelante y es por ello que desde hace treinta años se viene dedicando al comercio de prendas de vestir.En años anteriores tenía un local comercial pero el alquiler no compensaba las ganancias que percibía, es debido a esto que decidió vender sus artículos de manera ambulante por la difícil situación que afrontaba su familia y poco a poco inició comercializando sus prendas en las ferias locales de su zona.Hasta ahora está bien y piensa establecerse en un local comercial para que sus artículos tejidos y diseñadas enteramente por ella sean también apreciados en este espacio.
