Ahora Hilda tiene grandes anhelos que la motivan a seguir adelante; solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería. Así mismo te agradece tu gran aporte.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS SELLING KNITTED GARMENTS TO THE PEOPLE IN HUANCAINO.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa (her husband is pictured) was born in 1952. She lives with her family in Khachmaz town. This woman has 4 children. Her husband has cooked kabobs for 4 years. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy sheep for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy sheep for cooking kabobs.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a craftswomen and makes clothing, comforters and sheets. She is also employed at an insurance agency. These two activities combine to be her primary source of income, which she uses to help her daughter who is beginning studies at the local state university. She lives in the Achachicala District within the city of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a new sewing machine to help increase her production level thereby generating an increase in her family’s income. This is the fourth loan with Impro. Her excellent repayment history facilitates in granting her a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Doris es artesana y confecciona prendas de vestir, edredones y sabanas; también trabaja como empleada eventual en una empresa de seguros. Estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos principales con los que cubre la manutención de su hija que esta entrando a estudiar a la universidad estatal; vive en la Zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de una maquina recta, misma que le ayudara a mejorar su producción en costuras y generara mayores ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use:
Purchase of a sewing machine for her business

Compra de maquina de coser para su negocio

loans.name: Javier Natividad

texts.es:
Javier V. has been dedicated to cattle farming and agriculture for the past 15 years, and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in.
He is married and the father of two school-age children, who are his responsibility. In order to advance, he has looked for a way to improve his financial situation, and has done so thanks to loans granted by Ceprodel. These loans were invested by him in the purchase of cows to be fatten and bred, to then be butchered to sell the meat, or milked.
For as long as he has worked with Ceprodel, he has been an excellent client, who makes his loan repayments timely.

 Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier V. es un caballero que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad de ganadería y pecuaria, con vasta experiencia en el ramo de los animales por ser el único negocio al que se dedica.

Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Para lograr salir adelante ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica y lo ha hecho mediante los créditos brindados por Ceprodel, siendo éstos invertidos en la compra de vacas para alimentarlas, reproducirlas y luego venderlas o destazarlas para comercializar la carne o leche.
Desde que ha trabajado con Ceprodel ha sido un excelente cliente, cumpliendo con el pago de los créditos de manera eficiente.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Okouromi

texts.en: Okouromi I. is 45 years old, married and has one child. He resides in Benin-City, Nigeria where he uses a motorcycle to move people from place to place. He needs a loan of $625 to enable him to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. Since 1995, Prisca has sold clothes and she owns a small beauty salon. Every day, she works from 7am to 6.30pm at her business.

Prisca now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Miniqul

texts.ru:
Miniqul G. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education and has a retail business selling vegetables. He sells potatoes which he buys from local farmers and sells on the market. He has been doing this for the past two years. This business brings small income which is only enough to buy food. Miniqul wants to get a loan so he can pay for a truck of potatoes which he ordered. If he pays for it then all of the profits from sales will be his. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиев Миникул проживает в городе Турсун-заде . Женат и имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей овощами. Продает картофель , который скупает у дехкан и продает на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 2 лет. Этот бизнес приносит небольшой доход , которого хватает лишь на питание. Клиент хочет получить кредит , чтобы оплатить за камаз картофеля , который он заказал. Если он заплатит , то вся прибыль от проданного картофеля останется ему.Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

loans.name: Claribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Claribel is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her house, by plastering the walls and putting a floor in the kitchen. She has worked as a teacher at César Augusto Salinas Pinell school for 16 years and has three children. Claribel is a hard worker that, in addition to teaching, works in the mayor's office during the day and at night gives classes secondary students.

Her dream is to have job stability and a decent house with all the basic conditions that any person would want. She is a person known in Nueva Guinea for being a responsible and sociable person.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Claribel está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y ponerle el piso a la cocina, trabaja como docente de la Escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 16 años, tiene tres hijos, doña Claribel es una mujer luchadora que además de docente trabaja en la Alcaldia de dia, y de noche imparte clase a jóvenes de Secundaria.

Su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadana aspira, ella es una persona reconocida en Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable

loans.use: Plastering the walls and putting a floor in her kitchen

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Hilda M.. She is married and has three children with ages between 20 and 26.

In 2005, Hilda established her pharmacy business. Hilda has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional medicine. In the future, Hilda plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase medicine.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr:
Sira D., 56, married and raising 4 children has been a member of the village bank Saré Yéroyel for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase goats and rams in order to boast her livestock fattening business. She is intending to sell them during the Moslem feast commemorating Abraham's sacrifice (known in Senegal asTabaski) at which point animals are sold at much higher prices than usual. Her income allows her to support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Sira D., âgée de 56 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Yéroyel depuis 5 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des chèvres et des béliers afin de renforcer son activité d’embouche caprine et ovine. Elle compte vendre pendant la période de fête de Tabaski ou les bêtes sont vendus à des prix très élevés. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charges ses charges familiales.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Fattening goats and sheep

Embouche caprine et ovine.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 40, is a mother of two children—one is a student and the other is a garment worker—and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Chhun Rim, have a business purchasing recycled items and are able to make around US$3 each day. This couple told a loan officer that they started that business when they married, over nine years ago. To earn more money, Sok would like a loan from Kiva of US$600 to add to the number of recycled items for sale. (Sok is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: To add to the number of recycle items purchased for sale.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: Cuando inicio a trabajar en la elaboración de tortillas en su casa de habitación, por iniciativa de ella misma quiso vender raspado en los colegios del municipio, su primer crédito de adim lo invirtió en la compra de un carretón para iniciar este negocio, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo el que con tanto sacrificio compro una caponera (triciclo) y presta los servicios de traslado de personas en el mismo municipio. Tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo el que trabaja de albañil y con sus dos hijos mayores que le ayudan económicamente con  los gastos de la casa. Sueña con tener dos carretones más para tener vendedores ya que este producto en toda época se vende.
texts.en:
Simona began working by making tortillas in her home. This gave her the initiative to sell shaved ice in the high schools in the town. Her first loan was invested in the purchase of a cart to begin the business. For this she relied upon the help of her son, who sacrificed to buy a non-motorized vehicle for transporting people within the town. She has her own house where she lives with her husband, who is a mason, and with her two grown children who help her financially with the household expenses. She dreams of having two more carts and salesmen so the product can be sold at all times.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 31 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es docente, y elL. se dedica a L. agricultura. Sus padres fueron agricultores, por ello que está acostumbrada a L. chacra, pero desD. que se casó ya no  siembra en grandes cantidades, porque también tiene que atender a su esposo que trabaja como profesor y en las noches hace taxi y a sus hijos que están en L. etapa escolar. A elL. le agrada L. chacra, siempre está trabajando en frutos cítricos, tiene 4 hectáreas. A su esposo no le agrada L. actividad agrícoL., por ellos padece durante L. cosecha, entonces ha visto conveniente vender sus productos por chacra, así el comprador es el que cosecha. Esto no le deja grandes ganancias, pero sí las necesarias, pero durante las vacaciones D. sus hijos le apoyarán con L. cosecha, esto permitirá obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado contratará peones para sus plantaciones D. cítricos y otra parte invertirá en L. reparación D. su carro, con el cual su esposo hace taxi  D. noche.
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher and she earns a living in agriculture. Her parents were farmers and because of this she is accustomed to the farm. However since she married she doesn’t plant in large quantities because she also has to attend to both her husband who works as a teacher and a taxi driver at night, and to her school-age children. She likes farming, has 4 hectares, and is always working in citrus fruits. Agricultural activity does not appeal to her husband, and it is hard on them during the harvest, so it has seemed best to sell her products by the field, where the buyer is the one that harvests. This doesn’t yield large earnings, but the necessary earnings. But during their vacations her children will help her with the harvest and this will allow for better earnings. This is her fourth loan with MFP. With the money requested she will hire laborers for her citrus plantation and with the other part will invest in the repair of their car that her husband uses for the night time taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire workers for her farm fields, and furthermore to repair the car her husband uses for taxi service

loans.name: Hamdamov

texts.ru:
Машариф Хамдамов 1945 года рождения,  живет он  среди гор  Уткансоя в одном из кишлаков (деревня) сельского поселения. У него 8 детей. 2 сына уехали на заработки в Россию, но их жены остались. Машарифу приходиться обеспечивать свою семью и жен своих сыновей. Хотя сыновья присылают деньги на житье. Основная деятельность в  их кишлаке это фермерство где работает Машариф, но в конце осени он остается безработным.  Для этого в каждой семье, в том числе и Машариф  дома держит  скот, так как скот дает,  и пищу и тепло. Он держит коров которое дает молоко, а также делают др. молочные изделия, много коз и овец , которые дают шерсть. 
Зимой, когда скот дешевый он покупает коз или овец, но в этот раз  ему не хватило своего капитала для увеличения поголовья скота. Его родственники посоветовали обратиться в Микроинвест, так как сами имели опыт работы с кредитами.
Сейчас Машариф   получив необходимую сумму, на очередном  рынке приобрел овец и коз. Через 3-4 месяца молодняк подрастет и можно продать  дороже, погасить кредит и на остатки  купить другой скот.
texts.en:
Hamdamov M. was born in 1945 and lives in the Utanskoya mountains in a rural kishlak (village). He has eight children. Two of his sons have gone to work in Russia, but their wives remain. M. provides for his family and his daughters-in-law, even though his sons send money to live off of. The primary occupation in the village is farming. M. works in farming as well, but at the end of autumn, he is unemployed. Because of this, every family, including M.’s, raises livestock, since livestock provide both food and warmth. He keeps cows for milk and other dairy products, and he has a lot of goats and sheep who give wool. In the winter when livestock is cheap, he buys goats or sheep. However, this time he did not have enough money to increase his herds. His relatives advised him to go to MicroInvest, since they themselves had taken out loans in the past. Now, having received the necessary funds, M. will get sheep and goats at the next market. In three to four months, the lambs and kids will grow up, and he will be able to sell them for a profit in order to pay off the loan and buy more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José P. tiene 45 años, vive en pareja con la señora Miriam Trinidad desde hace muchos años. Ellos tienen su propia casa en el Barrio Quiteria de la ciudad de Encarnación. 

El señor José es propietario de su carpintería que posee en su domicilio desde hace más de dos años, el es muy trabajador y mediante eso ha progresado, ya que ha realizado mejoras en su carpintería y gracias a su trabajo también siempre ha podido cubrir los gastos de hogar. Su cónyuge, la señora Miriam, es ama de casa y se dedica a realizar los trabajos que el hogar requiere diariamente.

Este señor ha solicitado el crédito en Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de más insumos para su carpintería, debido a que esta teniendo muchos pedidos y desea cumplir acabadamente con cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
José P. is 45 years old and has lived with Miriam Trinidad for many years. They own their own home in the Barrio Quiteria neighbourhood in the city of Encarnación. José has had a carpentry workshop in his home for more than 2 years. He is a very hard worker and has made a lot of progress as he has made improvements to his workshop. Thanks to his work he has always been able to pay the household expenses. His common-law wife, Miriam, is a housewife and she takes care of the day-to-day household chores. This client has requested a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy more wood for his carpentry business, as demand is strong and he wants to fill every single one of his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to make furniture.

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es:
Waldo  vive en la calle Sorata  en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña hija. en su terreno que le heredo su padre.
 
Se dedica al comercio de muebles y artefactos en deshuso, los cuales adquiere en las zonas centrales de la ciudad de La Paz, y los vende en sectores periféricos de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderia para su negocio.
 
Es el  primer crédito en Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Waldo lives in Sorata St, in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife, who cares for their young daughter, on land he inherited from his father. He works selling furniture and second hand items, which he acquires in the central zones of the city of La Paz and sells in the outlying areas of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for his business. This is his first loan with Impro. They have evaluated his application and classified him as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Agée de quarante six (46) ans, Mme Marie H. est mariée avec quatre (04) personnes à charge. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de produits de premières nécessités à Aného. Son dynamisme, son dévouement et la qualité de ses produits ont instauré une confiance énorme entre elle et ses clients qui ne cessent d’augmenter et d’être exigeants. Pour développer son commerce et faire face aux besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite un financement. Ce crédit lui permettra de rentabiliser son activité et d’accroître ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Marie H., age 46, is married and has four people to support. She is the owner of a shop selling food items and basic goods in Aného. Her dynamism, devotion, and the quality of her products have established enormous trust between her and her customers, who are continually increasing and demanding. To develop her commerce and to address their needs, she is requesting financing. This loan will enable her to make her work profitable and to grow her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Asociación Belen - Compone Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es denominado “ASOCIACIÓN BELEN - COMPONE”; Se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Anta a 1 hora 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; Este banquito lo conforman 15 socios 12 mujeres y 3 varones, ellos pertenecen a está asociación de vecinos, amigos y parientes y viene trabajando en función a los bancos comunales cerca de 2 años.

En su mayoría los socios, se dedican ala crianza de animales vacunos,  compran y venden vacas y toros, crían animales de corral, y se dedican también a los cultivos en las diferentes épocas, ahora terminaron de producir maíz y están preparando sus tierras para la siembra de papa, verduras, cebada.

Los socios invertirán sus capitales de trabajo de las siguiente forma; comprar vacas y vender sus derivados en la ciudad el Cusco los días domingos, los 02 socios varones son chóferes de transporte y lo invertirán en la compra de repuestos par5a sus carros, llantas nuevas, otras socias para alquilar el tractor y comprar semillas, otra socia en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos, otra socia comprar vidrios para su casa, otra socia comprará fermento para elaborara chicha de  maíz y vender en su casa.

En la foto falta un socio varón es el señor Catalino C., el tiene el permiso de sus banco, por encontrarse hospitalizado.

Los socios del banco agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado para su capital de trabajo y se comprometen en pagar el total del préstamo en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ASOCIACIÓN BELEN - COMPONE”. It is located in the district of Anta an hour and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. This little bank consists of 15 partners--12 women and 3 men. They have belonged to this group of neighbors, friends and parents and have worked in communal banks for about two years. The majority of the members work raising cattle. They buy and sell cows and bulls, raise barnyard animals, and also tend crops in various seasons. Now they have finished producing corn and are preparing to sow their fields with potatoes, vegetables, and barley. The partners will invest their capital in the following manner: some will purchase cows and sell their derivatives in Cusco on Sundays; two of the male partners, who are drivers, will purchase replacement parts and new tires for their cars; other members will rent a tractor and buy seeds; another member will buy school supplies for her children; another member will buy windows for her house; and another member will buy fermenting supplies to make maize chicha and sell it from her home. The photo is missing one of the partners, Catalino C., who has a pass from the bank as he is in the hospital. The bank partners appreciate and value this loan for their working capital, and promise to pay the loan total by the established dates.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows and seeds, rent a tractor, etc.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden R. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to buy more beer for sale. Kiden is 35 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell at home

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma V. R. tiene 46 años vive en Licapa, distrito de Paijan, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro. de primaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que no le gustaba ir al colegio. Tiene 01 hijo que ya no depende económicamente de ella.
Norma se dedica a la venta de ladrillo, iniciò su negocio vendiendo fruta durante 10 años, luego se dedicò a la venta de ropa, que abandonò debido a que era muy cansado para ella.  Con el capital que tenia decidió empezar la venta de ladrillo en sociedad,  pero al tiempo tuvo que cambiar de domicilio y empezar sola el negocio que le es muy rentable, con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado comprarse 2 carros que utiliza para repartir el ladrillo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el sector llamado chuin bajo.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de carbón.
Con el crédito de 3000 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de carbón, briqueta y leña para el horno de ladrillo.
Norma tiene el gran sueño de  tener un horno de ladrillos maquinados.

loans.use: compra de carbón, briqueta y leña

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar D. lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Uuganbayar is 24 and married his wife three years ago. His wife is a big supporter of his business.

Uuganbayar has a small retail business selling secondhand car accessories. He started the business with his parents in early 1995 and the business was passed down to him after his marriage. He has plenty of experience with car accessories and fixes cars by request in his free time.

In the future, he would like to open a full-service car shop where he would be able to fix and diagnose cars. Uuganbayar requests a Kiva loan to buy more secondhand car accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand car accessories for his business.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Mr Komlavi K. est un vieil agriculteur né en 1942 à Adzralakopé. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants, c’est rien que par l’agriculture et principalement la culture du mais qu’il tire les revenus lui permettant de scolariser ses enfants et faire face aux charges de sa famille. Après plusieurs années de cultures, ses terres cultivables s’appauvrissent réduisant considérablement ses rendements. Pour y remédier, il sollicite un financement pour l’achat des engrais. Cela va accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlavi K. is an elderly agriculturist born in 1942 in Adzralakopé. Married and the father of 7 children, he has managed to support his family and send his children to school thanks to farming, principally maize-growing. After many years of crops, his arable land is getting expended, which reduces his yield. To remedy that situation, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. This will increase his yield and his revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
T. Võ Thị (633980789) is a 57 year old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên.  She is married and has six children, who are now adults.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 14000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Elena Patricia M. G., María Auxiliadora Chávez y Blanca Azucena G..

Este grupo es originario del municipio de Tisma, son mujeres conocidas por la actividad económica que realizan, entre ellas tiene mucha confianza y solidaridad. 


Doña Elena Patricia es una joven mujer , casada, con un hijo pequeño, su negocio es la elaboración de venta de cajetas, manjares, dulces, etc. Trabaja con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. El esposo trabaja como comerciante en el mercado y a veces de ayudante en cualquier oficio.
Sueña con poder mejorar su casa y tener un puesto de cajetas en el mercado de masaya.

Doña María Auxiliadora Chávez tiene en su casa una pequeña venta de verduras, helados, refrescos, etc. Ella es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, ayuda a atender a los clientes y a cuidar el negocio. Tiene varios años de experiencia en este negocio y de esto mantiene a su hijo porque ella no tiene esposo.
Sueña con poder mejorar su casa y darle estudio a su hijo.

Doña Blanca Azucena es madre soltera de tres hijos adolescentes que estudian en la escuela cercana a su hogar, se dedica a la venta de cajetas al igual que su otra compañera, vende ambulante en las escuelas y comunidades cercanas. El crédito lo ocupó para comprar los ingredientes como azúcar, frutas, colorantes, etc.
Sueña poder crecer en su negocio para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Elena Patricia M. G., María Auxiliadora Chávez and Blanca Azucena G..
This group is from the Municipality of Tisma and they are women who are known for their businesses. They have a great deal of confidence in each other and work in solidarity.
Elena Patricia is a young married woman with a small child. She makes a living making and selling cajetas (caramel), manjares (delicacies), sweets, etc. She works with ADIM because one of their clients encouraged her to join a solidarity group. She then formed a group with two close friends and received the loan. Her husband works as a merchant in the market and sometimes as an assistant in any kind of work. She dreams of making improvements on her home and of having a cajetas stall in the Masaya market.
María Auxiliadora Chávez has a small store selling vegetables, ice cream, refreshments, etc. in her house. She is the mother of one school aged son who helps her serve customers and look after the business. She has several years experience working in this business, which helps her provide for her son since she does not have a husband. She dreams of making improvements on her home and giving her son an education.
Blanca Azucena is a single mother of three teenagers who attend school near their house. She sells cajetas, just like her colleague, at the schools and in nearby communities on foot. She used the loan to purchase ingredients like sugar, fruits, colourings etc. She dreams of expanding her business in order to improve her children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cajetas and sweets

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es: La Señora Alba María García G. es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer casada tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos, Todos ellos ya independientes. Ella emprende su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el capital con el que dio inicio fue propio por lo que  no fue muy fácil, a pesar de su edad, Alba maneja un triciclo donde transporta su verdura, por lo que a su edad esta es una actividad muy cansada, todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante en las calles, pues ella tiene ciertos clientes que son estables. Con este financiamiento comprara tomates, cebollas, repollo y bananos. Su deseo es establecer su negocio en su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba María García G. works with Fundación Leon 2000. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. All of her children are now independent. She runs her own business of selling fruits and vegetables. Alba rides a tricycle to transport her vegetables. At her age, this is a very tiring activity. Every day she wakes up very early to sell her products, moving from street to street, as she has established relationships with certain customers. With this loan she will buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage and bananas. Her dream is to establish a business in her own humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mr. Chum C. is 25 years old and lives in Sambuor village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land that he uses to cultivate rice. He is also a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Khat Nhoen, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand by purchasing more goods to add to her inventory. Thus, Mr. Chum C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He has a child who is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right in this photo.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to add to the inventory of his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en: Z. Prossy is a 38-year-old married mother of five children, aged 16 – 6 years as she helps to take care of 1 orphan. She has owned and operated a retail grocery shop for 8 years and she is happy to say that her shop is doing so well with the help of loans. She is able to have plenty to sell hence making some good profits that have enabled her to take care of her family for all this long. She needs a loan to be able to save some more money to be able to buy a plot of land so that she and her husband could be able to construct a presentable family house for her children.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more sugar, cooking oil and other confectionaries once given a loan.

loans.name: Sol De Verano_Media Lina Group

texts.es: Seis son los integrantes del grupo Sol de verano_Media Luna, son un grupo unido y alegre. Beatriz de 52 años vende fideo, arroz, azúcar en la Zona Garita, Charo de 29 años vende verduras en la Max Paredez, Noemí de 18 años elabora muñecos, Eusebio de 62 años vende ropa en difernetes ferias y Victoria y Evelin venden productos al crédito. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería y ofrecer productos variados  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are six members of the group “Sol de Verano, Media Luna” (Summer Sun, Half Moon). They are a united and happy group. Beatrice, 52 years old, sells rice and sugar in the Garita Zone. Charo, 29 years old, sells vegetables in the “Max Paredez”. Noemî, eighteen years old, makes dolls. Eusebio, 62 years old, sells clothes in different fairs and Victoria and Evelin sell products on credit. All of them need a loan to buy merchandise and to offer a variety to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Orvilia

texts.es:
La señora Ovilia C. vive sola en su casita, ya que sus hijos están casados, ella es pensionada y también percibe otro ingreso ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa seminueva tales como vestidos, ropa casual, calzado etc.
Por tal motivo de inversión ella esta solicitando este crédito, para la compra de mas mercancía por mayoreo y poder seguirle ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen producto a un bajo precio.
texts.en:
Ovilia C. lives alone is her little house because her children are married. She receives a pension, and she has another income from selling almost new clothes like dresses, casual clothes, and footwear, etc. She is asking for this loan to buy more wholesale merchandise to be able to keep offering her customers a good product at a low price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gloria Delfina

texts.es:
Gloria  es socia del Bancomunal Jadat, es casada, tiene 59 años, tres hijos mayores que viven con ella pero en ambientes diferentes D. su casa.
Gloria decidió trabajar por necesidad y le gusta, se dedica a cuidar niños, y también se dedica a la venta D.  ropa interior. 
En Finca ella pudo crecer económicamente, tiene mas capital para trabajar, esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan, por eso ella se esfuerza en los pagos.
Gloria necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. mercadería D. ropa interior para hombres, mujeres y  niños.
El sueño D. Gloria es poner una lavandería al peso en su casa.

loans.use: compra de mercadería de ropa interior

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Yanira is a 36-year-old borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group “Fe y Amor” (Faith and Love), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

The area around La Romana is dominated by the Dominican Republic’s vast sugar fields. Electricity is scarce and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Yanira successfully runs a small stand selling fruit and general household items. With this loan, she plans on buying various merchandise for her stand including fruit, flour, oil, and charcoal to sell to her friends and neighbors.

This is Yanira’s fifth loan with Esperanza International and, with a perfect repayment record so far, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza in order to inject capital into her business and has been successful so far.

With the profits her loan brings, Yanira hopes to purchase her own home someday, even if it is simple. She also hopes to move her business into its own store, continually improving its appearance and offerings. Thank you for lending to Yanira and the Fe y Amor group!

loans.use: To buy fruit, other food, and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E.  is 68 years old and a widow with  3 children. She takes care of her children alone. Patience sells clothes and underwear at retail prices to her customers in Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in this business for a long time and is a hard working woman.This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.  Patience hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and underwear to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Bella Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Segunda es una de las socias del grupo Bella Maria.

Por mucho tiempo la señora Segunda se dedico junto a su esposo ala fabricación de escobas debido a su poca experiencia su fabrica  fracaso a pesar que fue una experiencia muy triste no se desanimaron y nuevamente empezaron pero con otro negocio la venta de productos de limpieza, iniciarse en este negocio no fue nada fácil ya que tuvieron que lidiar con muchos obstáculos  buscar clientes, hacerse conocidos fue una tarea difícil a pesar de todo lograron salir adelante hoy al ver su negocio realizado realmente se sienten orgullosos y muy felices.

La señora Segunda, etiqueta, embolsa y vende  los productos de limpieza. es increíble saber que llevan en ese negocio mas de 30 años, con este trabajo han logrado darle educación para sus hijos ,una de ellas es profesora y otro de sus hijos será chef. eso los llena de felicidad  también ha logrado terminar el primer piso de su casa y para un futuro muy cercano están evaluando la posibilidad de abrir una tienda en su misma casa para ofrecer sus productos directamente al publico, ahora solo lo hacen repartiendo a sus clientes conocidos ambos saben que con una tienda abierta al publico sus ganancias aumentaran  también quieren fabricar sus propios productos  y por que no crear su propia marca , la señora esta muy agradecida a EDAPROSPO por que a través de sus prestamos su negocio a crece poco a poco ahora  usara este préstamo para el mismo fin, comprar mas productos por que tiene pedidos por entregar.

*La señora Segunda aparece sentada al lado izquierdo
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda is one of the members of the Bella Maria ("Beautiful Maria") Group. For a long time Mrs Segunda worked with her husband making brooms. Because of their lack of experience, the business failed. Although it was very sad, they didn’t lose their enthusiasm and started another business selling cleaning products. It wasn’t easy to start this business because they had to overcome many obstacles including finding customers. It was difficult to become known, but despite these problems they succeeded and today feel very proud and happy to see the success of their business. Mrs. Segunda labels, wraps and sells the cleaning products. It’s amazing to realize that they have been working for 30 years in this business and have been able to educate their children. One of them is a teacher and another will become a chef. This fills them with happiness. They have also been able to finish the first floor of their house. In the near future they are looking at the possibility of opening a store in their house so that they can sell the products directly to the public. Currently they only sell to the customers that they know. Both of them realize that their profits will increase and they would like to make their own products. And why not have their own brand? Mrs. Segunda is very grateful to EDAPROSPO because with their loans, their business has expanded little by little. She will use this loan for the same purpose, to buy more products since she has orders to fulfill. *Mrs. Segunda is seated on the left side.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning products

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Y., 51, owns a large plantation which she inherited from her grandparents. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is married. Two of their daughters are employed: one has been working in the sewing industry for years and the other is a rattan weaver. 

On her farmland, Sam Y. and her husband plant potatoes and other crops, which they sell. Besides growing crops, her husband is skilled at making wooden beds.  He wants to use his knowledge to earn more income for his family, but he doesn’t have enough money to start a business. Therefore, Sam Y. has decided to borrow money on Kiva for her husband to use as capital to buy planks and carpentry equipment so that he can begin making beds for sale.

loans.use: to buy planks and carpentry equipment to begin making beds for sale

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 6 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers depuis maintenant des années. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, cinq rouleaux de tissus et de merceries, 3 sacs de 50Kg d’oignon, des cartons de spaghettis et des boites de concentrées de tomate à Bamako, 4 cartons de poissons fumé à Mopti, des sacs de céréales à Fana et une grande quantité de bananes à N’Golobouou et Banko. Tous les produits sont revendus au marché de Fana et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 34 500FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djiguisseme are married women averaging 50 years of age and six children each.  With their husband and children, the women live in large traditional families and reside in Fana City, Fana Coura district, Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  The women know one another through ties of community and kinship.  For several years, they have operated in the commerce of a variety of goods. These group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of ensuring the continuation of their lucrative businesses and are now on their tenth solidarity loan.  All the preceding loans have been properly repaid.  With this new loan, they intend to buy five rolls of cloth and some sewing supplies, three 50-kg sacks of onions, some boxes of spaghetti and boxes of tomato paste in Bamako, four boxes of smoked fish in Mopti, some sacks of grain in Fana, and a large quantity of bananas in N’Golobouou and Banko. All of these goods are sold at the Fana marketplace and at fairs in the area to customers composed of women and men. The group members each plan on realizing an average profit of 34,5000 francs CFA per month.  The profits are partly reinvested into the businesses and partly for day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth, fish, condiment, fruit, and grain

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 47 ans elle mariée et mère de sept enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Pakour1 depuis un an. Elle possède d'une table où elle vend divers produits alimentaires tels que des légumes comme des choux, des oignons, du piment séché et d'autres épices. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne et à la santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of seven dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Pakour1 for one year. She owns a table where she sells various food items such as vegetables (such as cabbage and onions), dried hot peppers, and other spices. She contributes to the daily expenses and health needs of her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Aleyda Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Villanueva en el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Aleyda R. se ha desempeñado como maestra de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio del municipio donde a diario ella imparte clase a los pequeños con el propósito de obtener los ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella es soltera y tiene a su cargo el cuido y protección de su mamá por lo que el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de los medicamentos de su mamá que ha estado un poco afectada de salud pero Aleyda tiene las esperanzas de que mejorará. Espera que el crédito sea otorgado y así mejorará las condiciones de vida de su amada madre.
texts.en:
Aleyda R. works as an elementary school teacher in a small elementary school in Villanueva, Chinandega department. She imparts knowledge every day to the children hoping to earn enough income to support her household. She is single but has her mother's care and protection in her hands. The loan requested is to buy medicines for her mother who has been a bit unwell. Aleyda hopes, however, that she will recover. She hopes that the loan will be approved so that her dear mother's living conditions will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine for her mother.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria joined CEVI in January. She wants to avail herself of its financial services because she needs additional capital for her rice farm. She is 58 years old, married, and has eight children. She owns a hectare of rice field, which she and her husband maintain. The farm still needs supplies, so she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000. This loan will go far towards buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy I. is a farmer. As the head of the family, he thinks of ways to provide his family with an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. He is busy in the farm. He has been tilling it for many years now. He would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: María Hermelinda

texts.es:
María Hermelinda es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Punto Nueve, un sector agrícola que se encuentra situado dentro del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora en su domicilio, adicionalmente también las distribuye en los domicilios de sus clientes, previo pedido. Este negocio le provee de ingresos extras para solventar los gastos familares ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Este es el motivo principal por el que María Hermelida se esfuerza al máximo para mantener su negocio.

El negocio ya esta gozando de muy buena acogida, por lo que María Hermelinda siente que ha llegado el momento de ampliarlo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200  nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para elaboración de chicha y de mas cerveza para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer emprenderora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es podr brindarle a sus menores hijos la oportunidad de llevar algun tipo de estudio superior.
texts.en:
María Hermelinda is a 33-year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Punto Nueve area, an agricultural sector found within the Mochumí district, in Lambayeque province, about a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years she has worked selling beer and chica de jora (Andean fermented drink -like corn beer) in her home. Currently she also sells them to customers by order. This business has provided extra income to help with family expenses. Her husband, like most of the men in this area, works as a farm laborer and the money that he receives isn’t enough to cover the household expenses. This is why María Hermelida does her utmost to keep the business going. The business is doing well now and so María Hermelida feels that it’s the time to expand. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 new soles that she plans on using to buy ingredients to make chicha and more beer to reach her goal. She is a hard-working businesswoman and very responsible. Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her children the opportunity of having some type of higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chicha and beer so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la couture, mais n’ayant pas trouvé de moyen pour ouvrir son propre atelier, elle s’est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce des articles de mercerie. Sa clientèle  se compose de toutes personnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, son stock est en baisse. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES pour la deuxième fois un crédit pour l’achat de popeline, de satins et de mousselins.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè demakpoe à Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew as a trade. But not being able to afford her own workshop, she got started in sewing supplies business in 2000.  Her customer base is compose of any and all people.  She gets her supplies from the big market Lomé.  Having a low inventory and wanting to replenish it, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for a second time in order to buy some poplins, satins, and muslins.   She is married and the mother of one child.  She lives with her family in the Agoè Demakpoe district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying poplin, satin, and muslin cloths

loans.name: Jose Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. R.  es un taxista que vive en el municipio del Viejo.
El va a utilizar el crédito para  Reparación y mantenimiento del Mismo.
Actualmente ha tenido 6 créditos los cuales todos los ha pagado bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución  ya que se siente muy satisfecho por toda la ayuda que le han dado así como también ha tenido mejoría en sus ingresos ya que dándole un bien mantenimiento a su Taxi le esta asegurando una larga vida para la alimentación  de su hogar diario.
texts.en:
El Sr. R. es un taxista que vive en el municipio del Viejo. El va a utilizar el crédito para Reparación y mantenimiento del Mismo. Actualmente ha tenido 6 créditos los cuales todos los ha pagado bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que se siente muy satisfecho por toda la ayuda que le han dado así como también ha tenido mejoría en sus ingresos ya que dándole un bien mantenimiento a su Taxi le esta asegurando una larga vida para la alimentación de su hogar diario.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mantenimiento y Reparación de Taxi

loans.name: Adora

texts.en: Adora C. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Adora is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adora owns and operates a business providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Adora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Adora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase scrap wood to sell. Adora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Adora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Chy

texts.en: Mr. Chy C. is a villager in Taok Ma village in Kandal province and he is 40 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Kha Sok, are farmers who rent a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. So to improve their family's living conditions, they want to start a new business but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Chy C. is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. He is a father of six children. Two of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory, three of the children are attending the local public school, and one is too young to work or study. His wife appears in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro, con el cual compro su carro para repartir sus productos.
Julia tiene 64 años y 3 hijos que estudian, Julia Junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su casa, su taller cuenta con maquinaria necesaria, sus trabajos son con contrata D. personas particulares y D. instituciones, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Julia ayuda en el lijado D. los muebles. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. madera.
Julia sueña con comprar una granuladora para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the New Life Communal Bank and what she likes most are the ease of obtaining a loan and the incentive to save. With a previous loan she bought a car to distribute her products. Julia is 64 years old and has 3 children who are students. Julia and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house. Their workshop relies on necessary machinery. Their projects are through contracts with private individuals and institutions. They carry out this activity with the aid of their children. Julia helps in the sanding of the furniture. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of wood. Julia dreams of buying a sanding machine to use in the workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for their carpentry shop

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 58 años, es un padre muy amoroso, hace varios años enviudo, ahora vive en su casa propia a lado de sus hijos. El oficio que tiene es el de albañil, desde hace 30 años se especializa en revestidos de paredes y pisos y colocación de mayólicas. De esa manera sus clientes reconocen el trabajo que y por ello es muy solicitado. En un inicio empezó como ayudante de albañil y con el pasar del tiempo ganó experiencia, desde entonces cuenta con personal que lo ayude en las obras grandes y complejas de esa manera puede entregar a tiempo el trabajo. Disfruta mucho su labor, sin embargo a veces no cuenta con material suficiente que lo ayude en el trabajo, por lo que ha perdido varios contratos. Su mayor anhelo es construir el segundo piso de su casa y ofrecerles capital para que puedan trabajar sus hijas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficiosos para comprar sus herramientas de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa comprar tablones resistentes para  abarcar todos los techados que tiene que hacer, así podrá aumentar sus rentas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 58 years old and a living father. He became a widower several years ago and currently lives in his home with his children. He has been working as a builder for 30 years and he specialises in finishing walls and flats and installing majolica slabs. His clients know his work and he is in good demand. He started off as a junior bricklayer and he progressively acquired experience. He now has staff to help him with larger and complex building works so he can finish on time. He really enjoys his job; however, sometimes he does not have enough material for certain projects and because of this he has missed out on a number of contracts. His main aspiration is to build the second floor of his home and provide his daughters with some capital so that they can work. This is his third loan with MFP and is aware that it will enable him to buy work tools, so he is committed to pay all instalments. With the loan he plans to buy resistant planks to cover all the roofing he has to do, so he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy planks for roofing.

loans.name: Banard

texts.en:
Banard is a 36-year-old married man with two children. To earn a living, he sells timber. He has engaged in this business for eight years. He was previously doing construction work to earn a living. From this earlier experience, he got the idea of opening a timber yard, since there was a need for timber in his local community.

Banard, a member of the Prosper group in Faulu Kenya, is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to purchase an additional stock of timber for re-sale purposes. He hopes to open another business in the future to generate additional income. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional timber

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A., 57 years old, is from the village of Bagacay, Sibutad. She is married and has three adult children.

Rosario sells fruits in the local community to make a living. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3700 PHP a month.

Rosario joined PMPC in 2010 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 3000 PHP, which she will use as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her fruit vending business.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Pastor F. O. tiene  42 años es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la zona de la colorada radial 13 zona sud de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra.

El se dedica a la construcción como albañil, por el momento trabaja en la construcción de un mercado en la zona de la radial 10 zona de la Villa Primero de Mayo. El cuenta con escasos recursos por los cuales no puede arreglar su propio vehículo en el cual se desplaza a su trabajo ya que esta zona queda lejos de su casa  y en este invierno el transporte publico se hace escasos. Es por este motivo que el necesita arreglar su vehículo ya que también le sirve de una herramienta de trabajo alternativa ya que cuando no trabaja como albañil utiliza su automóvil y trabaja como Taxista.

Su Mayor sueño es poder en un futuro poder formar una familia y construir una casa para su familia con sus propias manos.
texts.en:
El señor Pastor F. O. is 42 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in zone La Colorada Radial 13, south of the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. He is a builder. At the moment, he is building a market in zone Radial 10, zone of the Villa Primero de Mayo. Because he has limited resources, he is unable to fix his car. Thus, he can't get to work because zone Radial 10 is far from his home and public transportation this winter is very limited. In addition, he has used his car as a taxi to provide himself with other work when he wasn't working in construction. His biggest dream is to form a family and build a house for his family with his own hands.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, D. 59 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive en casa D. su hija, junto a sus 2 nietos. En vista que su hija venD. cosméticos decidió ayudarla, al cabo D. un año, realiza por cuenta propia pedidos D. estos productos D. belleza.  DesD. entonces y luego D. atender a sus nietos, se dispone a vender su mercadería a su familia y amistades que tiene, D. esa forma realiza su trabajo. Le gusta mucho el negocio que tiene, ya que le hace ser independiente y generarse sus propios ingresos, además que disfruta mucho D. la compañía D. sus amistades y D. la gente con quien conversa para ofrecer el producto que venD.. En adelante anhela  ampliar su negocio, y retomar sus cultivos D. papa en su pueblo, donD. dice, la vida que llevaba era muy bonita. Este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es D. mucha utilidad, por lo que se  compromete en pagar  sus cuotas oportunamente.Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar diversos productos D. belleza, D. esta manera piensa abastecer los pedidos pendiente que tiene.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 59, is a very hard-working mother. She lives at home with her daughter and her two grandchildren. In light of the fact that her daughter sells cosmetics, she decided to help her. At the end of a year she had her own orders for these beauty products. From then on, after taking care of her grandchildren, she sells her merchandise to her family and friends. That is how she works. She likes the business that she has a lot. It makes her independent, and she generates her own income. Also, she really likes the company of her friends and the people she talks with in order to offer the product that she sells. In the future she would like to expand her business. She would also like to grow potato crops in her village again. That way of life was very nice. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that it is very useful to her. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the requested loan to buy diverse beauty products. That way she plans to fill the pending orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock more cosmetics

loans.name: Bebesa

texts.en:
Bebesa P. is from the village of Madalag. She is 43 years old. Bebesa is married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Bebesa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Bebesa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 300 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2008, Bebesa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients for food production. Bebesa is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP which will also be used to purchase ingredients for food production. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food production

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Olga Francisca

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y  mujeres hermosas.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Olga, ella está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 14 años y dice que siempre han estado junto a ella para ayudarla a crecer en su negocio, por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 59 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijas todas mayores de edad, todas viven con ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de cojines, confecciona distintos diseños y modelos en las fundas de los cojines, los que se pueden dar para diferentes usos como almohadas, para muebles y hasta diseños para los novios ya que  siempre le compran porque son un lindo obsequio, estos los elabora con plumón para que queden mas suavecitos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 20h00, estos productos los fabrica y los envía a Quininde y Quito y allá su hermana se encarga de venderlos, también entrega en Calceta a un bazar ya que tienen mucha demanda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la fabricación de sus productos. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller más  grande y poder enviar sus productos al exterior ya que dice que sus cojines son los mejores en el mundo.
texts.en:
In the lovely city of Calceta, known for its hard-working people and beautiful women, the San Agustín Village Bank meets every fifteen days.

That's where we met Olga, who has been with the village bank for fourteen years. She says the bank has always been there to help her grow in her business, so she really appreciates Fundación Espoir.  Olga is fifty-nine, married, and has five grown children, who all live with her.  Her husband is in agriculture.

Olga makes and sells cushions.  She sews different designs on the cushion covers to serve a variety of purposes, including for pillows, furniture and even for couples getting married; people buy those designs all the time because they make nice gifts, and Olga makes them with down so they'll be softer.  She works Monday through Friday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  She sends her products to Quininde and Quito where her sister sells them.  She also brings things to a bazaar in Calceta because there's a lot of demand there.

Olga plans to use her loan to buy materials to make her cushions.  

Her dream is to have a bigger workshop and to be able to send her products internationally because she says her cushions are the best in the world.

loans.use: To buy fabric, down, thread, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Salimchon

texts.ru: Салимов Салимчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Высшего образования не имеет. Салимчон  предоставляет услугу, такси по маршруту Вахдат-Душанбе и Душанбе-Вахдат. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для приобретения автомашины.
texts.en: Salimchon S. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 26 years old, married and has no children.  He lives together with his parents.  He does not have a higher education.  Salimchon provides a taxi service on the Vahdat-Dushanbe, Dushanbe-Vahdat route.  He has been in this business for 3 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a car.

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita D. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 56 years old. Angelita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is for four members who are living in Krabau village in Kandal province. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their families. The members in this group have selected Mrs. Tha M., 31 years old, as group leader.  

Mrs. Tha M. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sarat Mak, is a soldier who earns a salary to support his family. She has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Currently, her house is not very comfortable because it has no electricity. To improve this condition, Mrs. Tha M. is applying for a loan to buy some electric supplies to connect her house to the electric power lines.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies to connect her house to a power source

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio es una padre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Bajo Cruceta del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta en base de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Usualmente cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral.

Esta actividad es la más importante fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, por ello siempre trata de cuidarla del mejor modo posible. Actualmente el desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de estos animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Policarpio, 46, is a father living with his wife and three children in the Bajo Cruceta settlement in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a zone in Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He has some small farm animals that he raises in his yard.  He feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they reach ideal development levels he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  He has most recently raised sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl.

This activity is his most important source of income so he always tries to do the best job possible to care for it.  He wants to get nutritionally balanced feed to improve their growth and get higher sale prices.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan that will help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K. is marrried and has two children. Mercy sells onions, as well as and women and children clothing, at Takoradi market.  She has been in this business for two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mercy will use the loan to buy more children and women clothing for resale. She plans to buy a piece of land from her increased capital.

In the picture, on her lap are some clothing on a tray.

loans.use: To buy children and women clothing for resale

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 15 femmes issues du meme quartier. le groupe a été composé par affinité entre ses membres et sur la base de confiance. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

Madame THIECKA D. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, en écharpe blanche est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge.

Elle fait le petit commerce de colliers en perle et de tissu. Elle fait aussi de la coiffure dans son quartier.

Avec le prêt reçu elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises

son objectif est de renforcer son épargne , et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 15 women, all living in the same neighborhood. They have set up their group due to affinity and trust shared by its members. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga.

Mrs Thiecka D., standing far right in the photo and wearing a white scarf, chairs the group. She is 46 years old and the mother of five children in her care.

She has a small store in which she sells pearl necklaces and fabrics. She offers also hairdressing services in her neighborhood. She will use her loan to strengthen her activity and buy more supplies for her hairdressing business.

Her goal is to save more money and support her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Las Tres Marías esta compuesto por tres integrantes todas mujeres, La representante  es la Srta. Elvia realiza la venta de cosméticos, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres trabaja de lunes a sábado, es vendedora ambulante va a distintas instituciones a ofrecer sus productos es una persona muy amable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos por mayor que se encuentren en oferta, las otras dos componentes se dedican a la venta de accesorios para celulares  en Cochabamba y sacaba ofrecen de lunes a sábado  tienen varios clientes fijos , el préstamo lo invertirán para aumentar  su mercadería para así variar sus productos, todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Las Tres Marias [The Three Marias] solidarity group is made up of three members, all women. The representative is Miss Elvia. She sells cosmetics. She is single, lives in her parents'  home, and works from Monday to Saturday. She sells door to door, and goes to different locations to offer her products. She is a very likable and hard-working person.

She will use this loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics that are currently on sale. The other two members sell accessories for cell phones in Cochabamba Monday to Saturday. They have various fixed customers. They will use this loan to increase their merchandise in order to have varied stock. All of the members are grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Ana Theresa

texts.en:
Ana Theresa B. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ana Theresa owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community, like pork adobo & afritada. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ana Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. 

Ana Theresa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like pork, vegetables & spices. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ana Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
