HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for restaurant

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and lives with six family members. In 2009, Haidar opened a food market in his area where competition is minimal. He has a good reputation and he is well known.

Haidar is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop, buy an air conditioner and install an external ceiling and a sign for his shop. He is planning to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop, buy an air conditioner and install an external ceiling and a sign for the shop

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose M. owns Twin Rivers Construction, a company specializing in residential building and remodeling.  Jose is a U.S. Army veteran.  He has been operating Twin Rivers Construction off-and-on since 1995, when he finished his first active duty stint with the U.S. Army.  Jose ran Twin Rivers Construction, in addition to having other jobs, for six years until he was recalled to active duty following the September 11th attacks.

After retiring from the U.S. Army in 2005, Jose got a job driving a truck, only to find his veteran’s disabilities prevented him from meeting the job’s physical requirements.  Jose returned to his construction part-time job while he studied to be a pharmacy technician through the G.I. Bill.  After graduating and being unable to find work in his new specialty, Jose continued his construction business full-time.

An El Paso native, Jose learned to work with his hands as a small child when he would help his father with projects around the house.  He says he likes construction because he likes putting things together.  Though Jose originally intended Twin Rivers to be a commercial construction company, he moved to residential construction because he could be paid faster for his work.  Jose has one employee, who is also a military veteran and is Jose’s neighbor.  

Jose heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana through the Veteran’s Administration.  He is using this loan to better advertise his business, as well as have a cushion for operating expenses.  He has made new business cards and wants to start advertising his business through local media outlets.  Until now, Jose has relied on word-of-mouth advertising to generate business.  He uses a referral system that rewards his clients for recommending him.  He hopes his new commercial advertising efforts will grow his business to better sustain himself and his employee.

loans.use: Advertisement, cushion for operating expenses

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Elsie is married. Elsie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling health & medicinal or supplementary products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional supplementary products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplementary products to sell

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
El cliente Aquilino M. Lanuza. Vive en la Comarca san Nicolas del municipio de Achuapa del departamento de león, no tiene hijo bajo su cargo y la actividad de la que el cliente se dedica principal mente es a la ganadería donde produce la leche y la vende al mercado, es de esa forma que sobre vive, ya que cuenta con su propio inventario ganadero, donde tiene su propia finca, para abastecerlo en la alimentación de su ganado. 
 La cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia, su propia finca.
 El destino del crédito fue la compra de pacas para la alimentación de ganado en época de invierno, ya que esto le permite suministrarle una alimentación val ansiada y mejorar su producción de leche, con el objetivo de obtener una mayor producción y abastecer a su familia en sus gastos familiares. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y llegar a producir más producto lácteo, para el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Aquilino M. L.lives in San Nicolas region, in Achuapa, in León department.  He does not have any children in his care.  Auqilino's main business is raising cattle.  His cows produce milk which he sells in the market.  This is how he gets by.  He owns his own cattle and has his own farm which he stocks with feed for his animals.  He owns his own home and his own farm.

Aquilino will use his loan to buy bales of hay to feed his cattle over the winter.  This allows him to provide his animals with balanced feed and improves his milk production with the goal of obtaining more milk and covering his family's expenses.  This will allow him to keep his farm in a better condition and produce more milk, for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. runs a food stand in the town of Mfuom, which is located near the larger city of Abura. She has been running this business for the last three years and in this photograph we see her preparing fufu, which is a Ghanaian staple made from cassava. She is married, has three children, and works hard to help her husband support her household and pay their children's school fees. She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more of the ingredients she needs to make fufu.

loans.use: to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make fufu.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
In the photo is Agripina M. I. and her three-year-old son.  For three years, Agripina has been operating a salon.  She also relies on her husband, who is a driver, for financial support.  

Agripina says that before she joined Faulu Kenya, she had only one blow dryer machine and didn’t have a business premise.  Now, she is happy because she has an equipped salon.  In five years, she hopes to open a hair dressing school and a cosmetics shop.   She has requested for 50,000 Kes to buy Tong set, hair braids, pony tails and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Piledrina

texts.en:
Piledrina is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Piledrina is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Piledrina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Piledrina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Piledrina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Piledrina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the first loan taken out by Piledrina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.en:
Eva, age 30, is a grade school teacher, but she also has a cosmetics business, selling products to a wide network of friends and referrals. She has been working in both of these careers for the last two years, and hopes to save enough so that she and her husband can start a family in the near future. 

This loan will assist Eva to buy more products to sell, including perfumes, which will be particularly popular gift items during the upcoming family-focused holidays.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products, including perfumes, to offer for sale

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
La enfermedad de la madre de Javier ocasionó en la familia problemas económicos debido a los gastos que ello les representó, lo que debilitó notablemente el negocio de postres que desde hace algunos años le genera los ingresos a este luchador y a su esposa pues además del dinero requerido para sobrellevar esta situación tuvieron que sacrificar tiempo, lo que les impedía realizar sus labores diarias. 
 
Javier en compañía de su esposa elabora los postres en su casa diariamente todas las mañanas, después en horas de la tarde camina por diferentes sectores de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos. Para recuperarse de dicha situación y lograr nuevamente ganancias derivadas de su labor, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos propios de la elaboración de los postres como gelatina, leche condensada, crema de leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
His mother's illness brought economic difficulties upon Javier's family owing to the expenses it incurred, which significantly affected the dessert business that for a number of years has generated income for this fighter and his wife. In addition to the money needed to overcome this situation they had to sacrifice time as well, which kept them from carrying out their daily work. 

Javier, along with his wife, makes desserts daily in his home every morning. Later during the afternoon he walks through various parts of the city offering his products for sale. In order to recover from the aforementioned situation and once again make profits from his efforts, this entrepreneur needs a loan in order to purchase supplies for the making of desserts, including gelatin, condensed milk, cream, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the making of desserts.

loans.name: Carmen Amapola

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca en un sector muy concurrido de esta ciudad, esta localidad  es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida y la variedad de su gastronomía  cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Carmen tiene 47 años, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 15 años de edad que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión topógrafo, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Carmen es comerciante ambulante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, realiza esta actividad hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para tener más variedad. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Triunfadoras (Successful Women).  She lives in the Batan sector of the city of Cuenca.  This is a city with a cold climate, has great architectural and natural beauty, its people are warm and the gastronomic variety captures the palates of visitors and residents.

Mrs, Carmen is 47 years old, married and has a 15 year old daughter that is studying in a school in the city.  Her husband is a topographer.  They do not own their home and live in the house of a family member.

Carmen is a traveling merchant, selling all types of clothing.  She has been doing this for the last 3 years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan through the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of merchandise, such as slacks, blouses, T-shirts and clothing for children, to offer more variety.

Her dream is to own her home.

loans.use: to purchase slacks, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul is 65-year-old man. He is married and the father of three children. He is a hardworking man. Since 2002 he has been running the business of selling legume products at the local market of Isfara city. He purchases his products from Khujand and Kyrgyz Republic. 

He would like to get a loan 9,000 TJS for purchasing products in bulk in order to pay the lower wholesale prices, which allows him to make a good profit.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy legume products in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Greivin

texts.es: Greivin, tiene la edad 22 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su cónyuge, la madre y un sobrino. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para la asistencia de  café. El cuenta con un terreno sembrado de café y pretende invertir en el pago de mano de obra, compra de insumos como abonos, fungicidas para el mantenimiento del cafe y así obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un cafetal que genere ganancias por medio de la producción y asi vender  café de calidad. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Greivin is 22 years old. He lives in a common law marriage and lives with his partner, his mother and one nephew. With this loan he wants to purchase inputs to improve his coffee fields. He has a plot of land that he planted with coffee and he wants to invest in paying for labor and in purchasing inputs such as fertilizers and fungicides to maintain his coffee and have a better harvest. He wants to establish a coffee plantation that generates income by growing coffee and selling a quality product. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his family and to expand her coffee business.

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his coffee fields.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 45 years old and married with five children.

Marcela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her variety store.

Marcela has borrowed and re-paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marcela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es:
Tiburcia nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 45 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos. 

Actualmente, Tiburcia vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella es ama de casa y después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la agricultura. Tiburcia vende cebada, papa, habas, olluco, oca y cebada en unos de los mercados más populosos de la ciudad de Urubamba.

Tiburcia requiere el micro crédito para comprar abono y semillas de olluco.  

El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tiburcia was born in Urubamba Province in the community of Racchi.  She’s 45 years old, married and has five children.

Currently, Tiburcia lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her various economic activities.  Tiburcia is a housewife and after doing her household chores she farms.  Tiburcia sells barley, potatoes, lima beans, olluco [a tuber], and oca [another tuber] in one of the most crowded markets in the city of Urubamba.  Tiburcia needs the micro loan to buy manure and olluco seeds.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets monthly in the community of Racchi in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy manure and 'olluco' [a tuber] seeds.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Omar has operated a fish selling business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Omar faces a major challenge of perishable products, because of poor storage facilities. He dreams of establishing another business in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase a freezer for fish storage. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for fish storage.

loans.name: Purisimo

texts.en:
Purisimo is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Purisimo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Purisimo has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Purisimo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 54 years old and married, with five children.  Matilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Matilde has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Matilde aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a single parent taking care of four children. The loan will serve as additional income to buy maize to make kenkey.

Efua sells kenkey in Elmina. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day.

She divides the risen dough into two. She mixes one part with water to make a porridge-like consistency form cooks it until it is firm, but not fully cooked. She mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey.

loans.use: to buy maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is 26 years old and married with three children. He deals in spare parts for motorcycles and has been in this business for two and a half years. He is faced with a challenge of inflation, which affects his purchasing power and yet he has a high demand for his goods. His business goal is to operate a large-scale spare parts business and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Anatoli wants a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles to meet the high demand.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycles to sell.

loans.name: Naayem

texts.en:
Naayem is a 66-year-old married woman who has worked as a tailor for the past four years. Her house is her business center, and most of her customers feel comfortable going there to make their requests.

Naayem is a hardworking woman. She is proud that she's capable of helping her husband to improve their standard of living. That's why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new machine necessary to improve the quality of her products and increase her productivity in a very short period of time.

Naayem will also invest part of the loan to help her son pay for his wedding as her gift to him.

She is very happy and anxious to take the loan, and hopes to expand her business more as well as to open her own atelier in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 32 años de edad,  vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con sus padres y hermanos; Allí mismo tiene su negocio de venta de pescados y aguacates, negocio que se dedica desde hace 2 años, aunque su experiencia emprendedora data desde hace 10 años, cuando muy joven, no terminó sus primaria y se dedicó de manera independiente a la venta de jugos naturales y productos fritos.  Con su negocio ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia que depende de él. Su necesidad de crecimiento está manifiesta y siente que cada día le alcanza menos el dinero para responder a su demanda creciente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará en mayor cantidad y de contado, bocachico, mojarra, bagre y aguacates, con esta inversión alcanzará a mejorar su capacidad de compra y atenderá a un mercado,  que ha dejado de atender por que siempre tiene el desafío de un capital de trabajo insuficiente.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 32 years old. He lives in the southwest area of his town with his parents and siblings. From there he runs his business selling fish and avocados. He has been in this business for the last two years, although his enterprising experience dates back 10 years. When he was very young, he interrupted his studies and began independently selling fruit juice and fried goods. With his business he has been able to support his family who depends on him. He has clear need for expansion and he feels that every day there is less money to meet his customers' growing demands. This is the reason why he turns to credikiva, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will purchase "bocachico" (a type of fish), bream, catfish and avocados in bulk and in cash. With this investment he will improve his buying capacity and cater to a market he has not catered to because he is constantly faced with the challenge of an insufficient working capital.

loans.use: to purchase "bocachico" (a type of fish), bream, catfish and avocados in bulk and in cash.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past four years, Sophie has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sophie to generate greater profits and increase in her capital. Sophie hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house.

Sophie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sophie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida, de nuevo solicita un préstamo para aprovechar la época navideña y comprar harina, azúcar, maíz para la elaboración de pan dulce y quesadillas y a si venderlas en los hogares de los clientes. 
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo,porque pudo mejorar la produccion y pudo observar como aumentaron en sus ganancias y su familia ha mejorado las condiciones de vida que tenían antes.
texts.en:
Cándida is again seeking a loan so that she can take advantage of the approaching Christmas season. She wishes to bake pan dulce (a sweet bread) and quesadillas to take round to her customers’ homes. 

She believes that the previous loan helped her as she was able to increase production and see her income increase. Her family’s standard of living is now better than it was before.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and corn for her baking needs

loans.name: Teofilo Cesario

texts.es:
Teofilio Cesario tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y los dos hijos de 21 y 22 años de edad en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Teofilio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para arrendar más terreno y comprar abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá arrendar más terreno. El sueño es comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar los productos y poder venderlos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Teofilio Cesario is 42 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and his two children, who are 21 and 22 years old, in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Teofilio is a member of "LA UNION" community bank which is located in Aguas Frías, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Teofilio is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.

Teofilio is requesting this loan to rent more land and to buy manure, fertilizers and urea.  This loan will enable him to rent more land.  His dream is to buy a truck so that he can transport and sell his produce.

In his free time, Teofilio enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to rent more land and to buy fertilizers, manure and urea

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 47 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad Chincha con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todo sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta  de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como vigilante de un condominio en su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor brindando servicios de seguridad, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el empeño que pone a su labor.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias  a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de parte de su casa, ya que lamentablemente su vivienda se destruyo en el último terremoto sufrido en su ciudad y él y su familia viven en un pequeño módulo de madera; de esta manera Luis espera tener su hogar en mejores condiciones, brindando mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logar su gran sueño de poder darles mayores oportunidades y una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para relizar la construccion de su vivienda.

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 69 years old and a married father of six children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Charles has been a farmer for more than 40 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Charles wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Charles hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 7 solar lights. Even though Charles decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Raziel

texts.en:
Raziel works hard to support  children. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Raziel requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Raziel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onyango, a staff member for Kiva and Village Enterprise Fund in Uganda

Pricila is a Japadhola by tribe and she comes from the North Eastern part of Tororo District in Eastern Uganda. She lives in the grass thatched house in the village.

She got a grant of 100$ US from VEF and she started by selling of fish right away after fishing. Most fish mongers got to know her. So a number of them could buy fish from her.

After attending training on business skills twice, she got wide knowledge on how to choose and run business effectively. She then shifted to buy fish as a fish monger.

Her business picked up very much and he got enough profits to buy large number of fish and selling it. She now moves from the fishing site to come and sell the fish in town in large quantities.

I expect her to do better business to bring development in the lives of our people who are beneficiaries of his business.

loans.use: Buy Fish

loans.name: Gulalai

texts.en:
Gulalai is 49 years old  and lives with her 4 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She has a shared business with her husband and wants to take a loan for him. She cleans and feeds the sheeps and cows and her husband sells  their meat in the bazaar.

Gulalai's husband has a butcher shop near her home area. They are happy to be able to take a loan from AFSG - through this process their business can grow and they can get a good income.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows

loans.name: Leontina Felismina

texts.en:
Leontina Felismina C., 39 years old, native of Chidenguele, province of Gaza, grew up with her parents, and only studied through the 4th level.

Since 1990, she has been taking care care of her family's business and has 2 commercial establishments in the district of Campoane. As of last year, 2006, through friends in the Campoane market, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema, and requested a loan at the start of April to expand her business. With the loan, she plans to increase the volume of her business, offering better quality products, and a better quantity, to the community, and thus increasing her monthly revenue.

The impact of her activity is visible in the community, since it ensures the supply of basic goods and self-employment to support her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Campoane - Boane

Cliente: Leontina Felismina C.

Sector de actividade: Comercio

Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$)

Aplicação de montante: Compra e venda de produtos

Inicio: 10/04/2007

Fim: 31/03/2008

Leontina Felismina C., de 39 anos de idade, natural de Chidenguele, provincial de Gaza cresceu na responsabilidade, apenas estudou até 4@ classe.

Desde o ano 1990 vem assumindo a gestão do negocio da família e possui 2 estabelecimentos comerciais no bairro de Campoane. A partir do ano passado 2006 por indicações de amigos do mercado Campoane teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo solicitado um empréstimo no principio de Abril para ampliação do negocio.

Com o empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume de negocio, oferecendo produtos de melhor qualidade e quantidade a comunidade, aumentando desta forma a sua renda mensal.

O impacto da sua actividade é visível na comunidade, pois garante o abastecimento de produtos básicos e auto emprego para sustento da sua familia.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es:
Guillermo is been living in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas for the past 21 years, he is originally from Tampico. He moved there looking for better opportunities. He lives in cohabitation and he has four children. In order to offer them a better quality of life Guillermo decided to start his own business of selling footwear and backpacks. He has a unit on the market and he has done well with the sales. Regrettably, his mother fell ill and the medicines that she needs are very costly, Guillermo wants his business to grow, therefore he is asking for a loan of $275 that he will use to buy merchandise to increase the sales and profits. He only wishes the best for his family and he puts a lot effort to do it, you can contribute to the growth of this business, he are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 21 años Guillermo radica en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, él es originario de Tampico, pero cambio su residencia en busca de mejores oportunidades. Él vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos, para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida Guillermo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y mochilas, tiene un local en el mercado y le ha ido muy bien con las ventas. Lamentablemente su madre enfermó y los medicamentos que requiere son muy costosos, Guillermo desea hacer crecer su negocio para lo que solicita un préstamo de $275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas y utilidades. Él solo quiere lo mejor para su familia y se esfuerza mucho para conseguirlo, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo Phov, age 32, farms his land and sells the vegetables, making $2 per day in income. His wife works in a garment factory, earning about $3 per day. They have three children who are students. He would like to borrow $500 in order to build a new home to house his growing family. He is pictured in the photo standing on the land where he would like to build his home.

loans.use: To build a home for his growing family.

loans.name: Tafaoganiua

texts.en: Tafaoganiua is 35 years old, married and has two children. She runs a plantation and sells her crops in the local market, where she earns a profit of 240 Tala (or $96) every week. Tafaoganiua has applied for a loan to buy the tools and fertilizers she needs to run her business. These supplies will be extremely helpful to her and especially to her husband, who does most of the manual work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Mary Crisleyda

texts.en:
Mary is twenty-seven years old and she and her husband have two children.  Mary's husband works as a mechanic and her young son and daughter, three and one years old respectively, stay at home with mom.

Mary sells clothing and fashion products to the women in her community.  From her home,  she offers women’s dress shoes, pants, blouses, and a selection of silver jewelry.  With her loan, Mary plans on adding more silver bracelets, necklaces and earrings, which she believes will increase her profit margin.  Mary explains that as her business becomes more established she hopes she can ensure that her children receive an education and maintain her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry and women's clothing to expand home business.

loans.name: Paulina Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Paulina Maria is 44 years old. She left school after fifth grade. She has three children, two of whom still economically depend on her. She lives in the Mache district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state.

She opened up a small store at her house where she sells groceries such as sugar, rice, oil, noodles, etc. She also raises guinnea pigs, sheeps and chicken, which she sells on the Julcán fair on Sundays.

She also purchases cows and pigs to sell their meat at the Mache district. Her storage was very small and she had very few products for sale. Thanks to the loan she got from the “Women at Work” comunal bank she was able to expand it. With her first loan was of S/. 300.00 she purchased rice, sugar and noodles. With the S/.1,000.00, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 18 small pigs to fatten them and sell them alive or sacrifice them.

Her dream is to be a great entrepeneur, to sell wholesale and regular groceries around Mache and Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paulina María tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, en total tiene 3 hijos y aún 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. En su domicilio ha colocado una tienda donde vende abarrotes como azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, etc., también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ovejas y gallinas, los cuales vende los domingos en la feria de Julcán, asimismo compra reses y cerdos para la venta de su carne, esto lo distribuye en el camal y en los restaurantes del distrito de Mache. Su bodega era muy pequeña y tenía pocos productos y gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido en el banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” ha podido implementarla. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 y con este dinero compró arroz, azúcar y fideos. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 18 cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos vivos o sacrificarlos posteriormente. El sueño de la señora Paulina es ser una gran empresaria, vender abarrotes al por mayor y menor por Mache y la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Compra de animales (cerdos)

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
Don Santos is a native of the community of San José de los Ríos. He dedicates himself to agriculture. He spends the majority of his time on pineapple production in the fertile lands of Ticuantepe, where the climate is very favorable for the harvest of said product. He possesses 20 years experience in the cultivation of pineapple, which involves an artisan manufacturing process that requires a lot of investment since the maintenance of of land must be paid for constantly. Also the land must be fumigated so that said harvest is not destroyed. The earnings that he obtains from the sale of his products vary according to the time at which products are harvested. His earnings go toward surviving and supporting his three children and his wife, who takes care of the kids and their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Santos es originario de la comunidad de San José de los Ríos, se dedica a la agricultura, su actividad principal en la que basa su mayor tiempo es a la producción de piña, producto asentado en las fértiles tierras de Ticuantepe, en donde el clima le es muy favorable para cosechar dicho producto, posee 20 años de experiencia en el cultivo de la piña, el cual conlleva un proceso artesanal manufacturero que requiere de mucha inversión, ya que el mantenimiento de las manzanas de tierra deben de abonarse constantemente así como también fumigar para que dicha cosecha no se dañe, los ingresos que obtiene por la venta de su producto varían de acuerdo a la época en que saca la producción, para poder sobrevivir y mantener a sus tres hijos y a su esposa, quien cuida de los hijos y la vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers and insecticides to prevent pests or fungi.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina I., Zakia M., Rehema M., Mariam O. and Helleni K. make up the Saana group. For ten years, Amina I., the group leader, has run a shop selling traditional medicine. She travels in different parts of the country selling her products, and getting the medicine, as most of it is made from herbs. She and her group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase medicine to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose L. is married with four children. She began selling shoes in 1993.  Every day, Rose works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Hougouhoin

texts.fr:
Born in 1982 in Djrékpoba (Prefecture of Vo), Mr. Hougouhoin T. lives and works as a barber in the same village. Unmarried and childless, he is able to meet his needs through his job. Having run into an obstacle, a lack of apprentices, his work is slowing down gradually. For his stability and job security, he is asking for a loan in order to open a barbershop and obtain work supplies. He is very confident that this job will be very profitable insofar as dealing with his difficulties.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1982 à Djrékpoba (préfecture de Vo), monsieur Hougouhoin T. vit dans le même village et exerce son métier de coiffure. Célibataire et sans enfant il arrive à répondre à ses besoins par la coiffure. Ayant remarqué un obstacle, manque d’apprenti, le métier freine son allure pas à pas. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de son boulot, il sollicite un apport financier pour ouvrir un atelier et s’équiper en matériels de travail. Il est très confiant que ce métier lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il répond aux difficultés.

loans.use: To open a barbershop and buy work supplies

loans.name: Basilidesa Hidelisa's Group

texts.en:
Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank.

Hidelisa is married and has 3 children over 18. She dedicates herself to selling clothes and cakes. She also sells cosmetics. She has several businesses, she never worked in just one business.

Luisa is a single mother and has a 4-year-old daughter. She sells sweet bean biscuits and sweets depending on season. 

Jacqueline lives with her husband and has 2 children. She has a phone booth business she gradually did up in a place owned by her father-in-law. She also does printing and re-transcription.

Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline are asking for a 2600 soles loan to use their capital for purchasing merchandise for their businesses. Jacqueline wants to buy 3 units for her microenterprise.

loans.use: Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline are asking for a 2600 soles loan to use their capital for purchasing merchandise for their businesses. Jacqueline wants to buy 3 units for her microenterprise.

loans.name: Bourama

texts.fr:
This enterprising gentleman sells bamboo for construction and firewood.. He purchases in bulk and resells to domestic households. He would like to increase his inventory before the winter season arrives, when the demand for wood is very high. With this loan he will be able to considerably increase his revenue and support his family.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Ce dynamique bonhomme vend des bambous pour la construction et du bois de chauffe. Il achéte en gros et revend aux ménages. Il veut renforcer son stock avant que l'hivernage s'installe définitivement, à l'heure la demande en bois est trés forte. Donc aec ce crédit il pourra augmenter de façon considérable ses revenus et faire face aux charges familiales.

loans.use: Renforecement commerce

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Dame Z. Christine est née vers 1967 à Cotonou au sud BENIN. Mariée à monsieur BOKO Hyacinthe, un militaire à la retraite, elle a quatre enfants dont un seul est à sa charge. Elle vend en son domicile des poissons frits et fumés. Compte tenu de l'augmentation du nombre de clients elle a commencé par éprouver des difficultés financières. Elle sollicite donc ce deuxième crédit afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Christine Z. was born around 1967 in Cotonou, in the south of BENIN. Married to Mr. Hyacinthe BOKO, who is retired from the military, she has four children, one of whom is in her care. She sells fried and smoked fish out of her home. Given the increase in the number of customers, she began experiencing financial difficulties. She is therefore requesting this second loan in order to respond better to the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 drums of vegetable oil, 10 piles of firewood, and a half sack of charcoal

loans.name: Appia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Appia M. is a 28-year-old single woman with no children. She has been running a stationery business since 2005 and earns about 400 USD in profit each month. Appia is hoping to expand her business further to attract a wider customers base and is requesting a loan in order to purchase a binding machine, a laminating machine, and rent a larger store to accommodate her growing business needs!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for a stationery business

loans.name: Sup

texts.en: Sup S., 54, is married and lives with his wife in Battambong, Cambodia. Selling fish, he makes US$6 each day and his wife sells traditional medicine making US$3 each day. This couple has six children, four of whom are students and two of whom are employed. Sup S. is asking for a loan of US$700 to increase amount of fish he has to sell. He sees this purchase as a good investment to expand his business and he is confident it will increase his income.

loans.use: Sup would like to increase the number of fish he has to sell.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en AAHH. Teodoro Binder 1 Mz. A Lt.3, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja de manera independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa. Se dedica a su hogar y a la atención de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ½ saco de arroz, una caja de leche, ½ saco de azúcar, etc.

Norma se siente contenta porque gracias a la ayuda de Manuela Ramos su negocio será ampliado y tendrá la oportunidad de apoyar a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the Las Flores de Nuevo Eden (The Flowers of the New Eden) Communal Bank located in AAHH. Teodoro Binder 1 Mz. A Lt. 3, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 29 years old, has 5 young children that still depend on her. She is married and her husband works independently. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), Norma decided to invested in selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for 2 years.

Currently, she has a small grocery store at home. She takes care of her home and tends to her business. With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy 1/2 sack of rice, 1 box of canned milk, 1/2 sack of sugar, etc.

Norma feels happy because thanks to the help from Manuela Ramos her business will expand and she will have the opportunity to support her young children.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 1/2 sack of rice, 1 box of canned milk, 1/2 sack of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nasir Ahmad

texts.en: Nasir Ahmad lives in Kamari, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 35 years old with four children, two of whom are students and two are still small. He the owner of plot of agricultural land and is very hard-working. He has got three years' experience in this field. He wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy seeds and other materials to expand his business and to have more profit because he is devoted to agriculture and earns money through it.

loans.use: buying seeds and materials for his farm

loans.name: Isis

texts.es: Isis tiene 30 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su conviviente quien le ayuda en lo posible. Su dedicación a la venta de comida logró que implementara en su propio domicilio un espacio para su negocio, por la misma razón que sus clientes le exigieron que ampliara, y ella por su buena atención y sazón, se ganó el cariño y respeto de sus comensales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. Además, le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha sido puntual en sus créditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isis is 30 years old and lives with her four children and her husband, who helps her wherever possible. She is dedicated to selling food, which she does in her own home in a space made for her business. This is the reason why her clients demanded her to increase the space. Through her good attention and flavor, she won the affection and respect of her guests. She has been doing this activity since a year ago, and the thing she likes about her work is cooking so well that her clients feel satisfied. Furthermore, it is profitable for her since she is located in a good place. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has been punctual in her previous loans. With the money that she requests, she wants to buy tables and seats in order to give a better reception to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seats and tables for her food sales business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Totornasa, comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  43 años de edad, tiene dos  hijos, es casada y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela R. su primer préstamo fue  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra y venta de ganado engorde, también vende queso, y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar materiales para la compra de queso.
Con este prestamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles podra ampliar su negocio, invirtiendo en  la compra y venta de ganado (vacuno, porcino y entre otros), además ella desea invertir en materiales para la elaboración de queso (moldes de queso, prensadora, y comprar mas litros de leche), de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la economía de su familia; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a member of the “Sacuyo” cooperative bank in the Totornasa section of the Sacuyo community, located in the province of Puno. She is 43 years old, has two children, is married, and completed her primary school education. For the past year, she has worked with the Manuela R. movement. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles which she invested into the purchase of livestock to fatten. She also sells cheese, and feels very content because the loan helped her buy her product. With this loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles she will be able to expand her business, investing in the purchase and sale of livestock (cows and pigs, among others). In addition, she would like to invest in materials to make cheese (molds, a press, liters of milk). This will allow her to better contribute financially toward supporting her family. Likewise, she commits to paying her loan punctually in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase and sale of livestock (cows and pigs, among others), and she also wishes to invest in materials for making cheese (molds, a press, and liters of milk).  In this manner, she will be able to better contribute toward supporting her family.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Ruth is 32, married, and has 4 boys who are all attending school. She joined K-MET in order to work with her community.

Ruth is an onion seller in Kibuye Market in Kisumu. She has been selling there since 1996. Before deciding to start a business selling onions, Ruth was not working. She chose onions because they are an easy product to get. Ruth purchases her stock of onions by the sack daily from wholesalers in Kibuye Market.

Ruth has applied for a loan from K-MET of approximately $150. She plans to use the money to buy a larger stock of onions; the price has risen recently due to the drought conditions in Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase onions

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhony tiene 28 años, vive con su esposa Doris y sus hijos Alexander de 13 y Válerie de 12, en su propia casa. Desde muy niño sintió gusto e inclinación por los carros, es así que siendo muy jóven aprendió a conducir en autos de amigos y familiares, logró sacar su licencia de conducir y desde entonces se viene dedicando al servicio de taxi en el auto de su cuñado. Ya han pasado 10 años en los cuales ha trabajado incanzablemente en esta labor, sientiéndose muy felíz, ya que gracias a él puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, pero como en todo trabajo siempre se tienen algunos inconvenientes, en su caso, el auto con el que trabaja suele tener algunas fallas ocasionales, perjudicando su labor y los ingresos diarios; felizmente Jhony ha sabido lidiar con todo este tipo de problemas hechándole ganas a su trabajo, el cual es muy rentable gracias al esfuerzo que le pone, ya que sale desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. En el futuro quiere tener su propio auto, y así lograr mejores ingresos, pero también sabe que todo se logra poco a poco y con la ayuda de toda su familia, es por eso que apoya también el trabajo de su esposa la cual se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Jhony se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y promete pagar con puntualidad las cuotas de su crédito. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, para proveer mayores ganancias a su hogar, y en un futuro tener los ahorros necesarios para la compra de su propio carro.
texts.en:
Jhony is 28 years old, lives with his wife Doris and their children Alexander who is 13 years old, and Valerie who is 12 years old, in their own house. Ever since he was a child, he felt an affinity for cars, so since he was very young he learned to drive in cars of his friends and family and was able to get his drivers license and since then he has tirelessly worked in this job, feeling very happy because he is able to obtain the income necessary to pay for his family's expenses. However, as in any job, his has some downsides. In his case, the car with which he usually works has some sporadic problems, which hurt his job and daily income. Fortunately, Jhony has been able to deal with all kinds of problems, working very hard at his job which is very profitable thanks to his efforts, since he goes out to work at 6 in the morning and returns at 11 at night. In the future he would like to have his own car, to be able to obtain larger profits. However, he also knows that everything can be accomplished little by little and with the help of family. This is why he also supports his wife's job, which is selling beauty products. This is Jhony's first loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his loan on time. With the requested money he will invest in his wife's business, to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to obtain greater profits for their household, and in the future have enough savings to buy his own car.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his wife's business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. A. is married with five dependent and received basic schooling. Elizabeth is a supplier of palm nuts in Kotokraba near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1979. She supplies them to her customers who are mostly palm oil producers. Her husband is a nurse. Elizabeth uses her income to pay for utilities and the school fees of her children.

Elizabeth will use the loan to buy more palm nuts to supply to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Benny Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Benny Margarita A. P. tiene 28 años, es tesorera de su Banco Comunal, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió la carrera de técnica de contabilidad, carrera que abandonò debido a que salió embarazada y se dedicò a su hogar. Tiene 01 pequeño hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Benny tiene una pequeña bodega, cuando empezó vendía marcianos, luego se dedicò a la venta de mazamorra y cachangas (postres de la regiòn). Con el tiempo empezó la venta de golosinas que poco a poco fue ampliando con la venta de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y ahora tiene una bodega màs surtida.  Con las ganancias que obtuvo ha iniciado la venta de desayunos escolares, el mismo que le es muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de una licuadora para preparar sus marcianos (helados de hielo).
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y compra de útiles escolares para la campaña escolar.
Benny tiene el gran sueño de comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benny Margarita A. P., 28, is the treasurer of her community bank. She lives in Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She studied bookkeeping, but she left the career when she was pregnant, and she became a homemaker. Benny has a small store. She started out selling popsicles, and later started selling “mazamorra” and “pachangas” (regional desserts). In time she started selling sweets, and little by little she expanded her sales by adding ingredients for food preparation. Now she has a better stocked store. With the earnings that she had, she started selling school breakfasts, which is very profitable for her. She runs her business in her home. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Las Auroras en Acción II”, she bought a blender to make her popsicles. With a loan of 1200 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy ingredients for food preparation and school supplies for the start of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food preparation and school supplies

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan B. is 45 years old. He and his wife are farmers and their five children also work in agriculture. His parents were farmers, his only source of income has always been farming, and it will always be farming. His wife and children help him in the harvest.

Hasan sows tomato, cucumber, garlic, and other produce. At around 6 a.m., he's already in his fields. He sells his potatoes to cover the expenses but his other products are for family consumption. He loves his work but for him to break even and have a good quality crop, he needs to fumigate and fertilize at very precise dates. During this season they are sowing in great quantities, and with the help of this loan, Hasan will purchase seeds and fertilizer to help with the tilling.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Agricultrice très dynamique et courageuse, Mme Yawavi N. est née en 1967 à Adzralakopé. Mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants, elle pratique la culture du mais, activité qui lui procure les revenus nécessaires pour prendre en charge les dépenses de son ménage et la scolarisation de ses enfants sa famille. Aujourd’hui ses rendements diminuent à cause de l’appauvrissement de ses sols qui sont intensément utilisés. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les engrais pour fertiliser les sols en vue d’accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
A very energetic and courageous farmer, Ms. Yawavi N. was born in 1967 in Adzralakopé. She is married and the mother of seven. She grows corn, a business that brings in the revenues necessary for her to cover household expenses and the schooling costs for the children. Today, her crop yields are declining because of the poor soil, which is intensely used. She's requesting a loan to buy manure to fertilize the soil with the goal of increasing her yields and her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Cao Thị

texts.en:
V. Cao Thị (656060050) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community. V. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, V. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. V. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her third from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martina Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Martina Andrea L. V.  tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria tiene estudio secundarios completos, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo.
Martina se dedica a la venta de menús (alimentos)los cuales los prepara en su domicilio. Luego son repartidos a sus comensales.

El primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”, lo invirtió en la compra insumos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, menestras ,ajos , ají, rocoto, aceite , carne , pollo, etc     
Con este crédito de 500 soles comprará insumos al por mayor así como utensilios de cocina  que requiere su negocio.
Juana tiene como sueño, incrementar su negocio para obtener más ganancias y seguir con la construcción de cuartos en su domicilio para luego ponerlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
La señora Martina Andrea L. V. is 46 years old. She lives in the district of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. The businesswoman has studied secondary school, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in her care. Martina works selling food, which she prepares in her home. The food is then distributed to customers. The first loan of 300 soles she received from the Banco Comunal 'Las Emprendedoras II' she invested in the purchase of consumables such as rice, pasta, sugar, lentils, garlic, chili, hot peppers, oil, meat, chicken etc. With this loan of 500 soles she will buy consumables because they are the biggest utensils of the kitchen that she requires in her business. Her dream is to increase her business to be able to obtain more earnings and continuing constructing the rooms in her house to later rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of consumables such as rice, oil, lentils, pasta etc to prepare food

loans.name: Luisa Benita

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Luisa es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Luisa tiene un establo en el distrito de Chiara en donde se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuna y la producción de leche y quesos, además compra leche de los demás productores y lo vende a una institución publica.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina para el ganado y para la siembra de alfalfa.
Los sueños de Luisa son aumentar su ganado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Rubi Community Bank. Luisa is 38, married, and has three children. Luisa has a stable in the Chiara district. She raises cows and produces milk and cheese. She also buys milk from other producers and sells it to public institutions. Luisa needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy medicine for her livestock and to plant alfalfa. Luisa’s dreams are to increase her number of livestock and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for her livestock and to plant alfalfa

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn C. is the group leader of a four-member group who all live in Rolus village in Kandal province. She is employed in a garment factory and also raises pigs. Since her pig-raising business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to raise to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khat Nak, is a soldier. This couple does not have a child yet. 

Three members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. An EOT loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise to earn more income

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa Lilian A. D. F. vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo quien trabaja como transportista, sus tres hijos, su nuera y un nieto D. tan solo 12 meses D. nacido. Toda la familia D. Rosa trabaja para ayudarse mutuamente en las responsabilidades del hogar, y Rosa no es la excepción ella maneja su propio negocio ubicado en su casa en una tienda con productos D. consumo, rosa posee ocho años D. experiencia en su negocio y ahora solicita este crédito ya que desea invertir en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Lilian A. D. F. lives in Atiquizaya in the district of Ahuachapán. Her husband works as a delivery carrier. They have three children, a daughter-in-law, and a 12 month old grandson. All of Rosa’s family share in the household responsibilities, and she is no exception.

She manages a home-based business selling consumer products. Rosa has 8 years of business experience and is now requesting a loan to invest in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Elaine Gracc

texts.en:
Elaine Grac D. is from the village of Unidos. She is 25 years old. Elaine Grac is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Elaine Grac owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Elaine Grac has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elaine Grac joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elaine Grac has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Elaine Grac is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elaine Grac from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ever Bruno

texts.es:
Eber es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Eber es casado, tiene 26 años y 1 hija, Eber se dedica a la compra de ganado, sus compras lo realiza en diferentes ferias y los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Eber realiza tejidos en telar que vende en los mercados de Ayacucho.
Eber necesita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana y tinte.
Los sueños de Eber son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de lana y tinte.

loans.name: Monica Felicita

texts.es: Mónica  es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata, es casada, no tiene hijos, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con sus padres, inicialmente vendía ropa, ahora ha puesto una tienda de abarrotes, en la casa de sus padres, solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, leche, fideos  menestras y gaseosas de diferentes marcas, ella tiene una congeladora y quiere llenarla, el sueño de Mónica es que su bodega sea la mejor de la zona y este bien surtida y gracias a los préstamos que recibe lo va a lograr.

loans.use: arroz, leche, fideos  menestras y gaseosas

loans.name: Madres Unidas 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a 38-year-old borrower who lives near Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group Madres Unidas (Mothers United), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

Specifically, Gloria lives the Los Alcarrizos region of Santo Domingo. This area is one of the most difficult places to live in the entire Dominican Republic. Electricity is scarce, shelter is insufficient, and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Gloria successfully runs a small natural pharmacy. In addition to this business, she also sells some clothing when sales are not going well in the pharmacy. 

This is Gloria’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and with a successful repayment, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza so that her business could expand. She hopes that with the extra money, she can not only improve her business, but also save money for herself and her family.

loans.use: Natural medicines and some clothing.

loans.name: Azumi

texts.en: Azumi, fifty-two years old, is married and has six children. Currently, two of her children are in school and the rest are working. She is a trader and trades in clothes and different kinds of scarves. She normally buys her supplies on credit and pays back when the goods are sold. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to purchase clothes and scarves in bulk to enable her to reduce her cost base and to increase her income. She hopes to use part of her profit to purchase decent shelter for her family in the future. It is her greatest desire to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes and scarves.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.en:
This committee is located in the Barrio Santa Maria of the city of Encarnación. 
Each woman has her own independent business, such as: selling clothes, selling drinks, dressmaking, selling food, hairdressing, farming and selling fish, running kiosks and market stalls. 
The activity of each of the members is very important to their livelihoods, for example, Mrs Maria Lopez owns a small hair salon that she operates from her home.
