She started with very few materials and clients, and sacrificed a lot to improve the family business. The amount received by each woman varies from 300,000 to 2,000,000 Gs, which the women invest in their businesses and entrepreneurial activities to better their livelihoods.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en: Mrs. Sophan P. (shown in the photo) is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use in their farming business. Sophan, 43, and her husband, Mr. Mab Pon, 46, have been married since 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Four others attend school. Her husband is a fisherman. Sophan sells the fish that her husband catches at the village market. Beside this business, the couple also farms. They live along National Road No. 6 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for use in a farming business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Edna trades in food items such as corn dough, groundnut (peanut) paste, etc., and sells on a table at the market square. Edna buys bags of maize and other goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is forty-three years old. She is divorced and has three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Yaa works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader in utensils such as plates and bowls. Yaa procures the goods from Accra and then sells them. She also treks to nearby towns to sell on their market days. Yaa has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plates and bowls.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR RICHARD S. C. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO CON SRA. MARIA DEL CARMEN ALMANZA OVANDO, ACTUALMENTE NO CUENTAN CON HIJOS, SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ES LA PRODUCCION Y COMERCIALIZACION DE YESO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION CIVIL.

EL SEÑOR RICHARD S., ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN CASA DE SUS SEÑORES PADRES UBICADO EN LA ZONA OESTE A 23 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, SON PERSONAS JOVENES EN ETAPA DE CONSOLIDACION DE SU MATRIMONIO ASI COMO DE SU ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA.

EL PRESENTE CREDITO ES UNA CONTRAPARTE PARA LA ADQUISICION DE UNA CAMIONETA QUE LE SERVIRA PARA LA DISTRIBUCION DE SU PRODUCTO, CON LO CUAL MEJORARAN SUS INGRESOS Y SU CONDICION DE VIDA Y EN FUTURO INDEPENDIZARSE DE LA VIVIENDA DE SUS SEÑORES PADRES.
texts.en:
Richard S. C. is 22 years old. He is married to Maria del Carmen Almanza Ovando. At the present they have no children; their main economic activity is the production and sale of plaster for construction. Richard S. currently lives in his parents' home, located in the Eastern zone, 23 km from the city of Cochabamba. They are young people in the stage of building their marriage as well as their economic activities. The current loan will be used to acquire a vehicle that will be used to distribute their products. With this vehicle they will increase their income and improve their living conditions and, in the future, become independent from the home of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for the distribution of plaster

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas, 55, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. He started farming in 1985. Now he manages a 1-hectare rice field. He takes good care of two children in his family; the eldest is 21. He wants his children to have a bright future, that's why he works hard on the farm in order to provide for their needs.

He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, in order to take a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos. He lacks capital and sought help from CEVI. This loan will help in providing fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia E. is 72 and widowed with 8 children (ages 24 - 51).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Malia has 4 years of experience in this business.  Malia needs a loan of WST $1650 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Malia joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Malia E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen C. D. P. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, la cual está ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar con su hija Zulma P. D. 21 años D. edad. La señora Lucia posee una venta D. productos varios como ganchos, colas y otros accesorios más para el cabello, así mismo venD. juguetes como automóviles plásticos, alcancías, esponjas para lavar platos y otros productos más. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio en las afueras del mercado D. Ciudad Arce, lugar en el cual hay gran afluencia D. personas durante todo el día, situación la cual beneficia en gran manera a Lucia, ya que pueD. mostrar sus productos a mayor cantidad D. personas y su posibilidad D. vender es mayor. DesD. hace muchos años atrás que ella ha logrado salir adelante y criar a su hija gracias a este negocio, ahora Lucia desea poder seguir creciendo en el y D. esta forma contar con un mejor futuro para ella. Lucia solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, D. manera que cuente con más variedad para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen C. D. P. is 55 years old and resides in Ciudad Arce, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. There she shares a home with her daughter Zulma P., age 21. Sra. Lucia sells a number of different products such as clips, extensions, and other hair accessories. She also sells toys such as plastic cars and piggy banks, as well as dishwashing sponges and other items. Her business is located outsiD. of the market in Ciudad Arce, a place that experiences a large influx of people throughout the day. This situation greatly benefits Lucia because she is able to display her products in front of more people, thus creating possibilities to increase her sales. For many years, she has managed this business in order to move forward and raise her daughter. Lucia now desires to keep growing her business in order to have a better future.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can increase her inventory of products in order to offer more variety and proviD. better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ginette

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, A. Ginette est mariée à AHOVEGBE Désiré, un soudeur. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Ahito à Allada, depuis trois ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Ginette vend depuis trois ans, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Allada. Ginette a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Ginette désire renforcer son activité et augmenter son stock de produits, afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est pour cette raison que Ginette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Ginette A. was borin in 1983 in Allada in the Atlantique department. She is married to Désiré Ahovegbe, who is a welder. The couple has two children who are both in school. The family has lived in the Ahito neighborhood of Allada for three years. She and her husband both work to pay for their family's various expenses. To meet her needs, for three years Ginette has been selling plastic kitchen utensils in Allada. She has previously been granted two loans by Alidé, which she paid back in full. Ginette would like to strengthen her business and increase her stock of products to better meet her customers' demand. For this reason Ginette is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a wife of F. M.. They both live in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She is a mother of three boys. Her elder son runs an electrical supplies selling business. the next son works in a local factory on a monthly wage and the youngest son works in a private company as a computer operator.

Khursheed's husband is a government employee, earning a meager income. To run the financial circle she makes handmade decorative fans which have high demand in summer season. Her work gives her an income of Pak Rupees 10,000 in the summer season. This has become a great source for her family. She has successfully repaid her four loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase the electrical supplies (wires, switches, tube lights and bulbs) to expand her sons’ electrical supplies selling business.

loans.use: To purchase electrical supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen T. is a 46 year old married woman. She works very hard as a fresh fish seller inside the local market and typically earns around $3 per day. She currently has another financial earner in her husband, who is a building foreman. This couple is married without any children.

Recently, Sen T.’s husband received orders from some people to build their houses, but he cannot satisfy the needs of his customers because he lacks material to use for his building work. Because of that, Sen T. decided to pursue a loan for her husband to buy any accessory he requires.

loans.use: To buy materials for building.

loans.name: C5259 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Dancilla is the leader of this group which is called Abahuje in the local language. The group contains five members: most of them are women and only one is a man. Each member in this group has his own business. They are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses.

Dancilla is 41 years old and is married with four children aged between 6 and 18. She is representative of the group and sells foodstuffs to her neighbors. This is the 3rd successful year she has been in operation; her business is open from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Dancilla will use her loan to add a large quantity of foodstuffs to her small shop. With this loan she will be able to save money for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To add a large quantity of foodstuffs to her small shop

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como cajero en el supermercado Ketal, donde le pagan un salario muy bajo.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios y poder de esta manera mejorar su educación y acceder a un trabajo mejor.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Roger lives in his parents' home and works as a cashier at the Ketal supermarket, where they pay him a very low wage. The loan he is seeking is to pay for his studies and thus to allow him to improve his level of education and gain access to a better job. He is a client of Impro and is very good with making payments; therefore he is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of continuing his education in order to obtain a higher paying job.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo Cliner de 13 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de San Francisco, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Rayda, recuerda que todo lo conseguido fue gracias a la perseverancia de sus objetivos trazados. Desde hace 2 años trabaja en la venta de ropa, por lo que procura siempre de mejorar en sus ventas, con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ganar una cantidad considerable de clientela. Sin embargo no tiene mucho presupuesto para invertir en su negocio, además tiene que viajar a la ciudad capital para adquirir las prendas a menor precio y al por mayor. Normalmente ella trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo. Su punto de venta esta localizado en el mercado de su misma localidad, desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda de venta de ropa, con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, así como captar mayor clientela. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y oportuna, además asegura de sentirse cómoda con grupo comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en comprar mercaderías que tenga mucha demanda, para que pueda abastecer su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Rayda is a 32 year old single mother with a 13 year old child named Cliner. They live in their own wooden house in the neighborhood of San Francisco, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuhan jungle. Rayda says that everything she has achieved was a result of perseverance and remaining focused on her goals. For the past two years she has been selling clothing. She always tries to improve her sales and over time has been able to build a considerable customer base. However, she does not have much money left over in her budget to invest in her business. Rayda has to travel to the capital to purchase merchandise wholesale at a lower price. She normally works alone, but sometimes she has the help of her son. Her vending location is located at the market in the same city where she lives. Rayda works from 7am until 9pm. Her plans for the future include expanding her clothing store and attracting more customers so that she can improve her earnings.

This is her third loan with MFP. Rayda promises to continue her payments in a prompt and timely manner. She says she feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank and all the members always support one another. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise that has the most demand so that she can keep her clothing store well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: O. Nguyễn Thị (20211020030) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. O. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month. In 2009, O. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. O. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 2nd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** O. Nguyễn Thị (20211020030) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, O. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh dO.. Công việc kinh dO. hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hàng bách hóa. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. O. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, O. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, O. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. O. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. O. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh dO. cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh dO. của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel P. is from the village of Bayabo East. He is 38 years old. Joel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Joel is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Balimaya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya III est constitué de sept femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le sésame, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est  vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Balimaya III Group is made up of seven married women with an average age of 38 and 3 children, and most of them live in polygamous families in Missiritou, on of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow sesame, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and their previous loan was fully repaid. With this new loan, Oumou T. hopes to buy fertilizer, small farming equipment, and pay the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of peanuts. The harvested goods are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base composed of both men and women. They hope to make a profit of approximately 50,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe G. G. de 65 años de edad, vive junto a una sobrina de 25 años de edad, la cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, Guadalupe vive en Usulután, lugar en el cual ha habitado toda su vida. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, un lugar muy concurrido ya que esta ubicada en calle principal. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas, huevos, jabón y otros productos más. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Ella desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella junto a su sobrina, son las cuales se encargan de solventar todos los gastos del hogar, ya que Guadalupe es soltera y no tienen hijos, los cuales le ayuden económicamente es por esto que junto a su sobrina ella vela por el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 65 years old. She lives with her 25 year-old niece, who works selling various products. Guadalupe lives in Usulután, where she has lived her whole life. She has a small store in her house where she sells perishable items. Her store is in a busy area, as it is located on a main street. She sells milk, bread, candy, eggs, ham and other products. Guadalupe is asking for a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of items for her business. She would like to buy products that are used everyday in the home. She would like to buy a lot in order to improve her sales. Guadalupe, along with her niece, are responsible for all the household expenses. Guadalupe is single and she doesn’t have any children that can help her economically. It is for this reason that she lives with her niece. She is looking out for the well being of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products needed for the home.

loans.name: Annabel Catalbas Group

texts.en:
Annabel C. is from the village of Maras. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Annabel is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Annabel is just starting this business.

In 2007, Annabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan that Annabel has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lerio Group

texts.en:
Violeta M. is from the village of Looc Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Violeta is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lerio.

Violeta is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as pancit canton, noodles, milk, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Violeta has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Violeta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living and business situation. Violeta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Violeta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
This is Jasmin P., 46, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Restituto P., a driver, and mother to four children. By the grace of God, Jasmin has managed to pay for her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continue to send all of them all the way through college.

Jasmin oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have long (20-22 person capacity) and short(14-16 person capacity) jeepneys, all of which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Jasmin’s husband also drives one of the jeepneys. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for repair and other needs of the jeepneys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Jasmin dreams of being able to buy another jeepney soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

-Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater "jeepney", open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for repair and other needs of the jeepneys (public transport buses)

loans.name: Lyndamar

texts.en:
Lyndamar C. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez. She is 28 years old. Lyndamar is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Lyndamar owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lyndamar has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lyndamar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyndamar is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lyndamar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine raises crops, primarily planting & harvesting corn for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda S. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos Tulio de 43 años de edad es soltero, labora como vigilante para el Hospital de El Rama desde hace 16 años. Esta solicitando  su 9no credito con el objetivo de levantar una pared en su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  

Cabe señalar que sus creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para ir mejorando su casa poco a poco, pues desea  brindaqrle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles, pues es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Marcos Tulio, 43, is single and has worked as a Watchman at El Rama Hospital for the last 16 years.  He is asking for his 9th loan to erect a wall in his house that’s in poor state thus providing more comfort to his family.

It’s worth mentioning that he used past loans to gradually fix up his house because he wants the best possible conditions for his family since this is the only estate he’ll leave them.

loans.use: To repair a wall.

loans.name: Afansi

texts.fr: Elle est âgée de 63 ans et mariée. Elle a en charge  4 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des boissons en canette et jus. Elle fait cette activité il y a de cela 10 ans et achète les boissons à la Brasserie du bénin  et au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite, elle revend dans une boutique à son domicile à Adakpamé à côté de l’école baptiste.  Elle demande un crédit  pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: She is 63 years old and married. She has four children in her care. She makes a living by selling canned beverages and juices. She has been in this line of business for 10 years. She buys her beverages  from the Brasserie du Bening [a major regional brewery] and at the big market of Lomé. She then resells the beverages in a store located at her home in Adakpame, near a Baptist school. She is seeking a loan in order to   meet the ever increasing demand.

loans.use: Purchasing canned beverages and ingredients for making juices

loans.name: What God Say Group

texts.en:
This is a photo of the members of the “What God Say” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu B., age 24. She was born in Makeni, where she lives with her husband and their four children. Her husband is a worker in a medical clinic. Two of the children are attending primary school and two are as yet too small to attend school. 

For many years now, Isatu has been selling women’s clothes, trousers, “lappers” (a type of traditional wrap clothing), and so on. With her share of this loan, she will buy more women’s clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more women’s clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita B. is married and has one child. Rita is a hair dresser in Elmina. She also sells hair products. Her husband sews for a living. Rita uses her income to assist her husband in feeding their family. 

Rita will use the loan to purchase more hair products to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to build a salon. In this picture, Rita is showing some of the artificial hairs she sells.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: To make a living, Sheila M. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, South Cotabato. Sheila has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Sheila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo and snack foods. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like shampoo and snack foods

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years, selling at retail prices to her neighbors. In addition, she operates a vegetable business which contributes to her other source of income.  Asha faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Tambo Real distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La socia Ana Maria es mujer que busca el bienestar de su familia y aprovecha de las pocas oportunidades que se le presentan en la vida,  ella se dedica a la venta de leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Ana Maria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus vacas lecheras.  

Ana Maria pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 32 years old, has 2 children and lives in the Tambo Real community, Anta district, Cusco department. Member Ana Maria looks out for the well-being of her family and takes advantage of the small opportunities that life presents to her. Ana Maria sells milk and has done so for many years, and the business is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Ana Maria requires this loan to purchase feed for her dairy cows.

Ana Maria belongs to the communal bank 'San Bartolomé de Tambo Real', part of the Arariwa Association, and is thankful for the opportunity given to her. She promises to make the repayments according to the specified time period.

loans.use: To purchase feed for dairy cows.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet K. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is divorced and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Juliet has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Juliet sells her products at the market.   She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental houses   .

The main business challenges for Juliet include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to invest in another business. Juliet lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Adita Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre, esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adita, tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene seis  hijos, cuatro de ellos son  mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, todavía cinco de sus hijos viven en su casa.

Tiene un bar en su casa en el cual vende bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, además de bocadillos como empanadas, corviches y productivos elaborados. Trabaja  los tres últimos días de la semana con la ayuda de sus hijos desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00, nos cuenta que lleva ocho años con su negocio y que gracias a Dios le ha ido bastante bien y con el cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, aguas, cervezas y bocadilos. Está en el Banco Comunal tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que dan en la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, the members of the communal bank named “Women September 13" meets every two weeks. The city was known many years ago as the city of the royal tamarinds, for the great quantities of these fruit during those times.

Here we meet Adita. She is 48 years old and she is divorced, but from that relationship she has six children. Four of them are grown and two are 16 and 14 years of age and they are in school.  Five of her children still live at home.

She has a bar in her house and she sells alcoholic drinks, soft drinks, juices, beers, and snacks such as empanadas, fried fish, and other pre-made foods. She works the last three days of the week with her children's help, opening for business from 2pm until 10pm. She says that she has eight years in the business and thank God that it has gone fairly well. Through it she has been supporting her children.

This loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, bottled water, beer, and snacks. She has been a member of her communal bank for three years and she enjoys taking part for the support provided by the organization. 

Her dream is to have a large business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bottled water, beer, and snacks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria: es casada y tiene 54 años la socia tiene 6 hijos  de los cuales 5 de ellos son independientes y uno tiene 18 años es el menor de la familia y la socia aún le sigue apoyando en los estudios y en todo lo referente a la economía y lo moral, la socia  tiene su negocio de verduras ella cultiva también en su terrenos verduras, la socia también a su vez tiene animales menores, tiene gallinas, cuyes, y estos los vende en la feria, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cuyes para la venta. La socia compra animales menores, los cría, engorda y reproducen, la socia cuando alcanzan los animales la madures los vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maria is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  Five of her children live independently but she still supports her youngest, who is 18, with his studies, and also financially and morally.  Maria has a vegetable business.  She grows vegetables on her own land.  She also raises young animals.  She keeps hens and guinea pigs which she sells at market.  Maria would like to invest her loan in buying guinea pigs to sell.  She buys young animals, raises them, fattens them and breeds them.  When they are grown, she sells them.  She is requesting her loan to buy young animals.

Maria is very grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy young animals

loans.name: Jorge Israel

texts.es:
Jorge es  un hombre de familia de 33 años. Es padre de un niño y vive en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado en departamento de Lambayeque, en un hogar humilde pero acogedor, que forjó junto a su esposa. 

Jorge labora construyendo casas, es maestro de obras y gracias a su desempeño en el  trabajo, se ha ganado una clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Jorge ha pedido un crédito de  500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, cuyo destino será la compra de andamios y nuevas herramientas necesarias, que Jorge emplea,  para la construcción de casas. 

Jorge pretende mejorar la calidad de su trabajo para satisfacer a su público ya establecido y ganarse nueva clientela, debido a que éste anhela ganar mayores ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 33-year old family man. He is the father of one boy and he lives in the district of Olmos, located in the department of Lambayeque, in a humble yet comfortable home which he nurtured with his wife. 

Jorge is a master builder and he builds houses. Thanks to his dedication to his work he has earned himself a stable clientele in the region. 

Jorge has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to be used in the purchase of scaffolding and new tools. Jorge uses these items to build houses. 

Jorge endeavors to improve the quality of his work to satisfy his existing clients and to win himself new clients. He strives to improve his income to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new construction tools.

loans.name: Tuydi

texts.ru: Туйди житель Яванского района. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. А сын зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сам он более 18 лет занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи. Кроме того он сажает фруктовые деревья, то есть занимается садоводством. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Tuydi lives in Yavan. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. His son is a day laborer in construction.  He has been farming for more than eighteen years. Primarily he grows vegetables. Additionally, he grows fruit trees; that is to say he has an orchard. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz de 47años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 29, 13 y 12 años los dos últimos estudian en colegios fiscales. Se dedica a la venta de mariscos.

Empezó hace 4 años cuando salio del trabajo de la empacadora (jubilada), tiene contacto que le dejan mas barato el producto de mariscos. No tiene horario fijo pero sale a recorre dejando sus pedido a amigos y conocidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en compras de mariscos y materiales de construcción para vivienda. Desea ponerse un expreso, comprar una camioneta para ofrecer transporte con ayuda del hijo o ponerla a recorrer vendiendo verdes o frutas
texts.en:
Luz is 47 years old and lives in a peri-urban area of La Perimetral.  She is single and has three children aged 29, 13 and 12.  Her two youngest children are in high school.

Luz's business is selling seafood.  She started her business four years ago when she left her job as a packer (retired).  She has a contact who provides her with discounted seafood.  Luz doesn't work fixed hours but she goes out and fills orders from her friends and acquaintances.  With the help of this loan, Luz would like to invest in buying seafood and building supplies for her home.  She would like to buy a truck so that she can provide a transport service with the help of her son or use it to go out selling fruit or vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seafood and materials for building her home

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: El joven José tiene 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres, José maneja una moto taxi el cual es alquilada, aparte tiene otros ingresos por la labor que realiza como operario de construcción, los días domingos y feriados, jose cuenta con algunos ahorros producto de sus trabajo, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar una moto taxi, para que así le genere mayores ingresos, y pueda ayudar en los gastos familiares, su sueño a futuro es poder estudiar una carrera profesional para tener una mejor calidad de vida, José es muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindando
texts.en:
José is a young man who is 19 years of age. He drives a rented motorcycle taxi. José earns additional income as a construction worker on Sundays and holidays. He has accumulated some savings from his work.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of a motorcycle taxi so that he can generate more income and help with the family expenses. His dream for the future is to study for a professional degree so that he can have a better quality of life. José is very grateful for the trust that is being shown to him.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señorita. Ana es socia del banco comunal El Valle, vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos de su gente sale a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca y regresa en la noche, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.
 
La Señorita Ana tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa con sus padres y les ayuda económicamente, su papá labora en la construcción y su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar, la casa en la que habitan es propia siendo el sacrificio de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años y trabaja de lunes a sábado.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para iniciar con la crianza.
 
Su sueño es  tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the 'El Valle' community bank.  She lives in Zhidmad parish which is surrounded by vegetation.  The locals work raising animals and farming.  Many people go to work in the city of Cuenca and return at night.  They are very kind and charismatic people.

Ana is 25 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  She helps them out financially.  Her dad works in the building trade and her mom is a housewife.  They own their own home which her parents made sacrifices to acquire.

Ana works as a maid.  She has been in this line of work for ten years and works from Monday to Saturday.

This is Ana's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying pigs that she will start raising.

Ana's dream is to own her own business such as a store.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Souhad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Souhad has been a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer. She is experienced and well known in her area.

She is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy a small generator and to add more inventories. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a small generator and add more inventory.

loans.name: Melva Lucelina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Melva, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta buena relación tienen 6 hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos falleció hace varios años lo cual cuenta con profunda tristeza nuestra amiga, su hijo menor  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es electricista.

Nuestra amiga es una gran ama de casa que para tener sus ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años puso un negocio el cual lo mantiene  hasta la actualidad, ella tiene un depósito de gas en sus casa, allí trabaja todos los días desde que amanece hasta la noche ya que a cualquier hora a sus clientes se les termina el gas y acuden hasta su local y ella esta presta a atender estas emergencias, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio, ella va a comprar las bombonas de gas a la distribuidora general en Montecristi.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar gas líquido para el uso del hogar para la venta.   Ella es socia fundadora  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The lending group Maria Auxiliadora meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, an area known as the home of the ancient fighter Eloy Alfaro. It is also known for the famous straw hats that are recognized in and out of the country. 

Here we meet Melva, who is 51 years old, married and has 6 children who are all grown. One of her children passed away some years ago which left our friend with a deep sadness. Her youngest son still lives with her. Her husband is an electrician.

Our friend is a housewife who started a business some years ago in order to bring in some income of her own to help her husband with the family's expenses. The business, which is still going today, is a gas deposit in her home. She works there every day from dawn to dusk, since her customers may need her at whatever hour their gas runs out and they show up at her store. She is ready to assist them during these emergencies. Her son helps her with the business.  She goes to buy tanks of gas from the general distributor in Montecristi. 

The loan will be used to buy liquid gas for home use, which she will sell. She is a founding member of the lending group and she likes it because her partners are very united and responsible.

Her goals are to continue moving forward and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy tanks of gas.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina es casada, tiene 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos específicamente a la elaboración de playeras de diferentes estilos, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Decide solicitar un presta que le servirá ara ampliar su capital de trabajo, para la compra de material en este caso par compra tela para producir más playeras,  espera que en el futuro tener su negocio grande y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Paulina, 25, is married.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has two children who are in school.  She is a fabric manufacturer, especially t-shirts in various styles.  She started out in this work as an employee in another business and to date has 10 year’s experience.  Her husband, who is in the same occupation, supports her efforts.

She decides to request a loan that will increase her working capital to buy material, in this case more fabric to make t-shirts.  She hopes in future to have a larger business that generates better profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make t-shirts.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 46-year-old woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a scrap buyer and she runs a retail store to help with the family's income. The business has been operating for 10 years, offering commonly used commodities for everyday living. The family's monthly income from all sources is PHP 7,300.

In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC for an easy way to enjoy financial services offered by the organization.  Earlier this year, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to obtain additional grocery supplies such as vinegar, salt, sugar, canned goods, etc. All revenue to be generated from this investment will be allotted primarily for store expansion, in particular to buy a small-sized stock showcase to put things in order.

loans.use: To obtain additional grocery supplies to sell

loans.name: Prouen

texts.en: Prouen, 50 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer with $3 per day for his income. She has five children, three are studying and other two are working making $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $4 on electricity, $12 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children to use traveling to study. In the future, she wants to raise animals like pigs or chickens at home so that she can help her husband earn some money to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use traveling to study

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Tereza nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 62 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Tereza vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani los días domingos y tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Tereza requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como gaseosas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tereza was born in Paucartambo province, in the town of Quiñer.  She is 62 years old, widowed, and has three children.

Tereza currently lives in the town of Huancarani and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Tereza sells food in the main square in the town of Huancarani on Sundays.  She also has a grocery store where she sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, etc.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as soda.

The 'Once de Mayo - Huancarani' community bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and also because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soda

loans.name: Rina Patricia

texts.es: Rina Patricia de 39 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su hijo de 14 años de edad el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella tiene a  su esposo y otro hijo en Estado  Unidos los cuales de vez en cuando mandan un poquito de dinero para que pueda ir sobreviviendo, pero este ingreso que recibe no es fijo ya que su esposo no posee un empleo formal en dicho país y solamente manda remesas cuando puede.  Rina no es una mujer que se sienta a esperar. Hace tres años decidió poner una pequeña tiendita gracias al aporte económico de su esposo, en la cual comercializa diversidad de productos de primera necesidad. Es muy conocida en la zona ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer amable, luchadora y servicial. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para hacer crecer su negocio e invertir en la compra de variedad de productos como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, sal, golosinas, pan dulce y de más productos de tienda que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta manera podrá salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Rina Patricia is 39 years old and lives in the family home with her son aged 14 who is studying. She has a husband and another son in the United States who occasionally send a little money so that they can carry on surviving. However, this is not a fixed income as her husband does not have permanent employ in the States and only sends remittances when he can. Rina is not a woman who sits and waits. Three years ago she decided to open a small shop thanks to her husband's economic contributions. Here she sells a variety of staple products. She is very well known in the area as she is a kind, enterprising and helpful woman. She has taken the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan in order to grow her business and invest in the purchase of a variety of products such as: sugar, rice, beans, beverages, salt, sweets, pastries and other such products that will attract more customers. She trusts in 'Dios todo poderoso' (God the almighty) to get ahead in this way and improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as: sugar, beverages, rice, beans, salt, sweets, pastries etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 61 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling herbal medicines in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for a year and also earns an income from networking & rice retailing.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa is 55 years old and married, with 5 children. Willa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Willa has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine and raising livestock.

Willa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a hardworking business man aged 51. He is married and blessed with five children and two of them attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last sixteen years to support his family. In the next 5 years, he wants to increase the number of cows in his farm. Elijah dreams of becoming more financially stable. He has requested a loan of KES 100,000 to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr:
Céline est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 1 enfant âgé de 02 ans. 
Céline travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2004. Elle coiffe, vend des mèches et des produits de beauté pour tout client à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de  difficulté. 
Céline a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des mèches, produits de beauté et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir. 
Dans les prochaines années, Céline voudrait Augmenter le niveau de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Céline is a 29-year-old woman who is married to a welder. She has one child aged 2. She has been a hairdresser since 2004, also selling hair extensions and beauty products from her home. She buys her merchandise in Lomé. She works alone. For the time being, she is not facing any particular difficulties.

Céline is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions, beauty products and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) for resale. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Celine wants to bolster her activity. She intends to use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products and pagnes for resale

loans.name: Amany

texts.en:
Amany is a 20-year-old young woman, a university student.  Her family raise sheep and benefit from selling their products, which is the only source of income to them.  

Amany is continuing her studies and paying the university fees from the family income.  Amany wants to help her family increase their income by purchasing more sheep but Amany doesn't have the money to pay for this, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Amany gets the loan, she will contribute to improve her family income that helps pay her university fees.  This will enable Amany to complete her studies and gain the ability to change her family life for the positive in the future.  Amany is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep for her family's business.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old and is married. She has two children between the ages of 2 and 4 years old. Her business is well clean and good. She sells fish in the market. Josiane has three years experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business operates from 7am until 8pm every day.

Josiane has requested a loan from Kiva lender (via vision finance company) in order to purchase more, larger quantities of fish. With this profit from the loan, Josiane will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of fish to sell.

loans.name: Helga  Arlette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, célibataire avec un enfant, à l’arrêt de ses études en classe de terminal, elle monte un étalage de produits cosmétiques  qu’elle achète en  cartons et qu’elle vend en détail dans le marché.
Ses ventes sont de 40.000frs a 120.000frs et il ne cesse   d’épargner.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle veut renforcer le stock de nouveaux produits de lait de toilette, de crème de beauté,  des savonnettes, des huiles éclaircissantes, des défrisants et des crème démêlantes, des tissages et des pagnes.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une parfumerie et vendre  des produits divers et avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin de son enfant et de sa mere.
texts.en:
This customer, who is 42 years old, single and has one child, left school in the final year of "lycée". She has a display of cosmetics which she buys in boxes and sells on a retail basis at the market. Her turnover ranges from 40,000 francs to 120,000 francs and she is consistently saving money. With this new loan she is going to replenish her stock with new body milks, beauty creams, small soaps, hair lightening oils, defrizzing products, hair conditioning creams, hair weaves and "pagnes" (pieces of brightly coloured fabric).

Her ambition is to open a perfume shop and sell a variety of products; with the profits she makes she looks after her child and her mother.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, "pagnes", hair extensions and hair weaves

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a single woman. She describes herself as an ambitious and honest woman. She runs a retail store and sells home products such as sugar, salt, blue band etc. She has been in this business for five years. She was previously involved in farming. Her business challenge is the increased cost of items sold. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy home products such as royco, sugar, flour etc. In the next five years, Ann hopes to run a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more home product such as royco, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Emérita, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 16 años, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Tiene más de tres años de dedicarse a la venta de utensilios de plásticos, como cubetas, lavamanos, panas plásticas de todo tamaño. 
Su puesto de venta es en las aceras de la zona del mercado central de la comunidad, es un puesto municipal. Ella vende todo el día y todos los días. Su negocio ha crecido a mantenido un inventario más grande. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el séptimo y lo va invertir en artículos de plástico como tinas, cubetas, platos y agüeros para surtir más e incrementar sus ventas.
Espera seguir creciendo en su negocio para vivir mejor económicamente.
texts.en: Emérita, 49, is the mother of a 16-year-old son; she lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She’s been selling plastic utensils like buckets, basins, and other plastic containers in all sizes for over three years.  Her sales point is the sidewalk in the central market zone of her community; it is a municipal stand.  She sells all day, every day.  Her business has grown; she’s maintained a larger inventory.  The loan she’s asking for is her 7th and will use it to buy plastic items like tubs, buckets, dishes and other containers to improve stock and increase sales.  She hopes to continue growing in her business to live better economically.

loans.use: to stock her business with plastic items like tubs, buckets, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 34 year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 1 and 2 years old. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells grains, like beans and maize. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in the town centre and his primary customers are local people. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy five bags of maize. Nicholas's  business goal and hope is to expand his business to be stocked with at least five hundred bags of maize.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of maize.

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mony is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating cassavas and selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $12 each day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $6 daily. 

Mony is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for the expenses of hiring farm workers to cultivate the cassavas. In the future, she would like to expand her groceries store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: hire workers to cultivate her cassavas crop

loans.name: Darya's Group

texts.en: Darya, a farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 22 years old. She is a young mother of two young children. She is growing rice as her main source of income and she works as a labor for others to supplement income. She has involved her business for 4 years and she can save from her daily income about 5 USD per day. The insect has destroyed her crop, so she could not sell it in higher price. For Darya, this is her first loan with VisionFund and she is a group leader of two members to get this new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fertilizer to improve on her rice farm to produce good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business, so she can upgrade her lifestyle and keeps her children to school on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support on her rice farming to get good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: I have been running my grocery for one year.  This is my second loan.  With my first loan, I bought my initial inventory.  With those sales, I bought fresh food products for my customers. My customers are regular and I will now be able to provide them more items with this new loan.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow, 60 years old and disabled. She runs a fruit and vegetable stall near her residence. She has been in this business for twelve years now. Since her husband passed away it has been very difficult for her to raise the family. The business she runs is the sole income generating unit for the family. She is helped by her young son to operate the business - due to her disability condition she cannot operate the business fully.

Asha is planning to buy a cart and large baskets which will facilitate her carrying fruits and vegetables from the market to her business premises. Having this equipment can help her run her business with more ease. To implement this plan she is in need of USD 400.

loans.use: Purchase a cart, baskets and fruits

loans.name: Utuagiagi

texts.en: Utuagiagi has a strong history with the SPBD.  She is seeking her fourth loan, with the previous three loans having been fully paid on schedule.  She has used the SPBD loans to fund the start-up and growth of her fishing business, which is her sole means of support.  Utuagiagi lives in a small Samoan village by the sea and is one of the few female fishermen on the island.  Most women who participate in fishing industries do so on or close to the shore, but Utuagiagi takes the risks inherent in going out to sea alone in her small boat to increase her catch.  An additional loan will help Utuagiagi obtain the necessary supplies and repairs to continue to support herself via her fishing production.

loans.use: Fund continued growth of her fishing business by purchasing necessary repairs and supplies

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is married with 2 children, who are still in primary school. He has been operating his shop for four years, selling manufactured retail goods which he buys from Khatia and Sheriffs Wholesales in Bungoma. He operates the shop from Masielo Trading Center. Through his business he has been able to afford to send his children to school, take care of his family needs and support the community wellbeing.

Although he has many challenges, Protus's concern is lack of capital which is limiting his expansion of services, which he alone provides in the area. With the help of the loan of $75 from PEMCI, he plans to increase his stock and introduce new demanded commodities in the shop, which in the long run will increase his client base and earnings. He plans to build his own bigger shop in the near future at the local trading center.

loans.use: Shopkeeper, farmer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives alone in a house next door to her daughter's family home. She is a small dairy farmer and also grows the grain she feeds her milk cows. Part of her milk production is processed at PIL Andina (Milk Producing Plant) and the balance is processed as yogurt, as her community has its own dairy. She lives in the Arasaya area of Achacachi, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow her to increase milk production. This is her first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa vive sola, su propiedad colinda con la de su hija quien vive con su esposo e hijos. Rosa se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y al cultivo de forraje que le sirve como alimento a las mismas vacas. Su producción loacomercializa en parte a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) y la otra parte a elaboración de yogurt, pues la comunidad cuenta con una procesadora leche. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi – sector Arasaya (A dos hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca productora, de raza mejorada, para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chem S., age 35, raises ducks and sells the eggs, earning about $5 per day in revenue. Her husband works as a policeman, making about $1 per day. They have three children who are students. In order to expand her duck egg business to meet customer demand, she would like to borrow $750 to purchase more ducks to lay eggs. This will increase inventory and therefore increase income for her family. She will be better able to finance her children’s education with the increased income and provide her family with greater financial security.
