She sells personal care products (menthol, needles, threads, toothpaste, shampoo, cotton swabs, scissors). Her business is located in a small place, very well set up, in her district's central market, where every day she offers her products to her steady clientele, among which she is already well known. She tells us that nowadays her business is going very well. Her fighting spirit and great optimism helped her grow independent as a woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan she will purchase more personal care items such as menthol, multicolored threads, shampoo, toothpaste, deodorant, scissors, refreshing colognes and soap. She is a stable and hard working woman who is thankful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos movement has offered her to grow as a woman and small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal care items

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Miguel, de también 24 años y su querido hijo José de 2 años a quien desea dar una mejor vida.

Su negocio es la costura y su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza este oficio. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande, pues es muy responsable y sabe que cualquier tardanza podría dañar la reputación que con tanto esfuerzo a logrado. 
En el futuro, espera que su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Yaneth con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una máquina nueva, de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 24, is a young mother, who lives in a rented house with her husband, Miguel, also 24, and her dear, 2-year-old son, José, for whom she wants to provide a better life. She is a seamstress and her work is highly sought-after in her neighborhood because she is the only one doing this kind of work. She learned from her mother at a very young age and she now has her own shop where she very patiently takes care of her customers. What she likes best about her work is to complete the clothing items that they order from her; she has been in this line of work for 6 years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to work all day when she has a large order to fill. However, she is very responsible and knows that any delays in completion could harm the reputation that she has worked so hard to establish. In the future, she hopes to have a better-known business so that she can grow more. To accomplish this, she is willing to work very hard without rest. This is Yaneth's second loan with MFP. She is happy for the opportunity and knows that she must repay on time; she is willing to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for her fellow communal bank members, where she is highly thought of and liked. She will use the 3000 new soles to buy a new sewing machine in order to increase her production and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves A. is a 62-year-old married woman who lives in Nabantu-an, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Nieves’s husband, Victoriano, is 61 years old and helps his wife run the store. They have seven children between 28 and 45 years old. Some of the children are married with children of their own and most are working. Nieves joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1984 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Nieves is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 20th loan, in the amount of 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store. Nieves is working hard to achieve her dream for her family which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia tiene 48 años, es una mujer luchadora en todo lo que hace, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la zona en la que vive. Allí ofrece gran variedad de exquisitos platillos, pues tiene grandes dotes culinarias. Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta las 2 ó 3 de la tarde, que es la hora en que se le termina el menú; posteriormente realiza las labores en su hogar. Rogelia se siente tranquila y contenta con su trabajo, puesto que le gusta mucho cocinar, aunque no piensa que es una labor sencilla, más bien todo lo contrario, porque debe poner gran atención a toda la preparación de los alimentos; además a veces la visitan gran cantidad de clientes con los cuales no se da abasto. Para el futuro quiere mejorar su puesto y comprar mejores mesas y hacer su local más cómodo y llamativo.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rogelia con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ingredientes al por mayor, (arroz, azúcar, fideos) porque así le resultará más económico.
texts.en:
Rogelia, 48, is a woman who fights hard to get ahead. She lives with her two children in a house she owns. For 2 years, she has made a living selling prepared meals at one of the best-known markets in her neighborhood. She is an excellent cook and serves up a variety of tasty dishes. She works from very early in the morning until everyone finishes their lunch at 2 or 3 in the afternoon. She then goes home to her household chores. Rogelia is happy with her business because she likes to cook. She doesn't think it's an easy job, though, because she has to be very careful about how she prepares her dishes and, at times, the rush of customers is more than she can handle. For the future, she wants to improve her food stand and buy better tables so that her customers will be more comfortable and able to talk to each other more easily. This is Rogelia's second MFP loan and she was very careful before to repay all the installments on time. She will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of the ingredients (rice, sugar, pasta) because they are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old and is married with four children. He hawks (sells door-to-door) torches (flashlights), padlocks and handbags to commuters to earn a living. He is very active and works hard so as to meet his family’s needs. He has been in this business for twelve years.

Peter hopes to expand his business since he can access loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 10,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of torches, padlocks and handbags.

loans.use: To buy more padlocks, torches and handbags to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 56-year-old mother of four. She lives with her husband, their two children, two grandchildren and the wife of one of their sons in Alajuelita, a region located in Costa Rica´s central valley. Angelita is an experienced client of Fundación Mujer. Over the past 16 years, she has received numerous loans in various amounts to finance her sales business. Angelita plans to use the current loan to purchase clothes, shoes and perfumes, which she will sell to her clients in different parts of Costa Rica. The majority of her clients are women, though she offers products for men as well. Angelita does not drive; her main method of transportation is the public bus system.  

In the mornings, Angelita performs domestic tasks such as cooking, cleaning and overall house maintenance. After lunch, she heads out to either purchase new products, collect on repayments from clients she has sold to on credit or to sell her products. Twice per month, Angelita travels 3 hours by bus to an area named Guapiles to visit her clients. 

Angelita says that the apartment her family lives in is small for seven people.  At the moment, she is saving as much as she can so that one day, she might be able to buy a house in Alajuelita.  Angelita says her main problem is collecting money from some of her clients. She says she has to remind some of them that her products are ¨not a gift.¨

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia K. is from the village of Del Pilar. She is 46 years old, married and has 1 adult child.To make a living, Dionisia is engaged in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling copra and charcoal. She is also engaged in the agriculture sector, primarily in the planting of coconut and corn. Dionisia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

 In 2004, Dionisia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionisia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business . Dionisia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to redeem their pawned land. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Dionisia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: T o redeem their pawned land

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en: Ayobami is a hard working woman and she sells for long hours to support her home. She sells pop corn at retail prices to her customers. She is happy in her business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is 42 years old, married with 2 children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband also works to support their home. She is requesting for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more pop corn to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pop corn to sell

loans.name: Women's Wing Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Women’s Wing Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and educating them.

Mabinty G. (right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makili village in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children. Two of Mabinty’s children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools.

Mabinty sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables. She also has a small box at the corner of her restaurant where she sells cigarettes, mints, matches, biscuits (cookies), lollipops, etc. She has been a businesswoman for more than six years now.

With this loan, Mabinty will be able to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as rice, palm-oil, pepper, onions, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es separada y tiene 3 hijos, los tres son estudiantes, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la realización y fabricación de sellos didácticos para colegios, jardines y otros;   Nuestra socia trae parte de la mercadería desde la ciudad de Lima, ella viaja cada mes a traer novedades y venderlos en su tienda en manzana pata, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y comprar mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, ella aprovecha que hay campañas escolares aún en la ciudad de Lima.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “RENOVACIÓN” ("Renewal") communal bank. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Yolanda, and she is 44 years old. She is separated and has 3 children who are all students. Yolanda divides her time between her household activities and her retail business. Her work is creating and selling educational stamps for schools, day care centers, etc. She brings some of her merchandise from the city of Lima; she travels each month to look for new products to sell in her store in the village of Manzana Pata. She is requesting the loan in order to travel and buy merchandise in the city of Lima; she wants to take advantage of the fact that there are still special offers on school supplies in Lima. Yolanda values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Traveling to Lima and buying merchandise

loans.name: Bornohoi

texts.en:
Bornohoi B. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd, the western province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 1992, Bornohoi has been running a special order iron and steel production business with his wife and has gained much experience.  

The iron and steel products were successful so Bornohoi and his wife have decided to build a workplace in order to expand their business. They sell the products at the local outdoor market in order to attract more customers. They are in the process of building a sustainable business based on the experience they have obtained. 

Bornohoi says, “My wish is to purchase a container where we should make sales and complete workplace construction with the loan.” He is requesting a loan of 2,850,000 MNT in order to purchase more iron and steel from Urumchi, a border province of Inner Mongolia for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Rose Akinyi Ochieng

texts.en: Rose Akinyi Ochieng O. is a shoe vendor at Oile Market in Kisumu Kenya. She started this business after finishing her education in 2001. Her sister, who was also a shoe vendor, influenced her to begin the business to help her generate income. Since then, Rose has being working hard to expand her business in order to earn considerable income. She buys her inventory in Nairobi every two weeks. With the number of her customers growing each day, Rose would like to increase her inventory. She would like to get a loan of KES 20,000 so that she can purchase more inventory. She believes this will enable her to earn a profit that will facilitate her plan to expand her business. She is 27 years old and a mother of five (5) children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es: Nora Del Carmen tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Ella dio inicio por que anteriormente se dedicaba a vender pozol y tiste y con el paso del tiempo y ciertas ganancias decide empezar a poner ciertos productos, que son necesarios para el hogar y con sus mismos vecinos que llegan a comprar lo que ofrece. Sueña con ampliar cada día más su negocio y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Nora Del Carmen, 57, has had a grocery store for over three years. She is always seeking ways to generate funds for her family. She used to sell pozol and tiste (typical corn-based drinks). As she started to earn income she used some of her profits to include other items that are of home use and that her neighbors come by to purchase. She dreams with enlarging her store every day and to be able to make some home improvements. The financing is to buy stock items like: sweets, natural beverages, bread, cookies, detergents and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en: Vilayet N. is 50 years old and is the father of three children. Vilayet lives in Imishly city. He and his wife are farmers who own farming land to cultivate fruits and vegetables, in particular grapes and pomegranates. At the same time, Vilayet raises cattle at his house. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. So, Vilayet decided to ask for a loan of 900 AZN. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. With this loan he believes he can increase it to 500 AZN and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rita L.

texts.en:
Rita L.O. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old. Rita is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Rita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Rita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Rita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y lo dice con orgullo ya que gracias a eso se han ayudado muchas de las personas que hoy integran el Banco, y siempre le ha gustado por la seriedad como se han comportado.
 
Ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos todos son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su marido se dedica a labores del campo.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, en la cual vende además de productos de primera necesidad algunas medicinas y tarjetas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00, compra sus productos en Calceta y otros se los entregan en el local. Además prepara bolos (helados en funda)  de frutas que se venden como pan caliente dice ella.

Con este crédito quiere comprar unas vitrinas para poner sus productos.

Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en el centro de Calceta.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga parrish in the city of Calceta, an area where the people are dedicated, in large part, to farming, raising animals and selling their products, the Quiroga Community Bank meets every 15 days.

Nancy is a founding member of the community bank and she says this with pride since thanks to this she has halped many of the people who today are members of the bank and she has always liked the seriousness with which they conduct themselves.

She is married and has three children who are adults. But two of them still live at home. Her husband is dedicated to farming work.

She has a small grocery store in which she sells basic necessities, medicines and phone cards. She works everyday from 6AM until 8PM. She buys her products in Calceta and others are delivered to her store. Additionally, she prepares "bolos" (ice cream) made of fruit that she says sell like hot cakes.

With this loan, she wants to buy a glass case in which to display her products.

Her dream is to have a big shop in the center of Calceta.

loans.use: Purchase a glass case.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 20 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Her husband is a businessman. Rose is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, simsim, groundnut, and coffee.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide home necessities and expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell

loans.name: Serah Waithera

texts.en:
Serah has been selling clothes in Njabini town for the last three years. She is 28 years old and a single mum of two children.
Serah was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan as capital to open up a retail shop in Njabini, which she will operate side by side with her clothing business.
In the future, Serah hopes to start selling clothes wholesale to other clothes shop in Njabini.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Victoria De Jesús

texts.es: Victoria D. Jesús M. D. P. D. 26 años D. edad, vive junto a sus padres, su esposo y dos hijos D. 5 y 2 años D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Con el enorme deseo D. brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, es por esto que ella posee su negocio propio, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, su puesto se encuentra dentro del mercado Monserrat, en donD. tiene tres años D. dedicarse a este trabajo. Victoria solicita un préstamo con la iniciativa D. mejorar sus ventas, comprando ropa para niños y mujeres, ya que es esta la cual posee mayor demanda en el lugar, la cual ella desea aprovechar, con esto Victoria espera no solo mejorar su economía familiar, sino también poder realizarse aún más como comerciante.
texts.en: Victoria D. Jesús M. D. P. is 26 years old.  She lives with her parents, her husband and her two children aged 5 and 2 in San Salvador department.  She has a real wish to help her husband with their household expenses.  This is why she owns her own business in which she sells clothes for children and adults.  Her stall is in the Montserrat market.  She has been doing this job for three years.  Victoria is requesting this loan in order to improve her sales, buying clothes for women and children, as this is what is in highest demand and she wants to take advantage.  Victoria thereby hopes not only to improve her family's finances but also to fulfil herself as a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is married with a 12-year-old son.  As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three years.  Building her business, she would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her store.  She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other related supplies.  Ma. Luisa believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ma. Luisa has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her son’s education.  Through hard work and determination, Ma. Luisa is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other related items for her store.

loans.name: Rossana Judith

texts.es:
Rossana es una madre de familia que tiene 25 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector Cusupe del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola que situada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar artesanalmente carteras y canastas de junco, las cuales vende a los comerciantes de artesanías del distrito de Monsefú. Adicionalmente cuenta con un horno de pan que también le sirve como herramienta para garantizar el sustento a su familia. Actualmente se encuentra fabricando panetón y los está vendiendo a las tiendas de la zona. Estas actividades le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rossana desea adquirir material para poder fabricar más carteras, así como insumos para seguir elaborando panetón por temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rossana is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in Cusupe sector, in Monsefú district, an agricultural area which is fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Rossana hand makes bags and baskets from reeds.  She sells these to handicraft dealers from Monsefú district.  She also has a bread oven which she uses as a tool to guarantee her family's maintenance.  She is currently making panettones and selling them in local stores.  These activities allow her to help her husband to support their family financially.

Rossana would like to acquire material so that she can make more bags as well as supplies so that she can keep making panettones for the Christmas season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy reeds to make her bags and baskets

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry is 25 years old and single.  He operates a studio and does printing for a fee.  He started the business two years ago and has managed to employ one person.  He was previously working in a music shop before he opened his own business.  He dreams of opening more outlets for his business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy a computer and CDs.

loans.use: To buy a computer and CDs

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo Y. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. He is 39 years old. Carmelo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Carmelo has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carmelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos jóvenes, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y hot dog fritos) y caldo de gallina en un puesto que ha instalado en el patio de su vivienda. Esta muy satisfecha pues este negocio le rinde buenas ganancias, y ella empieza a trabajar con la ayuda de su hija mayor, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, de lunes a domingo. Manifiesta que a pesar que su negocio requiere bastante tiempo, pues alista los platillos desde muy temprano. Esta muy contenta con las ganancias que recibe, ya que le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para el futuro desea ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Zonia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varias javas de gaseosa, pues quiere surtir mejor su negocio e implementarlo con estas bebidas.
texts.en: Zonia, 35, lives in her own house with her two teenaged daughters, and together they make an effort to get ahead.  For the past 4 years this enterprising woman has sold “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and hot dogs) and chicken soup in a stand that she installed on the patio of her home.  She is very satisfied because this business has given her a good profit.  She begins working with the help of her oldest daughter at 6 pm and stays open to 10 pm, Mondays through Sundays.  She shows that although the business is very time-consuming, she has the food ready very early.  She is very content with the earnings that she is getting since they have allowed her to get her family ahead.  In the future she wants to enlarge the space for her business to offer better service to her customers.  This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments punctually so that she stays on the good side of those who have made her ability to continue working possible.  Zonia plans to use the money from the loan to buy some soft drinks so that she can better stock her business with these drinks.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to offer to her customers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios H. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 68 years old. Remedios is married and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Remedios joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.   Remedios is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham C., 28, resides with her family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. C. is a cleaner, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Her mother sells snacks, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 5 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more snacks and groceries to stock her mother’s store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and groceries to resell

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema is 26 years old and married, with 3 children. She lacks an education: She always wanted to go to school but wasn't able to do this due to her parents' poor financial condition.
.  
Her husband, M. B., has a milk-selling business. He gets milk from his own buffaloes which he keeps at his home.  He has a good number of clients in his area who purchase milk from him due to its freshness and good quality
  
Seema is an embroidery expert. She learned the art of embroidery from her mother. She takes regular orders from her neighboring clients and charges a very reasonable amount to produce quality work. 

The family lives in the small city of Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its dairy industry. Seema owns a small single-room house there and she has been living in it for more than five years.
 
Seema has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo which will help him to increase his milk production and to serve many more clients in his area. Seema is confident that with the loan investment, her husband’s household income will be increased and she will be able to send her elder daughter, who is now 6 years old, to school.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Parmois Ole

texts.en:
Parmois Ole is 33 years old, married to Nosokon, and together they have four children. He has been a farmer for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000. Having repaid his first loan in a timely fashion, Parmois is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated, he plans to pay his children's school fees.

An assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources, he dreams of being rich.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more modern tools and build up his business

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo con Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de repostería, además tiene un bazar ubicado en su casa. Los productos de repostería los realiza en su casa y posteriormente los entrega a sus clientes, ya que la mayoría son productos a pedido. Marta trabaja de lunes a sábado, vendiendo postres por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la producción de repostería, también realiza chocolates de diferentes sabores. Además de atender su bazar con artículos varios. Durante el mes de diciembre Marta participa de una feria, en la cual ofrece y vende sus productos. 
La mercadería para su bazar la compra en la ciudad de Santiago y los insumos para sus productos de amasandería los compra en distribuidoras y chocolaterías.
Con el préstamo comprará artículos para su bazar específicamente poleras, frazadas de polar, camisetas. Toda esta inversión para el día de la madre que es durante la quincena de mayo. 
Además tiene proyectado comenzar con el negocio de la producción y venta de huevos de chocolate para la pascua, que es durante el mes de abril.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido para vender sus productos y sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle una mejor calidad educacional a sus hijos y una vida más confortable. 
Marta vive junto a sus hijos de 19 y 11 años de edad, además de su nieta de 2 años y su madre. Ella es quien le ayuda en su negocio.
Marta se siente a gusto con lo que hace, realizada y útil con su negocio.
Además, está muy agradecida del crédito y apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, respecto a las reuniones Marta participa activamente, ya que también es la tesorera de su grupo. Con los talleres ha aprendido contabilidad, conocimientos que ha ido aplicando a su negocio. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Marta belongs to the communal bank "Creciento con Fe," in the city of Viña del Mar.  She has a business making and selling pastries.  She also has a store that is located in her house. She makes her pastry products in her house, and later she delivers them to her customers, since she makes most of her products to order.  Marta works from Mondays to Saturdays, selling pastries in the mornings and making pastries in the afternoons. She also makes different varieties of chocolates, and attends to her store where she sells a variety of items.  During the month of December Marta participates in a market where she sells her products. She buys the merchandise for her store from Santiago, and the supplies for her bakery from wholesalers and wholesale chocolate merchants.

With the loan she will buy items for her store, specifically: T-shirts, fleece blankets and shirts.  All of this investment is for Mother's Day, which falls on the 15th of May.  In addition, she has plans to start making and selling chocolate Easter eggs, as Easter comes in the month of April.  

Marta's goal is to have a place to sell her products. At the personal level, she dreams of  providing her children with a quality education and a more comfortable life.

Marta lives with her children, who are 19 and 11, her 2 year-old  granddaughter and her mother, who helps her with the business.  

Marta feels good about what she does, and her business gives her a sense of accomplishment and usefulness.  She is also very grateful for the loan and the support provided by the Fondo Esperanza.  Marta participates actively in the meetings there, since she is also the treasurer for her group.  Through the workshops she has learned accounting, knowledge that she has also applied to her business.

Viña del Mar is a city and community that is located on the central coast of Chile.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that are found in some of the older homes in the city.  In addition, it is considered to be the tourism capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, fleece blankets and shirts

loans.name: Elda Maritza

texts.es: La señora Elda Maritza tiene 8 años con su negocio de venta de mercadería en general. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en mercancía como es calzado, accesorios de belleza para dama, tratamientos, adornos y ropa de temporada que le está haciendo falta y sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga esta mercancía a la venta. Ella se levanta todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que tiene que realizar las visitas de sus clientes. Desea tener más variedad y estilos de ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Elda Maritza has had her business selling general merchandise for 8 years. She is asking for a loan to be able to invest n merchandise such as shoes, women's beauty accesories, treatments, ornaments, and seasonal clothes. She is lacking these products and her customers are asking for her to have it for sale. She gets up every day at 7 in the morning until 9 at night since she has to visit her customers. She wants to have more variety and styles of clothing to satisfy her customers and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to obtain merchandise such as shoes, women's beauty accesories, treatments, ornaments and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tule

texts.es:
Tule es una mujer muy organizada que planea todo lo que hace y con eso está logrando salir adelante al lado  su hijo de 18 años , del cual anhela  se proyecte  como buen ciudadano, miembro de familia, buen  trabajador, pero principalmente que sea siempre una buena persona   y conozca que cuenta con su padre y con su madre. 
Tule conoce el arte de la peluquería  y el maquillaje porque estudió y practica esta actividad en un punto de su vivienda,  en el cual trabaja para resaltar la buena imagen de las clientes que  atiende  y que   son damas, línea en la que le gusta trabajar porque ella es una experta en dejarlas bellas, Ofreciendo  los servicios de corte, tinturado y blower. Tule  logró adecuar su salón de belleza a base de esfuerzos, pues también se dedica a una actividad comercial, de tal manera que en su negocio las clientes encuentran ropa escogida por ella en su buen gusto, cosméticos, calzado y artículos que le encargan, porque conocen que ella sabe lo que  les gusta o necesitan.  Su mayor desafío es llegar a los clientes con los principios especiales  con los que ella quiere trabajar, como el respeto, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad principalmente. 
Cuando indicó su negocio tomó una lista de amigas y le ofreció un muestrario y aunque no maneja guías especializadas ella se las ingenió para comprar los productos que  caen bien a sus clientes y a un precio competitivo. Su meta personal más adelante es adecuar completamente su salón de belleza y tener vitrinas para ordenar y exhibir los productos que vende, ya sean asociados a su arte o accesorios que sus clientes necesitan, porque además  Tule brinda como valor agregado el servicio de asesoría en belleza a sus clientes porque su propósito principal es lograr que siempre piensen y decidan regresar.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que  Tule hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una vitrina, accesorios, secadores profesionales y mucho maquillaje para actualizar su microempresa y convertirla en punto agradable de encuentro entre bellas mujeres que quieren realzar su imagen personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Tule is a woman who is very well-organized.  She plans everything she does and is successfully getting ahead together with her 18-year-old son.  She wants him to be a good citizen, family member, and hard worker, but mainly a good person who knows he can count on his father and mother.

Tule is familiar with the art of hair dressing and make-up because she studied and put it into practice in her own home.  She works to make her lady customers look the best they can.  She enjoys her work because she is an expert in beauty services.  She offers hair cuts, color and blow-drying.  Tule was able to set up her salon through much effort since she also is involved in sales.  Her customers come to her to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes and other articles they order because of her good taste.  Her greatest challenge is to treat and be treated by her customers with the special principles that she works by such as respect, responsibility and punctuality.

When she sat up her business she made a list of friends and showed them samples, and even though she wasn't used to using specialized catalogues, managed to buy products at competitive prices that her customers liked.  Her personal goal for the future is to upgrade her beauty salon and have display cases to organize and display the products she sells, whether beauty products or accessories the customers need.  Tule feels it is necessary to offer beauty advice because her main objective is to have the customer return.  this is her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy a display case, accessories, professional hair-dryers and a lot of make-up to upgrade her small business and turn it into a nice meeting point for women who want to improve their personal and professional image.

loans.use: To buy a display case, accessories, professional hair dryers and make-up.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Desde hace un año Luis Antonio tiene una tienda y sus familiares le ayudaran con las vitrinas y un refrigerador, sin embargo el necesita ofrecerle a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Con  este negocio Luis mantiene su familia y  con el crédito el no solo mejorará su negocio sino que también podrá a ayudar a fsu amilia a tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio has been running a general store for a year, and his family will help him buying display cabinets and a refrigerator. However, he needs to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

Luis provides for his family with this activity, and the loan he is requesting will be used to improve his shop and to help his family reaching better living conditions as well.

loans.use: To supply his shop with a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 47 years old, is a farmer and fish seller with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have 6 children, four are studying. 

Every month, Thy spends $47 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy three cattle for doing farming. Previously, her husband was a soldier for about 15 years. The income of a soldier is too small to support the family, so he decided to stop being a soldier and began helping his wife to earn money. This family would like to feed eels to sell because they saw that their neighbor can make a good profit from selling eels. Her plan is to expand her new career, if it can make a good income and she can feed more cattle to sell. For her children, she wants to send them to study until they are able to get a good job.

loans.use: to buy three cattle for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Emila

texts.en:
Emila, age 42, is a farmer  living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She generates a total of PHP 3,000.00 a month from her endeavors. She has been working as a farmer for 20 years.

Emila is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to pay for the cultivation and fertilizing of her corn crop. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to extend her farming area so as to gain more income. Her goal is to make essential repairs to the family house. 

Emila and her husband have five children, some of whom are grown.

loans.use: to pay for the cultivation and fertilizing of her corn crop

loans.name: Heidy Marilu

texts.es:
Heidy Marilu tiene 23 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 4 y 1 año, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	PATRON SAN JUAN , se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad San Juan, sector Llullundondo, parroquia Guanujo, a una distancia de 25 minutos  perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Heidy Marilu se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales siembra en los terrenos de la familia tanto ella como el esposo tiene 3 cabezas de ganado, cultiva papas, maíz, trigo. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda en el mercado mayorista.

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos y semillas e insumos  de los cultivos e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la producción de los terrenos. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es ampliar su producción tener una casa propia para poder vivir con la familia. 

Le gusta las festividades como el carnaval y de las del Patrón San Juan, realizar actividades como visitar a la familia.
texts.en:
Heidy Marilu is 23 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children (who are 4 and 1) in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province.
The members of the loan group V.R.C. Patron San Juan are located in the community of San Juan, in the Llullundondo sector and the Guanujo parish belonging to the canton of Guaranda. The members work in agriculture and livestock.
Heidy Marilu works in agriculture, livestock, and raising animals. She works her family's land and she and her husband have three head of cattle. She cultivates potatoes, corn, and wheat. She buys and sells her goods in the main market of the city of Guaranda.
She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and supplies for her crops and to crow her business. The loan will enable her to meet her financial needs and improve the production of her land. She faces challenges such as the rise and fall in the prices of the products she sells as well as the abrupt climate changes we are going through. Her dream is to increase her production and have her own house where she can live with her family.
She likes the festivals for carnival and the feast of San Juan and likes to doing things like visiting her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy onions and potatoes for selling

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia, who lives with her husband and four children, has been selling cosmetic products and toilet cleaners within their village for three years. The profits have provided support for her family.

Ophelia, who hopes to support her children's studies until they complete college to ensure a good future, is requesting a loan of P25,000  to buy more products such as cosmetics, lotion, toilet cleaners and underwear for her business.  She also hopes to satisfy customer demand through this increased range of products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products, lotion, toilet cleaners and underwear for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, a 30-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where, for the last two years, she has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. Having joined HSPFI this year, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera  tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Inicio vendiendo una comida típica llamada frito, en su casa de habitación ,luego consiguió un lugar para vender en la  acera de un asilo de ancianos esto le ayudo a dar a conocer su pequeño negocio después fue que comenzó a vender perfumes y cosméticos y ropa de manera  ambulante en los pueblos aledaños a la ciudad de Granada. 
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería para vender tales como sandalias, chinelas de baño, cosméticos. Pues necesita mas productos para vender y darse a conocer como comerciante en otros lugares. Ella desea comprar una camioneta donde pueda cagar su producto a irse a vender a otros lugares , ya que sus pies se casan mucho de tanto caminar y un vehículo le facilitaría poder movilizarse con mas facilidad, aunque el sacrificio vale la pena pues su principal prioridad es tener la condiciones económicas que le permitan darle estudios profesionales a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and she is a single mother of a 10-year old boy. She is originally from the city of Granada. She started out selling a traditional food called "frito" from her house. She later secured a place from where to sell on the sidewalk beside a retirement home. This has helped her small business get known. Later she started out selling perfumes, cosmetics, and clothing itinerantly in the surrounding villages of the city of Granada.

She has accessed a loan to purchase merchandise to sell, such as sandals, bathroom slippers, and cosmetics. She requires more products to sell and to make herself known as a merchant in other locations. She wants to purchase a truck which would help her transport her products, to go to sell in other locations. Her legs become very tired from so much walking and a vehicle would facilitate her travels, despite the sacrifice. But it is worth the effort because her primary priority is to have the financial resources to provide her son with professional training.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale, such as bathroom slippers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie is married and has for the last 10 years worked very hard to support her family by selling various food items that she makes herself. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she needs to make food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more ice cream for sale. She will use her extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es:
Danilo hombre trabajador de profesión técnico de mantenimiento, propietario de su negocio taller de refrigeración. Sus planes es expandir su negocio. El ofrece su servicio a empresa privadas y a todo clientela que requieran su servicio a su vez compra refrigeradoras, frízeres entre otro que tiene algún descompuesto, algunos de segunda mano. Lo reparar y colocando en exhibición para su venta. Lo inicio por el motivo que necesitaba tener un ingreso económico para sustentar a su familia ya que las oportunidades de trabajo eran escasas. Actualmente prosperado gracias a su esfuerzo y conocimientos antes mencionado. Con el préstamo comprara repuestos de equipos como: motores, cajones, bisagras, pintura, cener, gas refrigerante, soldadura para refrigeración, compra de varios frízeres, bomba de compresión, tubo de bronce, alambre de bronce, entre otros repuestos. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su microempresa permitiéndole ingresar artículos de reparación. Obteniendo mayores posibilidades de ventas e de clientela en general.
texts.en:
Danilo is a hard-working man whose profession is technical maintenance. He is the proprietor of his business, a refrigeration workshop. His plans are to expand his business. He offers his services to private businesses and to all customers who need his services. At the same time, he buys refrigerators and freezers, among other items, that have some type of breakdown and some that are secondhand. He repairs them and arranges them in a display for sale. He began this business because he needed to have an income to support his family, since the opportunities for jobs are scarce. Now he has prospered thanks to his efforts and knowledge, as mentioned above. With the loan he will buy parts such as motors, drawers, hinges, paint, thinner, refrigerant gas, and solder for refrigeration. He will also buy various freezers, a compression pump, copper tubing, and copper wires, among other parts.

He is grateful to the lenders for their support of his microbusiness, permitting him to bring in articles for repair and obtain greater possibilities for sales and for customers in general.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator parts.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker for a railway company.  

Hong supports her family by operating a general store in front of the door of her home. She sells many kind of products including basic household items, sugar, salt, sauces, plastic kitchen appliances, sim cards for cell phones and personal use items.

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase more products in bulk for the upcoming holiday season. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more products in bulk for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah is 34, married, and has five children that range in age from 4 to 15 years old.  His wife is a trader, and all of their children attend school.  In 2000, Farrah established a furniture-making business.  He began his business at age 15, after his father died.  Without his father, there was no sponsorship for his schooling and because of this, Farrah's uncle advised his mother to send him to study at a carpentry workshop.

Now Farrah makes beds, chairs, cupboards, dressing mirror, tables, benches, desks, and other items.  He works six days a week, 11 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from his business. Farrah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy raw materials to make beds, tables, and chairs.  Farrah says a major business challege for him is that some customers will not pay in full for items they order, leaving unpaid balances that are difficult to collect.  He serves about 10 customers each day, and says his business is popular because of his quality production. He has two trainees in his workshop.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 230,000. In the future, Farrah plans to build his own house, to have a more business capital, and to see that his children are educated and have good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make beds, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Vumilia Self Help Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vumilia Self Help Group in Western Kenya! Margaret is the facilitator of the Vumilia Self Help group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia Self Help group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.
